In for a Penny.name: In for a Penny
In for a Penny.description:
A Region (Forgotten Lands) Adventure for

Level 7 Characters

End the schemes of the Shadowmasters of Telflamm.

Situation. Citizens of the Theskan capital of Telflamm have fallen victim to a massive speculation scheme orchestrated by the city’s powerful thieves’ guild, the Shadowmasters. The enraged populace is rioting in the streets. Meanwhile, Shadowmaster Delra Vael, at the heart of the scheme, gathers her illicit treasures and prepares to escape.

Hook. Telflamm’s city council, desperate to reinstate order, offers land, titles, and a 10,000 GP reward if the party finds the Shadowmasters’ hidden vault and returns the city’s wealth.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMinorIllus]{Minor Illusion}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplPrestidigi]{Prestidigitation}

1/Day: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplTashasHide]{Tasha’s Hideous Laughter} (level 3 version)

Tasha's Hideous Laughter.name: Tasha's Hideous Laughter
Tasha's Hideous Laughter.description:
One creature of your choice that you can see within range makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it has the &Reference[prone apply=false] and &Reference[incapacitated apply=false] conditions for the duration. During that time, it laughs uncontrollably if it’s capable of laughter, and it can’t end the Prone condition on itself.

At the end of each of its turns and each time it takes damage, it makes another [[/save ability=wis dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] saving throw. The target has Advantage on the save if the save is triggered by damage. On a successful save, the spell ends.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level about 1.

Uncontrollable Laughter.name: Uncontrollable Laughter
Uncontrollable Laughter.description:
has the &Reference[prone apply=false] and &Reference[incapacitated apply=false] conditions for the duration. During that time, it laughs uncontrollably if it’s capable of laughter, and it can’t end the Prone condition on itself.

At the end of each of its turns and each time it takes damage, it makes another [[/save ability=wis dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] saving throw. The target has Advantage on the save if the save is triggered by damage. On a successful save, the spell ends.

Minor Illusion.name: Minor Illusion
Minor Illusion.description:
You create a sound or an image of an object within range that lasts for the duration. See the descriptions below for the effects of each. The illusion ends if you cast this spell again.

If a creature takes a Study action to examine the sound or image, the creature can determine that it is an illusion with a successful [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the illusion becomes faint to the creature.

Sound. If you create a sound, its volume can range from a whisper to a scream. It can be your voice, someone else’s voice, a lion’s roar, a beating of drums, or any other sound you choose. The sound continues unabated throughout the duration, or you can make discrete sounds at different times before the spell ends.

Image. If you create an image of an object—such as a chair, muddy footprints, or a small chest—it must be no larger than a 5-foot Cube. The image can’t create sound, light, smell, or any other sensory effect. Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, since things can pass through it.

Prestidigitation.name: Prestidigitation
Prestidigitation.description:
You create a magical effect within range. Choose the effect from the options below. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time.

Sensory Effect. You create an instantaneous, harmless sensory effect, such as a shower of sparks, a puff of wind, faint musical notes, or an odd odor.

Fire Play. You instantaneously light or snuff out a candle, a torch, or a small campfire.

Clean or Soil. You instantaneously clean or soil an object no larger than 1 cubic foot.

Minor Sensation. You chill, warm, or flavor up to 1 cubic foot of nonliving material for 1 hour.

Magic Mark. You make a color, a small mark, or a symbol appear on an object or a surface for 1 hour.

Minor Creation. You create a nonmagical trinket or an illusory image that can fit in your hand. It lasts until the end of your next turn. A trinket can deal no damage and has no monetary worth.

Details.name: Details
Details.text:
A Region (Forgotten Lands) Adventure for

Level 7 Characters

End the schemes of the Shadowmasters of Telflamm.

Adventure (Import to Run): @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.adventures.Adventure.4CVRssHPnGpV3eJZ]{In for a Penny}

Scenes: @UUID[Scene.aifInForAPennyCo]{Manor House}, @UUID[Scene.aifInForAPennyDu]{Dungeon Hideout}

Situation. Citizens of the Theskan capital of Telflamm have fallen victim to a massive speculation scheme orchestrated by the city’s powerful thieves’ guild, the Shadowmasters. The enraged populace is rioting in the streets. Meanwhile, Shadowmaster Delra Vael, at the heart of the scheme, gathers her illicit treasures and prepares to escape.

Hook. Telflamm’s city council, desperate to reinstate order, offers land, titles, and a [[/award 10000gp]] reward if the party finds the Shadowmasters’ hidden vault and returns the city’s wealth.

Encounters

The adventure consists of these encounters.

Telflamm Is Burning. A character who hits the streets for an hour, questioning key rioters and petty criminals, can make a [[/skill 15 inv]] check. On a successful check, the character learns the location of the entrance to the Shadowmasters’ secret vault, in Telflamm’s sewers. Every hour spent on the streets, roll on the table below or choose an encounter, rerolling duplicates.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.tables.RollTable.aifEncTelflammIs rollable classes="caption-top" resultLabel="Encounter" caption=false]

Sewers. The party must pass through the sewers to reach the vault entrance. As they do, they’re ambushed by an @UUID[Actor.aifOtyugh0000000]{Otyugh} and three @UUID[Actor.aifSwarmOfVenomo]{Swarms of Venomous Snakes}.

The Vault. Use level 2 of the @UUID[Scene.aifInForAPennyDu]{Dungeon Hideout} map in appendix B of the Dungeon Master’s Guide, eliminating the east staircase and eastern chambers. Two @UUID[Actor.aifToughBoss0000]{Tough Bosses} and ten @UUID[Actor.aifTough00000000]{Toughs} move the accumulated wealth of the city from southern rooms to mine carts in the northern tunnel. When interrupted by the party, they begin combat.

Mine Cart Chase. Shadowmaster Delra Vael (Medium @UUID[Actor.aifSpyMaster0000]{Spy Master}) tries to escape down the secret exit in a mine cart loaded with plunder. Characters can pursue in carts of their own, resulting in a chase through labyrinthine caverns, eventually ending at the harbor (see chapter 3 of the Dungeon Master’s Guide for rules on @UUID[Compendium.dnd-dungeon-masters-guide.content.JournalEntry.dmgDmsToolbox000.JournalEntryPage.7zmKJrfgd9aTtzFp]{running chases}). A mine cart can fit one Medium or Small creature. A creature riding in a cart has a Speed of 60 feet.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.tables.RollTable.aifEncMineCartCh rollable classes="caption-top" resultLabel="Complication" caption=false]

The Ashen Faithful.name: The Ashen Faithful
The Ashen Faithful.description:
A Deity (Bane) Adventure for

Level 10 Characters

Stop an execution in a gladiatorial arena.

Situation. A group of Banites called the Ashen Faithful have seized the gladiatorial arena in Hillsfar to conduct public trials, executing those they deem unworthy or corrupt. Many innocent people are caught in the crisis.

Hook. Hillsfar’s senators summon the characters and ask them to infiltrate the arena and disrupt the upcoming execution of one of their own, Councilor Marellia.

Divine Aid.name: Divine Aid
Divine Aid.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplBless00000]{Bless}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDispelMagi]{Dispel Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplHealingWor]{Healing Word}, or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplLesserRest]{Lesser Restoration}, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

Bless.name: Bless
Bless.description:
You bless up to three creatures within range. Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target adds 1d4 to the attack roll or save.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

Blessed.name: Blessed
Blessed.description: Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target adds 1d4 to the attack roll or save.

Dispel Magic.name: Dispel Magic
Dispel Magic.description:
Choose one creature, object, or magical effect within range. Any ongoing spell of level 3 or lower on the target ends. For each ongoing spell of level 4 or higher on the target, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability (DC 10 plus that spell's level). On a successful check, the spell ends.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You automatically end a spell on the target if the spell's level is equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you use.

Healing Word.name: Healing Word
Healing Word.description:
A creature of your choice that you can see within range regains Hit Points equal to 2d4 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The healing increases by 2d4 for each spell slot level above 1.

Lesser Restoration.name: Lesser Restoration
Lesser Restoration.description: You touch a creature and end one condition on it: &Reference[blinded], &Reference[deafened], &Reference[paralyzed], or &Reference[poisoned].

Light.name: Light
Light.description:
You touch one Large or smaller object that isn't being worn or carried by someone else. Until the spell ends, the object sheds Bright Light in a 20-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 20 feet. The light can be colored as you like.

Covering the object with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends if you cast it again.

Thaumaturgy.name: Thaumaturgy
Thaumaturgy.description:
You manifest a minor wonder within range. You create one of the effects below within range. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time.

Altered Eyes. You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

Booming Voice. Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute. For the duration, you have Advantage on [[/check ability=cha skill=itm]] checks.

Fire Play. You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.

Invisible Hand. You instantaneously cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.

Phantom Sound. You create an instantaneous sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as a rumble of thunder, the cry of a raven, or ominous whispers.

Tremors. You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.

Spiritual Weapon.name: Spiritual Weapon
Spiritual Weapon.description:
You create a floating, spectral force that resembles a weapon of your choice and lasts for the duration. The force appears within range in a space of your choice, and you can immediately make one melee spell attack against one creature within 5 feet of the force. On a hit, the target takes Force damage equal to 1d8 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

As a Bonus Action on your later turns, you can move the force up to 20 feet and repeat the attack against a creature within 5 feet of it.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for every slot level above 2.

Shortsword.name: Shortsword
Shortsword.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]], and the target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the start of the assassin's next turn.

Poisoned.name: Poisoned
Poisoned.description: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the start of the assassin’s next turn.

Evasion.name: Evasion
Evasion.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the save and only half damage if it fails. It can't use this trait if it has the Incapacitated condition.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three attacks, using [[/item .jLa5l9pntsTVrMKH]] or [[/item .dL4668G7zXeC5zyY]] in any combination.

Cunning Action.name: Cunning Action
Cunning Action.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes the &Reference[Dash apply=false], the &Reference[Disengage apply=false], or &Reference[Hide apply=false] action.

Cultist Hierophant.name: Cultist Hierophant
Cultist Hierophant.description:
Gear: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.equipment.Item.phbarmBreastplat]{Breastplate}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.equipment.Item.phbagHolySymbolV]{Holy Symbol (Varies)}

Cultists

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmAppendixMonste.JournalEntryPage.VICfYukXoYkWJ1yn caption=false cite=false classes="no-embed mm"]

Cultist Hierophant

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmAppendixMonste.JournalEntryPage.s4D5OTWHOKhQcYwW caption=false cite=false classes="no-embed mm"]

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three attacks, using [[/item .mmPactBlade00000]] or [[/item .mmRadiantRay0000]] in any combination.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMageArmor0]{Mage Armor} (included in AC), @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplThaumaturg]{Thaumaturgy}

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplJallarzisS]{Jallarzi’s Storm of Radiance} (level 7 version), @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMassSugges]{Mass Suggestion}

Mage Armor.name: Mage Armor
Mage Armor.description: You touch a willing creature who isn’t wearing armor. Until the spell ends, the target’s base AC becomes 13 plus its Dexterity modifier. The spell ends early if the target dons armor.

Mage Armor.name: Mage Armor
Mage Armor.description: The target's base AC becomes 13 + its Dexterity modifier.

Thaumaturgy.name: Thaumaturgy
Thaumaturgy.description:
You manifest a minor wonder within range. You create one of the effects below within range. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time.

Altered Eyes. You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

Booming Voice. Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute. For the duration, you have Advantage on [[/check ability=cha skill=itm]] checks.

Fire Play. You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.

Invisible Hand. You instantaneously cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.

Phantom Sound. You create an instantaneous sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as a rumble of thunder, the cry of a raven, or ominous whispers.

Tremors. You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.

Jallarzi's Storm of Radiance.name: Jallarzi's Storm of Radiance
Jallarzi's Storm of Radiance.description:
You unleash a storm of flashing light and raging thunder in a 10-foot-radius, 40-foot-high Cylinder centered on a point you can see within range. While in this area, creatures have the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] and &Reference[Deafened apply=false] conditions, and they can’t cast spells with a Verbal component.

When the storm appears, each creature in it makes a Constitution saving throw, taking 2d10 Radiant damage and 2d10 Thunder damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature also makes this save when it enters the spell’s area for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there. A creature makes this save only once per turn.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The Radiant and Thunder damage increase by 1d10 for each spell slot level above 5.

Senses Overwhelmed.name: Senses Overwhelmed
Senses Overwhelmed.description: While in this area, creatures have the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] and &Reference[Deafened apply=false] conditions, and they can’t cast spells with a Verbal component.

Mass Suggestion.name: Mass Suggestion
Mass Suggestion.description:
You suggest a course of activity—described in no more than 25 words—to twelve or fewer creatures you can see within range that can hear and understand you. The suggestion must sound achievable and not involve anything that would obviously deal damage to any of the targets or their allies. For example, you could say, “Walk to the village down that road, and help the villagers there harvest crops until sunset.” Or you could say, “Now is not the time for violence. Drop your weapons, and dance! Stop in an hour.”

Each target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] condition for the duration or until you or your allies deal damage to the target. Each Charmed target pursues the suggestion to the best of its ability. The suggested activity can continue for the entire duration, but if the suggested activity can be completed in a shorter time, the spell ends for a target upon completing it.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The duration is longer with a spell slot of level 7 (10 days), 8 (30 days), or 9 (366 days).

Charmed.name: Charmed
Charmed.description: The target has the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] condition for the duration or until you or your allies deal damage to the target. Each Charmed target pursues the suggestion to the best of its ability.

Mage Armor.name: Mage Armor
Mage Armor.description: The target's base AC becomes 13 + its Dexterity modifier.

Shield.name: Shield
Shield.description: You gain the Armor Class benefit of a Shield only if you have training with it.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three [[/item .vTZW4dSRGXTDWvRd]] attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of [[/item .mmShieldBash0000]].

Shield Bash.name: Shield Bash
Shield Bash.description:
Strength Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=eIErvLccVVCXiCSl]], one [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=eIErvLccVVCXiCSl]] within [[lookup @range.value activity=eIErvLccVVCXiCSl]] [[lookup @range.units activity=eIErvLccVVCXiCSl]]. that the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Prone.name: Prone
Prone.description: If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Parry.name: Parry
Parry.description: Trigger: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] is [[lookup @activation.condition activity=aLG3BRZL7P6OEjwd]]. Response: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] adds [[lookup @roll.formula activity=aLG3BRZL7P6OEjwd]] to its AC against that attack, possibly causing it to miss.

Use.name: Use
Use.condition: hit by a melee attack roll while holding a weapon

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes one [[/item .mmBeard000000000]] attack and one [[/item .mmInfernalGlaive]] attack.

Beard.name: Beard
Beard.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]], and the target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the start of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s next turn. Until this poison ends, the target can't regain Hit Points.

Poisoned.name: Poisoned
Poisoned.description: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the start of the user's next turn. Until this poison ends, the target can’t regain Hit Points.

Infernal Glaive.name: Infernal Glaive
Infernal Glaive.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a creature and doesn't already have an infernal wound, it is subjected to the following effect.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=4qy3fKL086OAE1xR]].

Failure: The target receives an infernal wound. While wounded, the target loses [[/damage average activity=IS4utGV80LpDrjvt]] Hit Points at the start of each of its turns. The wound closes after 1 minute, after a spell restores Hit Points to the target, or after the target or a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to stanch the wound, doing so by succeeding on a [[/check format=long activity=KNWa0TFhANjmQCds]].

Diabolical Restoration.name: Diabolical Restoration
Diabolical Restoration.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] dies outside the Nine Hells, its body disappears in sulfurous smoke, and it gains a new body instantly, reviving with all its Hit Points somewhere in the Nine Hells.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three [[/item .mmIceSpear000000]] attacks. It can replace one attack with a [[/item .mmTail0000000000]] attack.

Ice Wall.name: Ice Wall
Ice Wall.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplWallofIce0]{Wall of Ice} (level 8 version), requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @abilities.int.dc]]).

Wall of Ice.name: Wall of Ice
Wall of Ice.description:
You create a wall of ice on a solid surface within range. You can form it into a hemispherical dome or a globe with a radius of up to 10 feet, or you can shape a flat surface made up of ten 10-foot-square panels. Each panel must be contiguous with another panel. In any form, the wall is 1 foot thick and lasts for the duration.

If the wall cuts through a creature's space when it appears, the creature is pushed to one side of the wall (you choose which side) and makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking 10d6 Cold damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

The wall is an object that can be damaged and thus breached. It has AC 12 and 30 Hit Points per 10-foot section, and it has Immunity to Cold, Poison, and Psychic damage and Vulnerability to Fire damage. Reducing a 10-foot section of wall to 0 Hit Points destroys it and leaves behind a sheet of frigid air in the space the wall occupied.

A creature moving through the sheet of frigid air for the first time on a turn makes a Constitution saving throw, taking 5d6 Cold damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage the wall deals when it appears increases by 2d6 and the damage from passing through the sheet of frigid air increases by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 6.

Frigid Air.name: Frigid Air
Frigid Air.condition: creature moves through the wall for the first time on a turn

Ice Spear.name: Ice Spear
Ice Spear.description:
[[/attack extended]].

Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. Until the end of its next turn, the target can't take a &Reference[Bonus Action] or &Reference[Reaction], its Speed decreases by 10 feet, and it can move or take one action on its turn, not both.

Hit or Miss: The spear magically returns to the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s hand immediately after a ranged attack.

Speed -10.name: Speed -10
Speed -10.description: Until the end of its next turn, the target's speed decreases by 10 feet.

Details.name: Details
Details.text:
A Deity (Bane) Adventure for

Level 10 Characters

Stop an execution in a gladiatorial arena.

Scene: @UUID[Scene.aifGladatorialAr]{Gladatorial Arena}

Adventure (Import to Run): @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.adventures.Adventure.58jUDix9FNAtiJPN]{The Ashen Faithful}

Situation. A group of Banites called the Ashen Faithful have seized the gladiatorial arena in Hillsfar to conduct public trials, executing those they deem unworthy or corrupt. Many innocent people are caught in the crisis.

Hook. Hillsfar’s senators summon the characters and ask them to infiltrate the arena and disrupt the upcoming execution of one of their own, Councilor Marellia.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.book.JournalEntry.aifAtlas00000000.JournalEntryPage.NUqLghT0DUX2sWgU caption=false]

Encounters

The adventure consists of these encounters.

At the Senate. Senator Arnulf (Medium, Lawful Neutral @UUID[Actor.aifNoble00000000]{Noble}), explains the Ashen Faithful plan to burn Councilor Marellia alive at sunset. The characters have 4 hours to prepare. Arnulf intends to stage a fake assault on the Banites surrounding the arena, drawing away defenders and creating a window for the characters to infiltrate the arena.

Infiltrate the Arena. The Ashen Faithful control the region around the arena. If the party is caught trying to infiltrate, they face a @UUID[Actor.aifGuardCaptain0]{Guard Captain}, three @UUID[Actor.aifWarriorComman]{Warrior Veterans}, a @UUID[Actor.aifPriest0000000]{Priest}, and a rooftop @UUID[Actor.aifAssassin00000]{Assassin}.

Disrupt the Execution. Ashen Faithful are preparing to burn Councilor Marellia and eight other prisoners (Medium @UUID[Actor.aifNoble00000000]{Nobles}), at the stake. Use the arena map below. A human, Faenzel the Exalted Flame (Medium, Lawful Evil @UUID[Actor.aifCultistHierop]{Cultist Hierophant}), exhorts followers in the stands from the northern skybox as two @UUID[Actor.aifGladiator0000]{Gladiators} prepare prisoners in the middle of the arena. Three @UUID[Actor.aifBeardedDevil0]{Bearded Devils} also stand guard in the arena. If the party defeats the enemies on the arena floor, Faenzel intervenes, joined by two more @UUID[Actor.aifGladiator0000]{Gladiators} from beneath the arena.

Arena Dangers. The arena floor has six spiked pits (see chapter 3 of the Dungeon Master’s Guide), and the wall is studded with jagged iron spikes that prevent creatures from climbing out. Casks of lamp oil and wooden kindling are staged around the prisoners.

Escape with Councilor Marellia. Should the party flee with Marellia and other prisoners, cultists in another skybox complete a ritual summoning an @UUID[Actor.aifIceDevil00000]{Ice Devil} that chases them through the city.

Conclusion. If the characters successfully rescue Councilor Marellia, she rewards them with jeweled treasures worth a total of [[/award 3000gp]].

Foundry Note

  1. While hard to see, Councilor Marellia and the other prisoners are pre-placed on each of the fire pits.

  2. Faenzel the Exalted Flame and two gladiators are hidden and pre-placed north of the fire pits on a platform.

  3. The Ice Devil is not pre-placed on the scene.

Disinterred Danger.name: Disinterred Danger
Disinterred Danger.description:
A Faction (Harpers) Adventure for

Level 4 Characters

Recover dangerous treasures hidden by the Harpers.

Situation. After a battle long ago, Harpers sealed cursed magic items in a false tomb. The Zhentarim has found the site’s location.

Hook. Folavani Ladril, a wood elf scout and Harper, tried to defend the tomb but had to flee. Exhausted and due to report to her leaders, she asks the characters to go to the tomb and bring back the cursed items.

Incorporeal Movement.name: Incorporeal Movement
Incorporeal Movement.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can move through other creatures and objects as if they were &Reference[Difficult Terrain]. It takes [[/damage 1d10 average type=force]] damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

Sunlight Sensitivity.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
Sunlight Sensitivity.description: While in sunlight, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

Life Drain.name: Life Drain
Life Drain.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a creature, its Hit Point maximum decreases by an amount equal to the damage taken.

Create Specter.name: Create Specter
Create Specter.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] targets a Humanoid corpse within [[lookup @range.value activity=ypIQdXr13u7LATUP]] feet of itself that has been dead for no longer than 1 minute. The target's spirit rises as a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.aifSpecter000000]{Specter} in the space of its corpse or in the nearest unoccupied space. The specter is under the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s control. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can have no more than seven specters under its control at a time.

Swarm.name: Swarm
Swarm.description: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny creature. The swarm can't regain Hit Points or gain Temporary Hit Points.

Swarm of Grasping Hands.name: Swarm of Grasping Hands
Swarm of Grasping Hands.description: [[/attack extended activity=rO8NirkWF6w9GXTc]]. [[/damage average extended activity=rO8NirkWF6w9GXTc]], or [[/damage average activity=hzeHzcSKHC4AvIJQ]] damage if [[lookup @activation.condition activity=hzeHzcSKHC4AvIJQ]]. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Prone.name: Prone
Prone.description: If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Crawling Claw.name: Crawling Claw
Crawling Claw.description:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmAppendixMonste.JournalEntryPage.g2nO7BdHr87x4LcU caption=false cite=false classes="no-embed mm"]

Crawling Claw

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmAppendixMonste.JournalEntryPage.qVzJYYgD5qGPzC5T caption=false cite=false classes="no-embed mm"]

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two attacks, using [[/item .mmClaw0000000000]] or [[/item .mmFireRay0000000]] in any combination.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

2/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplAlterSelf0]{Alter Self}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplCommand000]{Command} (level 3 version), @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectMagi]{Detect Magic}

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDominatePe]{Dominate Person} (level 8 version), @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplPlaneShift]{Plane Shift} (self only)

Alter Self.name: Alter Self
Alter Self.description:
You alter your physical form. Choose one of the following options. Its effects last for the duration, during which you can take a Magic action to replace the option you chose with a different one.

Aquatic Adaptation. You sprout gills and grow webs between your fingers. You can breathe underwater and gain a Swim Speed equal to your Speed.

Foundry Note

The Active Effect provided by the Aquatic Adaptation activity upgrades the character's Swim Speed to a value of "1" to indicate equivalence to (walk) Speed.

Change Appearance. You alter your appearance. You decide what you look like, including your height, weight, facial features, sound of your voice, hair length, coloration, and other distinguishing characteristics. You can make yourself appear as a member of another species, though none of your statistics change. You can’t appear as a creature of a different size, and your basic shape stays the same; if you’re bipedal, you can’t use this spell to become quadrupedal, for instance. For the duration, you can take a Magic action to change your appearance in this way again.

Natural Weapons. You grow claws (Slashing), fangs (Piercing), horns (Piercing), or hooves (Bludgeoning). When you use your Unarmed Strike to deal damage with that new growth, it deals 1d6 damage of the type in parentheses instead of dealing the normal damage for your Unarmed Strike, and you use your spellcasting ability modifier for the attack and damage rolls rather than using Strength.

Aquatic Adaptation.name: Aquatic Adaptation
Aquatic Adaptation.description: You can breathe underwater and gain a Swim Speed equal to your Speed.

Natural Weapon.name: Natural Weapon
Natural Weapon.description: When you use your Unarmed Strike to deal damage with that new growth, it deals 1d6 damage of the type in parentheses instead of dealing the normal damage for your Unarmed Strike, and you use your spellcasting ability modifier for the attack and damage rolls rather than using Strength.

Command.name: Command
Command.description:
You speak a one-word command to a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or follow the command on its next turn. Choose the command from these options:

Approach. The target moves toward you by the shortest and most direct route, ending its turn if it moves within 5 feet of you.

Drop. The target drops whatever it is holding and then ends its turn.

Flee. The target spends its turn moving away from you by the fastest available means.

Grovel. The target has the Prone condition and then ends its turn.

Halt. On its turn, the target doesn’t move and takes no action or Bonus Action.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can affect one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell’s school of magic.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Dominate Person.name: Dominate Person
Dominate Person.description:
One Humanoid you can see within range must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] condition for the duration. The target has Advantage on the save if you or your allies are fighting it. Whenever the target takes damage, it repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

You have a telepathic link with the Charmed target while the two of you are on the same plane of existence. On your turn, you can use this link to issue commands to the target (no action required), such as “Attack that creature,” “Move over there,” or “Fetch that object.” The target does its best to obey on its turn. If it completes an order and doesn’t receive further direction from you, it acts and moves as it likes, focusing on protecting itself.

You can command the target to take a Reaction but must take your own Reaction to do so.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. Your Concentration can last longer with a spell slot of level 6 (up to 10 minutes), 7 (up to 1 hour), or 8+ (up to 8 hours).

Dominated.name: Dominated
Dominated.description: Whenever the &Reference[charmed apply=false] target takes damage, it repeats the [[/save ability=wis]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Plane Shift.name: Plane Shift
Plane Shift.description:
You and up to eight willing creatures who link hands in a circle are transported to a different plane of existence. You can specify a target destination in general terms, such as the City of Brass on the Elemental Plane of Fire or the palace of Dispater on the second level of the Nine Hells, and you appear in or near that destination, as determined by the DM.

Alternatively, if you know the sigil sequence of a teleportation circle on another plane of existence, this spell can take you to that circle. If the teleportation circle is too small to hold all the creatures you transported, they appear in the closest unoccupied spaces next to the circle.

materials.value: a forked, metal rod worth 250+ GP and attuned to a plane of existence

affects.special: you and up to eight willing creatures

Fire-Casting Statue.name: Fire-Casting Statue
Fire-Casting Statue.description:
Deadly Trap (Levels 1–4)

Trigger: A creature moves onto a pressure plate

Duration: Instantaneous, and the trap resets at the start of the next turn

When a creature moves onto this trap's pressure plate for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, a nearby statue exhales a 15-foot Cone of magical flame. The statue can look like anything, such as a dragon or a wizard. Each creature in the Cone must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 11 (2d10) Fire damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Detect and Disarm. A Detect Magic spell reveals an aura of Evocation magic around the statue. As a Search action, a creature within 5 feet of the statue can examine it and make a [[/check DC prc 10]] check, detecting a tiny glyph on the statue on a successful check. Once the glyph is found, a character can take a Study action to examine it and make a [[/check arc 15]] check, ascertaining that the glyph means "fire" on a successful check. As an action, a character can use a sharp tool to deface the glyph, which disarms the trap.

As a Search action, a creature can examine the section of floor that forms the pressure plate and make a [[/check prc 15]] check, detecting the pressure plate on a successful check. Wedging an Iron Spike or similar object under the pressure plate prevents the trap from triggering.

At Higher Levels. You can scale the trap for higher levels by increasing the damage and the area of effect, as shown in the following table.

Levels

Fire Damage

Area of Effect

5–10

22 (4d10)

30-foot Cone

11–16

55 (10d10)

60-foot Cone

17–20

99 (18d10)

120-foot Cone

Details.name: Details
Details.text:
A Faction (Harpers) Adventure for

Level 4 Characters

Recover dangerous treasures hidden by the Harpers.

Scene: @UUID[Scene.aifFalseTomb0000]{False Tomb}

Adventure (Import to Run): @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.adventures.Adventure.6pfjumZXnf0LldtJ]{Disinterred Danger}

Situation. After a battle long ago, Harpers sealed cursed magic items in a false tomb. The Zhentarim has found the site’s location.

Hook. Folavani Ladril, a wood elf scout and Harper, tried to defend the tomb but had to flee. Exhausted and due to report to her leaders, she asks the characters to go to the tomb and bring back the cursed items.

Encounters

The adventure consists of these encounters.

Site Features. The site, its magic weakened but unbroken, has endured more than a century. Harpers left various clues in each area; a character who takes a &Reference[Study] action and succeeds on a [[/skill 13 history]] check recognizes a Harper clue’s meaning.

Entryway. Zhents found the tomb, its door hidden in a small cave. Signs of an explosion (caused by a discharged @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplGlyphofWar]{Glyph of Warding} spell) mar the cave and the broken doorway, once carved as a graceful tree. Zhentarim corpses lie scattered on the floor. A @UUID[Actor.aifWraith0000000]{Wraith} drifts out of the tomb and initiates combat.

Nethertide Leavings. Orc equipment and bones form a pile near a bronze floor plate that reads, in Common, “Along Selûne’s path they did walk, leaving no stone unturned.” This is a Harper clue, and a character who recognizes it knows it refers to “Moonlight Paean,” a famous ballad. A character who recites the ballad causes silver light to bathe the chamber, revealing a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.dmgShieldOfMissi]{Shield of Missile Attraction} and a @UUID[Compendium.dnd-dungeon-masters-guide.equipment.Item.dmgSwordOfVengea]{Sword of Vengeance} lying among the bones. Other treasures and art objects here amount to a CR 4 random treasure hoard. Disturbing these items without first reciting the ballad causes bones to animate and ambush the characters (two @UUID[Actor.aifSwarmOfCrawli]{Swarms of Crawling Claws} and seven @UUID[Actor.aifCrawlingClaw0]{Crawling Claws}).

Silver Light

A Light is pre-placed in the Scene and can be toggled to bathe the room in silver light.

Dragon Statue. Two pressure plates trigger this @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.dmgFirecastingSt]{fire-casting statue} (see @UUID[Compendium.dnd-dungeon-masters-guide.content.JournalEntry.dmgDmsToolbox000.JournalEntryPage.RLB1MPQRqYDR0CtI#fire-casting-statue]{chapter 3} of the Dungeon Master’s Guide). A wall carving of a musician playing, notes issuing from his lute while he dances around the statue, is a Harper clue. Characters who recognize it know the tune depicted: “Coggin’s Reel.” Playing or humming this tune disarms the trap.

Tomb. This stone coffin is locked with the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplArcaneLock]{Arcane Lock} spell. Its lid reads, in Elvish, “To shine a light on the future.” This is a Harper clue. A character who recognizes it knows the response: “Study the past.” This phrase is the password for the arcane lock. Within the coffin is @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.dmgDemonArmor000]{Demon Armor} that animates and fights; use the stat block for a @UUID[Actor.aifCambion000000]{Cambion}. If the proper phrase was spoken, the armor starts the combat &Reference[Bloodied].

Conclusion. Folavani helps remove curses from cursed characters. Each character’s Renown Score with the Harpers increases by 1.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.book.JournalEntry.aifAtlas00000000.JournalEntryPage.lvqUg0FJhOgFjuHD caption=false]

Retaking the Terror.name: Retaking the Terror
Retaking the Terror.description:
A Location (Icewind Dale) Adventure for

Level 4 Characters

Explore the corpse of a Charalyn dragon.

Situation. An unorthodox high elf cleric of Ilmater at Revel’s End named Vargrazt the Wretch (Medium, Lawful Good Priest) offers to purge the chardalyn dragon remains in Easthaven of their diabolical power—the so-called Terror of Ten-Towns—via a ritual.

Hook. Therandril, a mage in Easthaven, hires the characters to retrieve Vargratz from Revel’s End and help him in his mission.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability:

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplLight00000]{Light}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplThaumaturg]{Thaumaturgy}

1/Day: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplSpiritGuar]{Spirit Guardians}

Divine Aid.name: Divine Aid
Divine Aid.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplBless00000]{Bless}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDispelMagi]{Dispel Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplHealingWor]{Healing Word}, or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplLesserRest]{Lesser Restoration}, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

Bless.name: Bless
Bless.description:
You bless up to three creatures within range. Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target adds 1d4 to the attack roll or save.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

Blessed.name: Blessed
Blessed.description: Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target adds 1d4 to the attack roll or save.

Dispel Magic.name: Dispel Magic
Dispel Magic.description:
Choose one creature, object, or magical effect within range. Any ongoing spell of level 3 or lower on the target ends. For each ongoing spell of level 4 or higher on the target, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability (DC 10 plus that spell's level). On a successful check, the spell ends.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You automatically end a spell on the target if the spell's level is equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you use.

Healing Word.name: Healing Word
Healing Word.description:
A creature of your choice that you can see within range regains Hit Points equal to 2d4 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The healing increases by 2d4 for each spell slot level above 1.

Lesser Restoration.name: Lesser Restoration
Lesser Restoration.description: You touch a creature and end one condition on it: &Reference[blinded], &Reference[deafened], &Reference[paralyzed], or &Reference[poisoned].

Light.name: Light
Light.description:
You touch one Large or smaller object that isn't being worn or carried by someone else. Until the spell ends, the object sheds Bright Light in a 20-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 20 feet. The light can be colored as you like.

Covering the object with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends if you cast it again.

Thaumaturgy.name: Thaumaturgy
Thaumaturgy.description:
You manifest a minor wonder within range. You create one of the effects below within range. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time.

Altered Eyes. You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

Booming Voice. Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute. For the duration, you have Advantage on [[/check ability=cha skill=itm]] checks.

Fire Play. You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.

Invisible Hand. You instantaneously cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.

Phantom Sound. You create an instantaneous sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as a rumble of thunder, the cry of a raven, or ominous whispers.

Tremors. You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.

Spiritual Weapon.name: Spiritual Weapon
Spiritual Weapon.description:
You create a floating, spectral force that resembles a weapon of your choice and lasts for the duration. The force appears within range in a space of your choice, and you can immediately make one melee spell attack against one creature within 5 feet of the force. On a hit, the target takes Force damage equal to 1d8 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

As a Bonus Action on your later turns, you can move the force up to 20 feet and repeat the attack against a creature within 5 feet of it.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for every slot level above 2.

Any nonmagical weapon takes a cumulative −1 penalty to attack rolls immediately after dealing damage to the [[lookup @name lowercase]] and coming into contact with it. Details.name: Details
Details.text:
A Location (Icewind Dale) Adventure for

Level 4 Characters

Explore the corpse of a Charalyn dragon.

Scene: @UUID[Scene.aifTheTerror0000]{The Terror}

Situation. An unorthodox high elf cleric of Ilmater at Revel’s End named Vargrazt the Wretch (Medium, Lawful Good @UUID[Actor.aifPriest0000000]{Priest}) offers to purge the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.book.JournalEntry.aifMagicOfIcewin.JournalEntryPage.RDZbwNDefoU0SAU9]{chardalyn} dragon remains in @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.book.JournalEntry.aifTentownsGazet.JournalEntryPage.GF9kz7TMKfi9HW3S]{Easthaven} of their diabolical power—the so-called Terror of Ten-Towns—via a ritual.

Hook. Therandril, a mage in Easthaven, hires the characters to retrieve Vargratz from Revel’s End and help him in his mission.

Encounters

The adventure consists of these encounters.

Fanatic in Chains. The characters travel by way of either Dwarven Valley or Highplume Station. Use the table in @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.book.JournalEntry.aifCh3DmsToolbox.JournalEntryPage.9ssPanaCADIxmuSY#wilderness-encounters]{Wilderness Encounters} earlier in this chapter for one encounter as they travel. At the prison, they take custody of Vargrazt the Wretch.

A Violent Rite. On their return to Easthaven, Vargrazt enters the Terror at sunset to perform the ritual. Vargrazt absorbs the chardalyn’s evil but destroys his own soul and becomes a violent @UUID[Actor.aifWraith0000000]{Wraith} (the wraith is placed as a Token in the entrance).

The Terror. Captain Imdra Arlaggath asks the characters to ensure the Terror is safe. It is the size of a small building, and half of it is buried below ground level. It is inhabited by two duergar @UUID[Actor.aifSpecter000000]{Specters} and one duergar @UUID[Actor.aifPoltergeist00]{Poltergeist}.

Slime on the Walls. Arlaggath asks the characters to keep watch in the Terror overnight as a last precaution. During the night, three @UUID[Actor.aifGrayOoze00000]{Gray Oozes} creep up a hidden passage from the Underdark and fight any living thing in the Terror.

Muck Monster. The oozes leave a path of slime to a hidden, locked trapdoor. The lock is Simple (1 action to pick) and of Good quality ([[/tool 15 thief]]). Below lies a pit of filth inhabited by an @UUID[Actor.aifOtyugh0000000]{Otyugh}. The otyugh heaves itself up through the trapdoor, so characters above aren’t safe from its hunger.

Conclusion. After the characters clear out the restless spirits and Underdark monsters infesting the dragon’s remains, Arlaggath entrusts the party with the Terror’s care, allowing them to convert it into a shared Bastion once they reach level 5. Vargrazt’s ritual absorbed the chardalyn’s power, rendering crystals inert and the Terror safe to inhabit. At your discretion, though, Zlan might still be able to monitor the characters while they’re in the chardalyn remains.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.book.JournalEntry.aifAtlas00000000.JournalEntryPage.KAfE6WxPNBCBOG7b caption=false]

A Restless Eternity.description:
A Region (Arcane Empires) Adventure for

Learn the secrets of Rashemen’s High Country.

Situation. A cult devoted to Cyric is traveling the High Country of Rashemen, disturbing ancient monoliths that imprison powerful demons. Hathrans of Rashemen keep watch on these monoliths, but the cultists are beyond their power.

Hook. Thulra, a hathran elder, offers the party 6,000 GP to travel to three monoliths, inspect them for damage, and find the cultists. She provides the party with a map.

The specter is under the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s control. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can have no more than seven specters under its control at a time.

Frightful Presence.name: Frightful Presence
Frightful Presence.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplFear000000]{Fear}, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]). The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.

Fear.name: Fear
Fear.description:
Each creature in a 30-foot Cone must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or drop whatever it is holding and have the &Reference[frightened apply=false] condition for the duration.

A Frightened creature takes the &Reference[dash] action and moves away from you by the safest route on each of its turns unless there is nowhere to move. If the creature ends its turn in a space where it doesn't have line of sight to you, the creature makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a successful save, the spell ends on that creature.

Fear.name: Fear
Fear.description: A &Reference[frightened apply=false] creature takes the &Reference[dash] action and moves away from you by the safest route on each of its turns unless there is nowhere to move. If the creature ends its turn in a space where it doesn’t have line of sight to you, the creature makes a [[/save ability=wis]] saving throw. On a successful save, the spell ends on that creature.

Pounce.name: Pounce
Pounce.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves up to half its Speed, and it makes one [[/item Rend]] attack.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMageArmor0]{Mage Armor} (included in AC), @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplThaumaturg]{Thaumaturgy}

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplJallarzisS]{Jallarzi’s Storm of Radiance} (level 7 version), @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMassSugges]{Mass Suggestion}

Mage Armor.name: Mage Armor
Mage Armor.description: You touch a willing creature who isn’t wearing armor. Until the spell ends, the target’s base AC becomes 13 plus its Dexterity modifier. The spell ends early if the target dons armor.

Mage Armor.name: Mage Armor
Mage Armor.description: The target's base AC becomes 13 + its Dexterity modifier.

Thaumaturgy.name: Thaumaturgy
Thaumaturgy.description:
You manifest a minor wonder within range. You create one of the effects below within range. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time.

Altered Eyes. You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

Booming Voice. Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute. For the duration, you have Advantage on [[/check ability=cha skill=itm]] checks.

Fire Play. You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.

Invisible Hand. You instantaneously cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.

Phantom Sound. You create an instantaneous sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as a rumble of thunder, the cry of a raven, or ominous whispers.

Tremors. You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.

Jallarzi's Storm of Radiance.name: Jallarzi's Storm of Radiance
Jallarzi's Storm of Radiance.description:
You unleash a storm of flashing light and raging thunder in a 10-foot-radius, 40-foot-high Cylinder centered on a point you can see within range. While in this area, creatures have the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] and &Reference[Deafened apply=false] conditions, and they can’t cast spells with a Verbal component.

When the storm appears, each creature in it makes a Constitution saving throw, taking 2d10 Radiant damage and 2d10 Thunder damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature also makes this save when it enters the spell’s area for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there. A creature makes this save only once per turn.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The Radiant and Thunder damage increase by 1d10 for each spell slot level above 5.

Senses Overwhelmed.name: Senses Overwhelmed
Senses Overwhelmed.description: While in this area, creatures have the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] and &Reference[Deafened apply=false] conditions, and they can’t cast spells with a Verbal component.

Mass Suggestion.name: Mass Suggestion
Mass Suggestion.description:
You suggest a course of activity—described in no more than 25 words—to twelve or fewer creatures you can see within range that can hear and understand you. The suggestion must sound achievable and not involve anything that would obviously deal damage to any of the targets or their allies. For example, you could say, “Walk to the village down that road, and help the villagers there harvest crops until sunset.” Or you could say, “Now is not the time for violence. Drop your weapons, and dance! Stop in an hour.”

Each target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] condition for the duration or until you or your allies deal damage to the target. Each Charmed target pursues the suggestion to the best of its ability. The suggested activity can continue for the entire duration, but if the suggested activity can be completed in a shorter time, the spell ends for a target upon completing it.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The duration is longer with a spell slot of level 7 (10 days), 8 (30 days), or 9 (366 days).

Charmed.name: Charmed
Charmed.description: The target has the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] condition for the duration or until you or your allies deal damage to the target. Each Charmed target pursues the suggestion to the best of its ability.

Mage Armor.description: The target's base AC becomes 13 + its Dexterity modifier.

The creature that damaged you is momentarily surrounded by green flames. It makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking 2d10 Fire damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d10 for each spell slot level above 1.

activation.condition: taking damage from a creature that you can see within 60 feet of yourself

Scorching Ray.name: Scorching Ray
Scorching Ray.description:
You hurl three fiery rays. You can hurl them at one target within range or at several. Make a ranged spell attack for each ray. On a hit, the target takes 2d6 Fire damage.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You create one additional ray for each spell slot level above 2.

[[@item.level + 1]]{Total Rays}

Thaumaturgy.name: Thaumaturgy
Thaumaturgy.description:
You manifest a minor wonder within range. You create one of the effects below within range. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time.

Altered Eyes. You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

Booming Voice. Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute. For the duration, you have Advantage on [[/check ability=cha skill=itm]] checks.

Fire Play. You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.

Invisible Hand. You instantaneously cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.

Phantom Sound. You create an instantaneous sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as a rumble of thunder, the cry of a raven, or ominous whispers.

Tremors. You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.

Fireball.name: Fireball
Fireball.description:
A bright streak flashes from you to a point you choose within range and then blossoms with a low roar into a fiery explosion. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius Sphere centered on that point makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking 8d6 Fire damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Flammable objects in the area that aren’t being worn or carried start burning.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 3.

materials.value: a ball of bat guano and sulfur

Demonic Restoration.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] dies outside the Abyss, its body dissolves into ichor, and it gains a new body instantly, reviving with all its Hit Points somewhere in the Abyss.

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition and repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. While Poisoned, the target takes [[/damage average activity=ukZveNVmvvtwbDj0]] at the start of each of its turns. Emptying a flask of Holy Water on the target ends the effect early.

Poisoned.name: Poisoned
Poisoned.description: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition and repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=eoIikvnPayaj02oN]], each creature in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=eoIikvnPayaj02oN]]-foot Emanation originating from the [[lookup @name lowercase]] (demons succeed automatically).

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &Reference[Stunned apply=false] condition until the end of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s next turn.

Stunned.name: Stunned

Wand.description: An @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagArcaneFocus]{Arcane Focus} is bejeweled or carved to channel arcane magic. A Sorcerer, Warlock, or Wizard can use such an item as a Spellcasting Focus.

Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three [[/item .mmArcaneBurst000]] attacks.

Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDetectMagi]{Detect Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplLight00000]{Light}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMageArmor0]{Mage Armor} (included in AC), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMageHand00]{Mage Hand}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplPrestidigi]{Prestidigitation}

2/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplFireball00]{Fireball} (level 4 version), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplInvisibili]{Invisibility}

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplConeofCold]{Cone of Cold}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplFly0000000]{Fly}

Misty Step.name: Misty Step
Misty Step.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMistyStep0]{Misty Step}, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

BtkwckQJktc8hRh0.name: Misty Step BtkwckQJktc8hRh0
BtkwckQJktc8hRh0.description: Briefly surrounded by silvery mist, you teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.

Protective Magic.name: Protective Magic
Protective Magic.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplCounterspe]{Counterspell} or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplShield0000]{Shield} in response to the spell's trigger, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

Counterspell.name: Counterspell
Counterspell.description: You attempt to interrupt a creature in the process of casting a spell. The creature makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the spell dissipates with no effect, and the action, Bonus Action, or Reaction used to cast it is wasted. If that spell was cast with a spell slot, the slot isn't expended.

activation.condition: when you see a creature within range casting a spell with Verbal, Somatic, or Material components

Shield.name: Shield
Shield.description: An imperceptible barrier of magical force protects you. Until the start of your next turn, you have a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and you take no damage from @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMagicMissi]{Magic Missile}.

activation.condition: when you are hit by an attack roll or targeted by the Magic Missile spell

Imperceptible Barrier.name: Imperceptible Barrier
Imperceptible Barrier.description: Until the start of your next turn, you have a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and you take no damage from Magic Missile.

Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell's school of magic.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Light.name: Light
Light.description:
You touch one Large or smaller object that isn't being worn or carried by someone else. Until the spell ends, the object sheds Bright Light in a 20-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 20 feet. The light can be colored as you like.

Covering the object with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends if you cast it again.

Mage Armor.name: Mage Armor
Mage Armor.description: You touch a willing creature who isn't wearing armor. Until the spell ends, the target's base AC becomes 13 plus its Dexterity modifier. The spell ends early if the target dons armor.

Mage Armor.name: Mage Armor
Mage Armor.description: The target's base AC becomes 13 + its Dexterity modifier.

Mage Hand.name: Mage Hand
Mage Hand.description:
A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.

When you cast the spell, you can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial.

As a Magic action on your later turns, you can control the hand thus again. As part of that action, you can move the hand up to 30 feet.

The hand can't attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

Prestidigitation.name: Prestidigitation
Prestidigitation.description:
You create a magical effect within range. Choose the effect from the options below. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time.

Sensory Effect. You create an instantaneous, harmless sensory effect, such as a shower of sparks, a puff of wind, faint musical notes, or an odd odor.

Fire Play. You instantaneously light or snuff out a candle, a torch, or a small campfire.

Clean or Soil. You instantaneously clean or soil an object no larger than 1 cubic foot.

Minor Sensation. You chill, warm, or flavor up to 1 cubic foot of nonliving material for 1 hour.

Magic Mark. You make a color, a small mark, or a symbol appear on an object or a surface for 1 hour.

Minor Creation. You create a nonmagical trinket or an illusory image that can fit in your hand. It lasts until the end of your next turn. A trinket can deal no damage and has no monetary worth.

Fireball.name: Fireball
Fireball.description:
A bright streak flashes from you to a point you choose within range and then blossoms with a low roar into a fiery explosion. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius Sphere centered on that point makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking 8d6 Fire damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried start burning.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 3.

materials.value: a ball of bat guano and sulfur

Invisibility.name: Invisibility
Invisibility.description:
A creature you touch has the &Reference[invisible apply=false] condition until the spell ends. The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 2.

Invisible.name: Invisible
Invisible.description: The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Cone of Cold.name: Cone of Cold
Cone of Cold.description:
You unleash a blast of cold air. Each creature in a 60-foot Cone originating from you makes a Constitution saving throw, taking 8d8 Cold damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature killed by this spell becomes a frozen statue until it thaws.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for each spell slot level above 5.

materials.value: a small crystal or glass cone

Fly.name: Fly
Fly.description:
You touch a willing creature. For the duration, the target gains a Fly Speed of 60 feet and can hover. When the spell ends, the target falls if it is still aloft unless it can stop the fall.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 3.

Details.name: Details
Details.text:
A Region (Arcane Empires) Adventure for

Level 7 Characters

Learn the secrets of Rashemen’s High Country.

Scene: @UUID[Scene.aifHighCountry00]{High Country}

Adventure (Import to Run): @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.adventures.Adventure.Br1B3vACnhXyNZKV]{A Restless Eternity}

Situation. A cult devoted to Cyric is traveling the High Country of Rashemen, disturbing ancient monoliths that imprison powerful demons. Hathrans of Rashemen keep watch on these monoliths, but the cultists are beyond their power.

Hook. Thulra, a hathran elder, offers the party [[/award 6000GP]] to travel to three monoliths, inspect them for damage, and find the cultists. She provides the party with a map.

Encounters

Use the map below as the characters travel through the High Country to the various monoliths. In addition to the encounters detailed below, you can select hexes on the map for other encounters of your own design. As the characters travel through these hexes, they’ll discover the encounters you created.

High Country Encounters. Every day of travel, roll once on the table below or select an encounter, rerolling duplicates.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.tables.RollTable.aifEncHighCountr rollable classes="caption-top" resultLabel="Encounter" caption=false]

Kissethkashaan’s Lair. Kissethkashaan (@UUID[Actor.aifAdultWhiteDra]{Adult White Dragon}) lives atop a tall mountain peak shrouded in perpetual snow. He is attended by four white @UUID[Actor.aifHalfdragon000]{Half-Dragons} and seeks to avoid conflict but defends his lair if necessary.

Cyric Cultists. The cultists move from one monolith to the next, damaging each to release Fiends trapped within. A @UUID[Actor.aifCultistHierop]{Cultist Hierophant} leads two @UUID[Actor.aifFiendCultist0]{Fiend Cultists} and eight @UUID[Actor.aifGnollFangOfYe]{Gnoll Fangs of Yeenoghu}. They fight anyone who threatens their mission.

Monoliths. When the party reaches their first monolith, they find it destroyed and four @UUID[Actor.aifVrock00000000]{Vrocks} dancing amid the rubble. At the second monolith, a cult @UUID[Actor.aifMage000000000]{Mage} and her two @UUID[Actor.aifAssassin00000]{Assassin} bodyguards survey the stone for the cult, but it isn’t yet damaged. If the party hasn’t encountered the Cyric Cultists previously, they find the cultists at the third monolith performing a ritual around the stone while the gnolls keep guard. The ritual takes 10 minutes to complete. If the cultists aren’t interrupted, the monolith shatters and a @UUID[Actor.aifGoristro00000]{Goristro} bursts forth.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.book.JournalEntry.aifAtlas00000000.JournalEntryPage.erK2iAnM7iajn7Hm caption=false]

Situation. Rendel Carver (Medium Commoner), the human husband of a prominent Zhentarim leader, has been kidnapped by a rival crime gang and is being held at a safe house in the city.

Hook. The Zhentarim leader instructs the characters to rescue Rendel and enact revenge on the kidnappers.

Success: Half damage only.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDisguiseSe]{Disguise Self}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMageHand00]{Mage Hand}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMinorIllus]{Minor Illusion}

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplHoldPerson]{Hold Person} (level 4 version), @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMageArmor0]{Mage Armor} (included in AC), @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMajorImage]{Major Image}

Disguise Self.name: Disguise Self
Disguise Self.description:
You make yourself—including your clothing, armor, weapons, and other belongings on your person—look different until the spell ends. You can seem 1 foot shorter or taller and can appear heavier or lighter. You must adopt a form that has the same basic arrangement of limbs as you have. Otherwise, the extent of the illusion is up to you.

The changes wrought by this spell fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, if you use this spell to add a hat to your outfit, objects pass through the hat, and anyone who touches it would feel nothing.

To discern that you are disguised, a creature must take the Study action to inspect your appearance and succeed on an [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC.

Disguised.name: Disguised
Disguised.description: To discern that you are disguised, a creature must take the Study action to inspect your appearance and succeed on an [[/check ability=int skill=inv]] check against your spell save DC.

Mage Hand.name: Mage Hand
Mage Hand.description:
A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.

When you cast the spell, you can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial.

As a Magic action on your later turns, you can control the hand thus again. As part of that action, you can move the hand up to 30 feet.

The hand can’t attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

Minor Illusion.name: Minor Illusion
Minor Illusion.description:
You create a sound or an image of an object within range that lasts for the duration. See the descriptions below for the effects of each. The illusion ends if you cast this spell again.

If a creature takes a Study action to examine the sound or image, the creature can determine that it is an illusion with a successful [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the illusion becomes faint to the creature.

Sound. If you create a sound, its volume can range from a whisper to a scream. It can be your voice, someone else’s voice, a lion’s roar, a beating of drums, or any other sound you choose. The sound continues unabated throughout the duration, or you can make discrete sounds at different times before the spell ends.

Image. If you create an image of an object—such as a chair, muddy footprints, or a small chest—it must be no larger than a 5-foot Cube. The image can’t create sound, light, smell, or any other sensory effect. Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, since things can pass through it.

Hold Person.name: Hold Person
Hold Person.description:
Choose a Humanoid that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the &Reference[paralyzed apply=false] condition for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional Humanoid for each spell slot level above 2.

Paralyzed.name: Paralyzed
Paralyzed.description: At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the [[/save ability=wis]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Mage Armor.name: Mage Armor
Mage Armor.description: You touch a willing creature who isn’t wearing armor. Until the spell ends, the target’s base AC becomes 13 plus its Dexterity modifier. The spell ends early if the target dons armor.

Mage Armor.name: Mage Armor
Mage Armor.description: The target's base AC becomes 13 + its Dexterity modifier.

Major Image.name: Major Image
Major Image.description:
You create the image of an object, a creature, or some other visible phenomenon that is no larger than a 20-foot Cube. The image appears at a spot that you can see within range and lasts for the duration. It seems real, including sounds, smells, and temperature appropriate to the thing depicted, but it can’t deal damage or cause conditions.

If you are within range of the illusion, you can take a Magic action to cause the image to move to any other spot within range. As the image changes location, you can alter its appearance so that its movements appear natural for the image. For example, if you create an image of a creature and move it, you can alter the image so that it appears to be walking. Similarly, you can cause the illusion to make different sounds at different times, even making it carry on a conversation, for example.

Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, for things can pass through it. A creature that takes a Study action to examine the image can determine that it is an illusion with a successful [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the creature can see through the image, and its other sensory qualities become faint to the creature.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The spell lasts until dispelled, without requiring Concentration, if cast with a level 4+ spell slot.
