Wish Stress.name: Wish Stress
Wish Stress.description: Each time you cast a spell until you finish a Long Rest, you take [[/damage 1d10 type=necrotic]] damage per level of that spell. This damage can’t be reduced or prevented in any way. In addition, your Strength score becomes 3 for [[/r 2d4]] days.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three [[/item .mmAquaticLash000]] attacks.

Water Jet.name: Water Jet
Water Jet.description:
Dexterity Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=CY2HqHThU06Jf0Bw]], each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=CY2HqHThU06Jf0Bw]] in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=CY2HqHThU06Jf0Bw]]-foot-long, [[lookup @target.template.width activity=CY2HqHThU06Jf0Bw]]-foot-wide Line.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is pushed up to 20 feet straight away from the [[lookup @name lowercase]] and has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Success: Half damage only.

Prone.name: Prone
Prone.description: If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is pushed up to 20 feet straight away from the attacking creature and has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplCreateorDe]{Create or Destroy Water}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectEvil]{Detect Evil and Good}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectMagi]{Detect Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplPurifyFood]{Purify Food and Drink}

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplControlWat]{Control Water}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplGaseousFor]{Gaseous Form}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplInvisibili]{Invisibility}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplPlaneShift]{Plane Shift}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplTongues000]{Tongues}

Create or Destroy Water.name: Create or Destroy Water
Create or Destroy Water.description:
You do one of the following:

Create Water. You create up to 10 gallons of clean water within range in an open container. Alternatively, the water falls as rain in a 30-foot Cube within range, extinguishing exposed flames there.

Destroy Water. You destroy up to 10 gallons of water in an open container within range. Alternatively, you destroy fog in a 30-foot Cube within range.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You create or destroy 10 additional gallons of water, or the size of the Cube increases by 5 feet, for each spell slot level above 1.

materials.value: a mix of water and sand

Detect Evil and Good.name: Detect Evil and Good
Detect Evil and Good.description:
For the duration, you sense the location of any Aberration, Celestial, Elemental, Fey, Fiend, or Undead within 30 feet of yourself. You also sense whether the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplHallow0000]{Hallow} spell is active there and, if so, where.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell’s school of magic.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Purify Food and Drink.name: Purify Food and Drink
Purify Food and Drink.description: You remove poison and rot from nonmagical food and drink in a 5-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point within range.

Control Water.name: Control Water
Control Water.description:
Until the spell ends, you control any water inside an area you choose that is a Cube up to 100 feet on a side, using one of the following effects. As a Magic action on your later turns, you can repeat the same effect or choose a different one.

Flood. You cause the water level of all standing water in the area to rise by as much as 20 feet. If you choose an area in a large body of water, you instead create a 20-foot tall wave that travels from one side of the area to the other and then crashes. Any Huge or smaller vehicles in the wave’s path are carried with it to the other side. Any Huge or smaller vehicles struck by the wave have a [[/r 1d100cs<26#Vehicle is capsized]]{25 percent} chance of capsizing.

The water level remains elevated until the spell ends or you choose a different effect. If this effect produced a wave, the wave repeats on the start of your next turn while the flood effect lasts.

Part Water. You part water in the area and create a trench. The trench extends across the spell’s area, and the separated water forms a wall to either side. The trench remains until the spell ends or you choose a different effect. The water then slowly fills in the trench over the course of the next round until the normal water level is restored.

Redirect Flow. You cause flowing water in the area to move in a direction you choose, even if the water has to flow over obstacles, up walls, or in other unlikely directions. The water in the area moves as you direct it, but once it moves beyond the spell’s area, it resumes its flow based on the terrain. The water continues to move in the direction you chose until the spell ends or you choose a different effect.

Whirlpool. You cause a whirlpool to form in the center of the area, which must be at least 50 feet square and 25 feet deep. The whirlpool lasts until you choose a different effect or the spell ends. The whirlpool is 5 feet wide at the base, up to 50 feet wide at the top, and 25 feet tall. Any creature in the water and within 25 feet of the whirlpool is pulled 10 feet toward it. When a creature enters the whirlpool for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there, it makes a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 2d8 Bludgeoning damage. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage. A creature can swim away from the whirlpool only if it first takes an action to pull away and succeeds on a [[/check ability=str skill=ath dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC.

materials.value: a mixture of water and dust

Gaseous Form.name: Gaseous Form
Gaseous Form.description:

Tongues.description: This spell grants the creature you touch the ability to understand any spoken or signed language that it hears or sees. Moreover, when the target communicates by speaking or signing, any creature that knows at least one language can understand it if that creature can hear the speech or see the signing.

Misty Veil.name: Misty Veil
Misty Veil.description: The marid casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplFogCloud00]{Fog Cloud}, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

Fog Cloud.name: Fog Cloud
Fog Cloud.description:
You create a 20-foot-radius Sphere of fog centered on a point within range. The Sphere is &Reference[heavilyobscured]. It lasts for the duration or until a strong wind (such as one created by @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplGustofWind]{Gust of Wind}) disperses it.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The fog’s radius increases by 20 feet for each spell slot level above 1.

Sunlight Hypersensitivity.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes [[/damage]] damage if it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has Disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes one [[/item .mmBite0000000000]] attack and one [[/item .mmShadowStrike00]] attack.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. The target’s Hit Point maximum decreases by an amount equal to the Necrotic damage taken, and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] regains Hit Points equal to that amount.

Shadow Stealth.name: Shadow Stealth
Shadow Stealth.description: While in Dim Light or Darkness, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes the &Reference[Hide] action.

Spider Climb.name: Spider Climb
Spider Climb.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item .mmClaw0000000000]] attacks and uses [[/item .mmBite0000000000]].

Claw.name: Claw
Claw.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC [[lookup @skills.ath.passive]]) from one of two claws.

Grappled.name: Grappled
Grappled.description: If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC [[/check ability=str skill=ath format=long]], see source item for DC) from one of two claws.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=7mBlINHfcabm0DAr]], one creature within [[lookup @range.value activity=7mBlINHfcabm0DAr]] feet that is willing or that has the Grappled, Incapacitated, or Restrained condition.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage. The target's Hit Point maximum decreases by an amount equal to the Necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains Hit Points equal to that amount.

Deathless Agility.name: Deathless Agility
Deathless Agility.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes the &Reference[Dash] or &Reference[Disengage] action.

Vampire Weakness.name: Vampire Weakness
Vampire Weakness.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has these weaknesses:

Forbiddance. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can't enter a residence without an invitation from an occupant.

Running Water. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes 20 Acid damage if it ends its turn in running water.

Stake to the Heart. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] is destroyed if a weapon that deals Piercing damage is driven into the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s heart while the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has the Incapacitated condition.

Sunlight. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes 20 Radiant damage if it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has Disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

Disadv. Attacks & Checks.name: Disadv. Attacks & Checks
Disadv. Attacks & Checks.description: While in sunlight, it has Disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

heal.condition: starts its turn with at least 1 Hit Point

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item Chaos Claw]] attacks.

Chaos Claw.name: Chaos Claw
Chaos Claw.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. Until the start of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s next turn, the target has a condition determined by rolling 1d4: on a 1, &Reference[Charmed apply=false]; on a 2, &Reference[Frightened apply=false]; on a 3, &Reference[Poisoned apply=false]; or on a 4, &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false].

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 16):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectMagi]{Detect Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectThou]{Detect Thoughts}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplInvisibili]{Invisibility} (self only), @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMageHand00]{Mage Hand}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMajorImage]{Major Image}

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplCloudkill0]{Cloudkill}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplFly0000000]{Fly}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplPlaneShift]{Plane Shift} (self only), @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplTongues000]{Tongues}

Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell’s school of magic.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Detect Thoughts.name: Detect Thoughts
Detect Thoughts.description:
You activate one of the effects below. Until the spell ends, you can activate either effect as a Magic action on your later turns.

Sense Thoughts. You sense the presence of thoughts within 30 feet of yourself that belong to creatures that know languages or are telepathic. You don’t read the thoughts, but you know that a thinking creature is present.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Read Thoughts. Target one creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself or one creature within 30 feet of yourself that you detected with the Sense Thoughts option. You learn what is most on the target’s mind right now. If the target doesn’t know any languages and isn’t telepathic, you learn nothing.

As a Magic action on your next turn, you can try to probe deeper into the target’s mind. If you probe deeper, the target makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, you discern the target’s reasoning, emotions, and something that looms large in its mind (such as a worry, love, or hate). On a successful save, the spell ends. Either way, the target knows that you are probing into its mind, and until you shift your attention away from the target’s mind, the target can take an action on its turn to make an [[/check ability=int skill=arc dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC, ending the spell on a success.

Invisibility.name: Invisibility
Invisibility.description:
A creature you touch has the &Reference[invisible apply=false] condition until the spell ends. The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 2.

Invisible.name: Invisible
Invisible.description: The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Mage Hand.name: Mage Hand
Mage Hand.description:
A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.

When you cast the spell, you can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial.

As a Magic action on your later turns, you can control the hand thus again. As part of that action, you can move the hand up to 30 feet.

The hand can’t attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

Major Image.name: Major Image
Major Image.description:
You create the image of an object, a creature, or some other visible phenomenon that is no larger than a 20-foot Cube. The image appears at a spot that you can see within range and lasts for the duration. It seems real, including sounds, smells, and temperature appropriate to the thing depicted, but it can’t deal damage or cause conditions.

If you are within range of the illusion, you can take a Magic action to cause the image to move to any other spot within range. As the image changes location, you can alter its appearance so that its movements appear natural for the image. For example, if you create an image of a creature and move it, you can alter the image so that it appears to be walking. Similarly, you can cause the illusion to make different sounds at different times, even making it carry on a conversation, for example.

Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, for things can pass through it. A creature that takes a Study action to examine the image can determine that it is an illusion with a successful [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the creature can see through the image, and its other sensory qualities become faint to the creature.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The spell lasts until dispelled, without requiring Concentration, if cast with a level 4+ spell slot.

Cloudkill.name: Cloudkill
Cloudkill.description:
You create a 20-foot-radius Sphere of yellow-green fog centered on a point within range. The fog lasts for the duration or until strong wind (such as the one created by Gust of Wind) disperses it, ending the spell. Its area is Heavily Obscured.

Each creature in the Sphere makes a Constitution saving throw, taking 5d8 Poison damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature must also make this save when the Sphere moves into its space and when it enters the Sphere or ends its turn there. A creature makes this save only once per turn.

The Sphere moves 10 feet away from you at the start of each of your turns.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for each spell slot level above 5.

Fly.name: Fly
Fly.description:
You touch a willing creature. For the duration, the target gains a Fly Speed of 60 feet and can hover. When the spell ends, the target falls if it is still aloft unless it can stop the fall.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 3.

Plane Shift.name: Plane Shift
Plane Shift.description:
You and up to eight willing creatures who link hands in a circle are transported to a different plane of existence. You can specify a target destination in general terms, such as the City of Brass on the Elemental Plane of Fire or the palace of Dispater on the second level of the Nine Hells, and you appear in or near that destination, as determined by the DM.

Alternatively, if you know the sigil sequence of a teleportation circle on another plane of existence, this spell can take you to that circle. If the teleportation circle is too small to hold all the creatures you transported, they appear in the closest unoccupied spaces next to the circle.

materials.value: a forked, metal rod worth 250+ GP and attuned to a plane of existence

affects.special: you and up to eight willing creatures

Tongues.name: Tongues
Tongues.description: This spell grants the creature you touch the ability to understand any spoken or signed language that it hears or sees. Moreover, when the target communicates by speaking or signing, any creature that knows at least one language can understand it if that creature can hear the speech or see the signing.

Shape-Shift.name: Shape-Shift
Shape-Shift.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] [[lookup @target.affects.special activity=EU2q25V5hIaM1ZlR]], or it returns to its true form. Other than its size, its game statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn’t transformed.

affects.special: shape-shifts into a Small or Medium Humanoid

[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a Humanoid not cursed by a [[lookup @name lowercase]], it is subjected to the following effect.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=C5wp4BSKfYlbMurm]].

Failure: The target is cursed unawares, and a minuscule slaad egg is implanted in it. Removing the curse destroys the egg.

Over [[/r 2d4*10#Days egg gestates]]{2d4 × 10} days, the egg gestates. In the final 24 hours, the cursed target feels unwell; its Speed is halved, and it has Disadvantage on D20 Tests. At the end of this time, the egg turns into a @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmSlaadTadpole00]{Slaad Tadpole}, which chews out of the host and kills it.

Flammable objects in the area that aren’t being worn or carried start burning.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=zy66rXdo6Mo4E9bO]].

If the curse reduces the target’s Hit Point maximum to 0, the curse ends, and instead of dying, the target instantly transforms into a @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmRedSlaad000000]{Red Slaad} or, if it can cast spells of level 3 or higher, a @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmGreenSlaad0000]{Green Slaad}. Only a @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplWish000000]{Wish} spell can reverse this transformation.

The cursed target can’t regain Hit Points, and its Hit Point maximum decreases by [[/r 3d6#HP Max Decrease]]{10 (3d6)} after every 24 hours and doesn’t return to normal after finishing a Long Rest.

Details.name: Details
Details.text:
A Location (CalimshanEmpires) Adventure for

Level 8 Characters

Save the realm from destruction.

Scenes: @UUID[Scene.aifThePalacePrim]{Palace Primordial}, @UUID[Scene.aifCalimemnonCon]{Volcanic Caves}

Adventure (Import to Run): @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.adventures.Adventure.GPz4GW0f5qzRkqQN]{The Calimemnon Conspiracy}

Situation. Ambassadors from the four genie factions of Calimshan come together for a three-day festival in Calimport. But while the city is distracted, @UUID[Actor.aifBihaBabir0000]{Biha Babir} learns the location of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.items.Item.aifCalimemnonCry]{Calimemnon Crystal}. The characters must stop her from acquiring it and freeing the genies trapped within.

Hook. Sultana Songal asks the characters to go the festival as her agents and make a good impression on the ambassadors each genie faction has sent to the festival.

Encounters

The festival takes place at the Palace Primordial, which is divided into distinct buildings for Dao, Djinn, Efreet, and Marids. Use the Palace Primordial map earlier in this chapter. Each day of the festival, the four genie ambassadors host magnificent feasts in their respective palaces attended by humanoid and elemental followers. Each ambassador competes to provide the most fantastic entertainments and sumptuous dishes.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.book.JournalEntry.aifAtlas00000000.JournalEntryPage.W17Ze8l9aDy2jf3W caption=false]

Each day, the characters can decide whether they linger at a feast, mingle with attendees, watch the various entertainments, or engage in some other activity. Each character has the opportunity to earn renown with one of the four genie factions by making a positive impression on one of the four ambassadors—a potential Renown Score increase of 1 per character per day. None of the genie ambassadors can cast the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplWish000000]{Wish} spell. The genies are as follows:

Adviser Elçin. Elçin is a @UUID[Actor.mmDjinni00000000]{Djinni} who is intelligent and aloof. She is Indifferent to the characters, watching them carefully and probing for information on Sultana Songal.

Prince Sadir. Sadir is a Hostile @UUID[Actor.aifDao0000000000]{Dao} envious of his fellow genies. He tries to trick the characters into embarrassing or humiliating the other ambassadors.

General Nirmalya. Nirmalya is an @UUID[Actor.mmEfreeti0000000]{Efreeti} and Indifferent to the characters. She enjoys revelry and demonstrating her magical powers. She is quick with compliments but equally quick to anger.

Sovereign Firtina. Firtina is a @UUID[Actor.aifMarid00000000]{Marid} with many titles, but his favorite is Sovereign of the Seventh Wave. He is proud, whimsical, and Hostile to the characters. Firtina is an old rival of Biha Babir.

Uninvited Guests. On the second day of the festival, the feast is infiltrated by a @UUID[Actor.aifVampireNightb]{Vampire Nightbringer} named Eshku, who is accompanied by two @UUID[Actor.aifVampireSpawn0]{Vampire Spawn}. The vampires are members of the Twisted Rune, and they’ve come to kill the characters. If the characters defeat the vampires, their Renown Score with each of the four genie factions increases by 2.

The Festival Ends. At the conclusion of the three days festival, attendants spot a falling star, landing in the Calim Desert; the “falling star” is the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.book.JournalEntry.aifMagicItems000.JournalEntryPage.scYl0dzFOmzP1rPQ#calimemnon-crystal]{Calimemnon Crystal} (see chapter 8). Determine which character has the highest Renown Score with any of the genie factions. The ambassador from that faction becomes Friendly to the party and confides to them that the meteor is actually the Calimemnon Crystal. The ambassador can’t allow any of their rivals to get the Artifact, so they give the party a @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.items.Item.svzgBtXiKLNShpAQ]{Spell Scroll of Teleport }and ask the party to acknowledge the ambassador’s assistance to Sultana Songal.

Hunting for the Crystal. The Calimemnon Crystal crashed to the ground like a meteor, breaking through into subterranean tunnels that subsequently flooded. Use the @UUID[Scene.aifCalimemnonCon]{Volcanic Caves} map in the Dungeon Master’s Guide for this part of the adventure, replacing lava with dark, icy water. Each of the three largest pools is guarded by one of the following groups:

  • A @UUID[Actor.mmGraySlaad00000]{Gray Slaad} and a @UUID[Actor.aifRedSlaad00000]{Red Slaad}
  • A @UUID[Actor.mmGreenSlaad0000]{Green Slaad} and a @UUID[Actor.mmBlueSlaad00000]{Blue Slaad}
  • Three @UUID[Actor.aifRedSlaad00000]{Red Slaadi}

The @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.items.Item.aifCalimemnonCry]{Calimemnon Crystal} lies at the bottom of one of the pools (your choice).

Final Confrontation. When the characters find the Calimemnon Crystal, @UUID[Actor.aifBihaBabir0000]{Biha Babir} (see chapter 9) arrives and tries to take it from them. On Initiative count 20 of the second round of combat, the ambassador who helped the party at the end of the festival appears to help fight Biha Babir.

Conclusion. Once the party recovers the Calimemnon Crystal, they’ll have to decide what to do with it. If they reveal all that’s occurred to Sultana Songal, she rewards each of them with [[/award 10000gp]] in coins and gems, then asks for the Artifact. She intends to hide it somewhere safe. Alternatively, the characters might decide to keep the Artifact for themselves. Regardless, the genies of Calimshan won’t stop trying to acquire it!

Silk and Suffering.name: Silk and Suffering
Silk and Suffering.description:
A Deity (Lolth) Adventure for

Level 10 Characters

Brave the malicious cruelty of Lolth.

Situation. The Silken Stewards, a sect of fanatical Lolth worshipers (see Forgotten Realms: Heroes of Faerûn), is kidnapping key figures from Neverwinter for ritual sacrifice as part of a broader campaign to destabilize the city.

Hook. The Lord Protector summons the characters to stop the disappearances before a panic sets in, promising 80,00 GP for their assistance.

Spider Climb.name: Spider Climb
Spider Climb.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item Tentacle]] attacks, uses [[/item Reel]], and makes two [[/item Bite]] attacks.

Bite.name: Bite

Tentacle.name: Tentacle
Tentacle.description:
[[/attack extended]]. Hit: The target has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC [[lookup @skills.ath.passive]]) from one of six tentacles, and the target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the grapple ends.

The tentacle can be damaged, freeing a creature it has Grappled when destroyed (AC 20, HP 10, Immunity to Poison and Psychic damage). Damaging the tentacle deals no damage to the [[lookup @name lowercase]], and a destroyed tentacle regrows at the start of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s next turn.

Ethereal Sight.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane when it is on the Material Plane.

Ethereal Jaunt.name: Ethereal Jaunt
Ethereal Jaunt.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] teleports from the Material Plane to the Ethereal Plane or vice versa.

Demonic Restoration.name: Demonic Restoration
Demonic Restoration.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] dies outside the Abyss, its body dissolves into ichor, and it gains a new body instantly, reviving with all its Hit Points somewhere in the Abyss.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Web Walker.name: Web Walker

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectThou]{Detect Thoughts}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplGaseousFor]{Gaseous Form} (self only), @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplWeb0000000]{Web}

1/Day: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDominatePe]{Dominate Person}

Shape-Shift.name: Shape-Shift
Shape-Shift.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] shape-shifts into a Medium Humanoid or a Medium spider or back into its true form. Its game statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn’t transformed.

Toxic Escape.name: Toxic Escape
Toxic Escape.description:
Trigger: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] is hit by an attack roll.

Response: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] halves the attack’s damage to itself (round down), and it teleports to an unoccupied space it can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=f6zHSW2bzTmUO9oR]] feet of itself.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=f6zHSW2bzTmUO9oR]], each creature within [[lookup @target.template.size activity=f6zHSW2bzTmUO9oR]] feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s destination space.

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn. While Poisoned, it has the &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] condition.

Save.name: Save
Save.condition: The attacking creature is hit by an attack roll.

range.special: teleports to an unoccupied space it can see

Poisoned and Incapacitated.name: Poisoned and Incapacitated
Poisoned and Incapacitated.description: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn. While Poisoned, it has the &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] condition.

Detect Thoughts.name: Detect Thoughts
Detect Thoughts.description:
You activate one of the effects below. Until the spell ends, you can activate either effect as a Magic action on your later turns.

Sense Thoughts. You sense the presence of thoughts within 30 feet of yourself that belong to creatures that know languages or are telepathic. You don’t read the thoughts, but you know that a thinking creature is present.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Read Thoughts. Target one creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself or one creature within 30 feet of yourself that you detected with the Sense Thoughts option. You learn what is most on the target’s mind right now. If the target doesn’t know any languages and isn’t telepathic, you learn nothing.

As a Magic action on your next turn, you can try to probe deeper into the target’s mind. If you probe deeper, the target makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, you discern the target’s reasoning, emotions, and something that looms large in its mind (such as a worry, love, or hate). On a successful save, the spell ends. Either way, the target knows that you are probing into its mind, and until you shift your attention away from the target’s mind, the target can take an action on its turn to make an [[/check ability=int skill=arc dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC, ending the spell on a success.

Gaseous Form.name: Gaseous Form
Gaseous Form.description:
A willing creature you touch shape-shifts, along with everything it’s wearing and carrying, into a misty cloud for the duration. The spell ends on the target if it drops to 0 Hit Points or if it takes a Magic action to end the spell on itself.

While in this form, the target’s only method of movement is a Fly Speed of 10 feet, and it can hover. The target can enter and occupy the space of another creature. The target has Resistance to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage; it has Immunity to the &Reference[prone apply=false] condition; and it has Advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws. The target can pass through narrow openings, but it treats liquids as though they were solid surfaces.

The target can’t talk or manipulate objects, and any objects it was carrying or holding can’t be dropped, used, or otherwise interacted with. Finally, the target can’t attack or cast spells.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 3.

Gaseous Form.name: Gaseous Form
Gaseous Form.description:
The target’s only method of movement is a Fly Speed of 10 feet, and it can hover. The target can enter and occupy the space of another creature. The target has Resistance to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage; it has Immunity to the &Reference[prone apply=false] condition; and it has Advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws. The target can pass through narrow openings, but it treats liquids as though they were solid surfaces.

The target can’t talk or manipulate objects, and any objects it was carrying or holding can’t be dropped, used, or otherwise interacted with. Finally, the target can’t attack or cast spells.

Web.name: Web
Web.description:
You conjure a mass of sticky webbing at a point within range. The webs fill a 20-foot Cube there for the duration. The webs are &Reference[difficultterrain], and the area within them is &Reference[lightlyobscured].

If the webs aren’t anchored between two solid masses (such as walls or trees) or layered across a floor, wall, or ceiling, the web collapses on itself, and the spell ends at the start of your next turn. Webs layered over a flat surface have a depth of 5 feet.

The first time a creature enters the webs on a turn or starts its turn there, it must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or have the &Reference[restrained] condition while in the webs or until it breaks free.

A creature Restrained by the webs can take an action to make a [[/check ability=str skill=ath dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC. If it succeeds, it is no longer Restrained.

The webs are flammable. Any 5-foot Cube of webs exposed to fire burns away in 1 round, dealing [[/damage 2d4 type=fire]] damage to any creature that starts its turn in the fire.

Dominate Person.name: Dominate Person
Dominate Person.description:
One Humanoid you can see within range must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] condition for the duration. The target has Advantage on the save if you or your allies are fighting it. Whenever the target takes damage, it repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

You have a telepathic link with the Charmed target while the two of you are on the same plane of existence. On your turn, you can use this link to issue commands to the target (no action required), such as “Attack that creature,” “Move over there,” or “Fetch that object.” The target does its best to obey on its turn. If it completes an order and doesn’t receive further direction from you, it acts and moves as it likes, focusing on protecting itself.

You can command the target to take a Reaction but must take your own Reaction to do so.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. Your Concentration can last longer with a spell slot of level 6 (up to 10 minutes), 7 (up to 1 hour), or 8+ (up to 8 hours).

Dominated.name: Dominated
Dominated.description: Whenever the &Reference[charmed apply=false] target takes damage, it repeats the [[/save ability=wis]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Drow Priestess of Lolth.name: Drow Priestess of Lolth
Drow Priestess of Lolth.description:
Throughout the vast Underdark, in cities such as Menzoberranzan, many drow worship Lolth, the Spider Queen. Exiled from the surface world millennia ago, these drow now consider the Underdark to be their true home. Their insidious schemes include raiding the surface, plotting against each other, and preparing for ultimate war.

Lolth’s worship is matriarchal, and only female drow can rise to become priestesses of the Spider Queen or rule a noble house.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The drow casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability:

At Will: [[/item .x5ztHmnJAzeGaVg1]]{Dancing Lights}, [[/item .ShxcJ6YIFclSo0oS]]{Guidance}, [[/item .5aVivxEaBwsYRoMm]]{Thaumaturgy}

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The drow makes three [[/item Scourge]] attacks.

Spider Vortex.name: Spider Vortex
Spider Vortex.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=kSLdo9Kl1zSBxlRT]], each enemy in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=kSLdo9Kl1zSBxlRT]]-foot Emanation originating from the drow.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition until the start of the drow’s next turn.

Success: Half damage only.

Restrained.name: Restrained
Restrained.description: You have the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition until the start of the drow’s next turn.

Lolth’s Blessing.name: Lolth’s Blessing
Lolth’s Blessing.description: The drow casts [[/item .0vPfjvEETbtTBxFp]]{Cure Wounds}, [[/item .dPSdS7u82ECTT0YU]]{Darkness}, [[/item .2hWTd3WRkhbiwO3U]]{Dispel Magic}, or [[/item .v6KGqoDyO1xAk6cu]]{Lesser Restoration}, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

Fey Ancestry.name: Fey Ancestry
Fey Ancestry.description: The drow has Advantage on saving throws it makes to avoid or end the Charmed condition, and magic can’t put the drow to sleep.

Sunlight Sensitivity.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
Sunlight Sensitivity.description: While in sunlight, the drow has Disadvantage on attack rolls.

Dancing Lights.name: Dancing Lights
Dancing Lights.description:
You create up to four torch-size lights within range, making them appear as torches, lanterns, or glowing orbs that hover for the duration. Alternatively, you combine the four lights into one glowing Medium form that is vaguely humanlike. Whichever form you choose, each light sheds Dim Light in a 10-foot radius.

As a Bonus Action, you can move the lights up to 60 feet to a space within range. A light must be within 20 feet of another light created by this spell, and a light vanishes if it exceeds the spell's range.

Guidance.name: Guidance
Guidance.description: You touch a willing creature and choose a skill. Until the spell ends, the creature adds 1d4 to any ability check using the chosen skill.

Thaumaturgy.name: Thaumaturgy
Thaumaturgy.description:
You manifest a minor wonder within range. You create one of the effects below within range. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time.

Altered Eyes. You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

Booming Voice. Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute. For the duration, you have Advantage on [[/check ability=cha skill=itm]] checks.

Fire Play. You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.

Invisible Hand. You instantaneously cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.

Phantom Sound. You create an instantaneous sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as a rumble of thunder, the cry of a raven, or ominous whispers.

Tremors. You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.

Cure Wounds.name: Cure Wounds
Cure Wounds.description:
A creature you touch regains a number of Hit Points equal to 2d8 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The healing increases by 2d8 for each spell slot level above 1.

Darkness.name: Darkness
Darkness.description:
For the duration, magical &Reference[darkness] spreads from a point within range and fills a 15-foot-radius Sphere. Darkvision can't see through it, and nonmagical light can't illuminate it.

Alternatively, you cast the spell on an object that isn't being worn or carried, causing the Darkness to fill a 15-foot Emanation originating from that object. Covering that object with something opaque, such as a bowl or helm, blocks the Darkness.

If any of this spell's area overlaps with an area of Bright Light or Dim Light created by a spell of level 2 or lower, that other spell is dispelled.

materials.value: bat fur and a piece of coal

Dispel Magic.name: Dispel Magic
Dispel Magic.description:
Choose one creature, object, or magical effect within range. Any ongoing spell of level 3 or lower on the target ends. For each ongoing spell of level 4 or higher on the target, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability (DC 10 plus that spell's level). On a successful check, the spell ends.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You automatically end a spell on the target if the spell's level is equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you use.

Lesser Restoration.name: Lesser Restoration
Lesser Restoration.description: You touch a creature and end one condition on it: &Reference[blinded], &Reference[deafened], &Reference[paralyzed], or &Reference[poisoned].

Spider Climb.name: Spider Climb
Spider Climb.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

Sunlight Sensitivity.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
Sunlight Sensitivity.description: While in sunlight, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

Web Walker.name: Web Walker
Web Walker.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] ignores movement restrictions caused by webs, and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] knows the location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three attacks, using [[/item .mmForeleg0000000]] or [[/item .mmPoisonBurst000]] in any combination.

Magic of the Spider Queen.name: Magic of the Spider Queen
Magic of the Spider Queen.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDarkness00]{Darkness}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplFaerieFire]{Faerie Fire}, or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplWeb0000000]{Web}, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]).

Darkness.name: Darkness
Darkness.description:
For the duration, magical &Reference[darkness] spreads from a point within range and fills a 15-foot-radius Sphere. Darkvision can't see through it, and nonmagical light can't illuminate it.

Alternatively, you cast the spell on an object that isn't being worn or carried, causing the Darkness to fill a 15-foot Emanation originating from that object. Covering that object with something opaque, such as a bowl or helm, blocks the Darkness.

If any of this spell's area overlaps with an area of Bright Light or Dim Light created by a spell of level 2 or lower, that other spell is dispelled.

materials.value: bat fur and a piece of coal

Faerie Fire.name: Faerie Fire
Faerie Fire.description:
Objects in a 20-foot Cube within range are outlined in blue, green, or violet light (your choice). Each creature in the Cube is also outlined if it fails a Dexterity saving throw. For the duration, objects and affected creatures shed &Reference[dimlight] in a 10-foot radius and can't benefit from the Invisible condition.

Attack rolls against an affected creature or object have Advantage if the attacker can see it.

Outlined.name: Outlined
Outlined.description:
For the duration, objects and affected creatures shed &Reference[dimlight] in a 10-foot radius and can’t benefit from the Invisible condition.

Attack rolls against an affected creature or object have Advantage if the attacker can see it.

Web.name: Web
Web.description:
You conjure a mass of sticky webbing at a point within range. The webs fill a 20-foot Cube there for the duration. The webs are &Reference[difficultterrain], and the area within them is &Reference[lightlyobscured].

If the webs aren't anchored between two solid masses (such as walls or trees) or layered across a floor, wall, or ceiling, the web collapses on itself, and the spell ends at the start of your next turn. Webs layered over a flat surface have a depth of 5 feet.

The first time a creature enters the webs on a turn or starts its turn there, it must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or have the &Reference[restrained] condition while in the webs or until it breaks free.

A creature Restrained by the webs can take an action to make a [[/check ability=str skill=ath dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC. If it succeeds, it is no longer Restrained.

The webs are flammable. Any 5-foot Cube of webs exposed to fire burns away in 1 round, dealing [[/damage 2d4 type=fire]] damage to any creature that starts its turn in the fire.

Legendary Resistance.name: Legendary Resistance
Legendary Resistance.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

Misty Escape.name: Misty Escape
Misty Escape.description:
If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] drops to 0 Hit Points outside its resting place, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] uses Shape-Shift to become mist (no action required). If it can't use Shape-Shift, it is destroyed.

While it has 0 Hit Points in mist form, it can't return to its vampire form, and it must reach its resting place within 2 hours or be destroyed. Once in its resting place, it returns to its vampire form and has the &Reference[Paralyzed apply=false] condition until it regains any Hit Points, and it regains 1 Hit Point after spending 1 hour there.

Paralyzed.name: Paralyzed
Paralyzed.description: Once in its resting place, it returns to its vampire form and has the &Reference[Paralyzed apply=false] condition until it regains any Hit Points, and it regains 1 Hit Point after spending 1 hour there.

Spider Climb.name: Spider Climb
Spider Climb.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

Multiattack (Vampire Form Only).name: Multiattack (Vampire Form Only)
Multiattack (Vampire Form Only).description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item .mmGraveStrike000]]{Grave Strike} attacks and uses [[/item .mmBite0000000000]]{Bite}.

Grave Strike (Vampire Form Only).name: Grave Strike (Vampire Form Only)
Grave Strike (Vampire Form Only).description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC [[lookup @skills.ath.passive]]) from one of two hands.

Grappled.name: Grappled
Grappled.description: If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC [[/check ability=str skill=ath format=long]], see source item for DC) from one of two hands.

Bite (Bat or Vampire Form Only).name: Bite (Bat or Vampire Form Only)
Bite (Bat or Vampire Form Only).description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=ngPzlEI5pVSdBv86]], one [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=ngPzlEI5pVSdBv86]] within [[lookup @range.value activity=ngPzlEI5pVSdBv86]] feet [[lookup @target.affects.special activity=ngPzlEI5pVSdBv86]].

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage. The target's Hit Point maximum decreases by an amount equal to the Necrotic damage taken, and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] regains Hit Points equal to that amount. A Humanoid reduced to 0 Hit Points by this damage and then buried rises the following sunset as a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.aifVampireSpawn0]{Vampire Spawn} under the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s control.

affects.special: that is willing or that has the Grappled, Incapacitated, or Restrained condition

Charm.name: Charm
Charm.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplCharmPerso], requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @abilities.cha.dc]]), and the duration is [[lookup @duration.value activity=fcRXSTOlFJShCl52]] hours. The &Reference[Charmed apply=false] target is a willing recipient of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s [[/item .mmBite0000000000]]{Bite}, the damage of which doesn't end the spell. When the spell ends, the target is unaware it was Charmed by the [[lookup @name lowercase]].

Charm Person.name: Charm Person
Charm Person.description:
One Humanoid you can see within range makes a Wisdom saving throw. It does so with Advantage if you or your allies are fighting it. On a failed save, the target has the &Reference[charmed apply=false] condition until the spell ends or until you or your allies damage it. The Charmed creature is Friendly to you. When the spell ends, the target knows it was Charmed by you.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

Charmed.name: Charmed
Charmed.description: the target has the &Reference[charmed apply=false] condition until the spell ends or until you or your allies damage it. The Charmed creature is Friendly to you. When the spell ends, the target knows it was Charmed by you.

Shape-Shift.name: Shape-Shift
Shape-Shift.description:
If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] isn't in sunlight or running water, it shape-shifts into a Tiny @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmBat00000000000]{bat} (Speed 5 ft., Fly Speed 30 ft.) or a Medium cloud of mist (Speed 5 ft., Fly Speed 20 ft. [hover]), or it returns to its vampire form. Anything it is wearing transforms with it.

While in bat form, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can't speak. Its game statistics, other than its size and Speed, are unchanged.

While in mist form, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can't take any actions, speak, or manipulate objects. It is weightless and can enter an enemy's space and stop there. If air can pass through a space, the mist can do so, but it can't pass through liquid. It has Resistance to all damage, except the damage it takes from sunlight.

Beguile.name: Beguile
Beguile.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplCommand000], requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @abilities.cha.dc]]). The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.

Command.name: Command
Command.description:
You speak a one-word command to a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or follow the command on its next turn. Choose the command from these options:

Approach. The target moves toward you by the shortest and most direct route, ending its turn if it moves within 5 feet of you.

Drop. The target drops whatever it is holding and then ends its turn.

Flee. The target spends its turn moving away from you by the fastest available means.

Grovel. The target has the Prone condition and then ends its turn.

Halt. On its turn, the target doesn't move and takes no action or Bonus Action.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can affect one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

Deathless Strike.name: Deathless Strike
Deathless Strike.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves up to half its Speed, and it makes one [[/item .mmGraveStrike000]]{Grave Strike} attack.

Vampire Weakness.name: Vampire Weakness
Vampire Weakness.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has these weaknesses:

Forbiddance. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can't enter a residence without an invitation from an occupant.

Running Water. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes 20 Acid damage if it ends its turn in running water.

Stake to the Heart. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] is destroyed if a weapon that deals Piercing damage is driven into the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s heart while the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has the Incapacitated condition.

Sunlight. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes 20 Radiant damage if it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has Disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

Disadv. Attacks & Checks.name: Disadv. Attacks & Checks
Disadv. Attacks & Checks.description: While in sunlight, it has Disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

Shield.name: Shield
Shield.description: You gain the Armor Class benefit of a Shield only if you have training with it.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Spell Immunity.name: Spell Immunity
Spell Immunity.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] is immune to three spells chosen by its creator. Typical choices include @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplHeatMetal0]{Heat Metal}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplLightningB]{Lightning Bolt}, and @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMagicMissi]{Magic Missile}.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item Arcane Sword]] attacks.

Spider Climb.name: Spider Climb
Spider Climb.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

Web Walker.name: Web Walker
Web Walker.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] ignores movement restrictions caused by webs, and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] knows the location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]].

Web.name: Web
Web.description:
Dexterity Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=6iMoUgxwYlvfKTXr]], one creature the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=6iMoUgxwYlvfKTXr]] feet.

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition until the web is destroyed (AC 10; HP 5; Vulnerability to Fire damage; Immunity to Poison and Psychic damage).

Restrained.name: Restrained
Restrained.description: The target has the &Reference[Restrained apply] condition until the web is destroyed.

Details.name: Details
Details.text:
A Deity (Lolth) Adventure for

Level 10 Characters

Brave the malicious cruelty of Lolth.

Scene: @UUID[Scene.aifFaneOfFecundi]{Fane Of Fecundity}

Adventure (Import to Run): @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.adventures.Adventure.GqHtQ1CzhmZ9XorO]{Silk and Suffering}

Situation. The Silken Stewards, a sect of fanatical Lolth worshipers (see Forgotten Realms: Heroes of Faerûn), is kidnapping key figures from Neverwinter for ritual sacrifice as part of a broader campaign to destabilize the city.

Hook. The Lord Protector summons the characters to stop the disappearances before a panic sets in, promising [[/award 8000GP]] for their assistance.

Encounters

The adventure consists of these encounters.

The Spider’s Path. The drow are using tunnels that lead up under Neverwinter’s cemetery. As the party follows this route into the Underdark, they navigate a labyrinth of caverns crisscrossed with thick webs. The priests took pains to train a @UUID[Actor.aifRoper00000000]{Roper} that hides among the webs. Packs of [[/r 2d6 + 1]] @UUID[Actor.aifPhaseSpider00]{Phase Spiders} are also drawn to motion on the webs. Eventually, the characters reach the Fane of Fecundity; use the @UUID[Scene.aifFaneOfFecundi]{map} below.

Chapel. This cold, beautiful room is decorated with iconography sacred to Lolth, two intricately carved statues, and luxurious tapestries. Entering the northern part of the room without praying the correct prayer of obeisance causes two @UUID[Actor.aifYochlol000000]{Yochlols} to burst from the two statues and begin combat.

Vestry. Two @UUID[Actor.aifDrowPriestess]{Drow Priestesses of Lolth} meditate in this room and become Hostile if disturbed. A @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.dmgCloakOfArachn]{Cloak of Arachnida} hangs in a locked armoire.

Ritual Chamber. Three @UUID[Actor.aifDrider0000000]{Driders} use this room for magic rituals, occasionally visiting the nursery and spider den.

Trapped Hall. A lurid painting of Lolth in the Demonweb Pits hangs here. Passing by the painting without offering the appropriate prayer to Lolth causes the painting to cast the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDisintegra]{Disintegrate} spell (DC 15) targeting the closest creature. Open jars containing the ashes of prior victims and arranged before the painting hint at the trap.

Nursery. Webs fill this cave, and pulsing, wet egg sacs hanging to the north. Touching the webs alerts two @UUID[Actor.aifDrider0000000]{Driders} who crawl up from the ritual chamber (below) and investigate.

Birthing Chamber. This domed cavern sports a massive statue of Lolth in her spider form. Arrayed before the statue like the legs of a spider are eight nurturing cages, occupied by Neverwinter citizens kept as food for spiderlings who crawl all over them. Hashtuth, a drow @UUID[Actor.aifVampire000000]{Vampire} and priest of Lolth, monitors the victims as the spiders feed. She is assisted by two @UUID[Actor.aifHelmedHorror0]{Helmed Horrors}, each adorned with eight glowing ruby eyes. The captives are still alive and can be rescued.

Spider Den. [[/r 3d6]] @UUID[Actor.aifGiantSpider00]{Giant Spiders} lair here. They threaten the characters but flee and hide if attacked.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.book.JournalEntry.aifAtlas00000000.JournalEntryPage.I76Va5b71QQ3Auqo caption=false]

The Blight on Soubar.name: The Blight on Soubar
The Blight on Soubar.description:
A Region (Arcane Empires) Adventure for

Level 12 Characters

End an outbreak of deadly plague.

Situation. Sewer Plague (see chapter 3 of the Dungeon Master’s Guide) has broken out in Soubar, near Baldur’s Gate. Powerful magic is necessary to counteract the magical contagion.

Hook. Soubar’s mayor hires the characters to assist the elf Stormshade (Medium Druid), who has devised a cure for the contagion.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two attacks, using [[/item .mmVineStaff00000]] or [[/item .mmVerdantWisp000]] in any combination.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDruidcraft]{Druidcraft}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplSpeakwithA]{Speak with Animals}

2/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplEntangle00]{Entangle}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplThunderwav]{Thunderwave}

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplAnimalMess]{Animal Messenger}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplLongstride]{Longstrider}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMoonbeam00]{Moonbeam}

Druidcraft.name: Druidcraft
Druidcraft.description:
Whispering to the spirits of nature, you create one of the following effects within range.

Weather Sensor. You create a Tiny, harmless sensory effect that predicts what the weather will be at your location for the next 24 hours. The effect might manifest as a golden orb for clear skies, a cloud for rain, falling snowflakes for snow, and so on. This effect persists for 1 round.

Bloom. You instantly make a flower blossom, a seed pod open, or a leaf bud bloom.

Sensory Effect. You create a harmless sensory effect, such as falling leaves, spectral dancing fairies, a gentle breeze, the sound of an animal, or the faint odor of skunk. The effect must fit in a 5-foot Cube.

Fire Play. You light or snuff out a candle, a torch, or a campfire.

Speak with Animals.name: Speak with Animals
Speak with Animals.description:
For the duration, you can comprehend and verbally communicate with Beasts, and you can use any of the Influence action's skill options with them.

Most Beasts have little to say about topics that don't pertain to survival or companionship, but at minimum, a Beast can give you information about nearby locations and monsters, including whatever it has perceived within the past day.

Entangle.name: Entangle
Entangle.description:
Grasping plants sprout from the ground in a 20-foot square within range. For the duration, these plants turn the ground in the area into &Reference[difficultterrain]. They disappear when the spell ends.

Each creature (other than you) in the area when you cast the spell must succeed on a Strength saving throw or have the &Reference[restrained apply=false] condition until the spell ends. A Restrained creature can take an action to make a [[/check ability=str skill=ath dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself from the grasping plants and is no longer Restrained by them.

Restrained.name: Restrained
Restrained.description: A Restrained creature can take an action to make a [[/check ability=str skill=ath]] check against your spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself from the grasping plants and is no longer Restrained by them.

Thunderwave.name: Thunderwave
Thunderwave.description:
You unleash a wave of thunderous energy. Each creature in a 15-foot Cube originating from you makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 2d8 Thunder damage and is pushed 10 feet away from you. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only.

In addition, unsecured objects that are entirely within the Cube are pushed 10 feet away from you, and a thunderous boom is audible within 300 feet.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for each spell slot level above 1.

Animal Messenger.name: Animal Messenger
Animal Messenger.description:
A Tiny Beast of your choice that you can see within range must succeed on a Charisma saving throw, or it attempts to deliver a message for you (if the target's Challenge Rating isn't 0, it automatically succeeds). You specify a location you have visited and a recipient who matches a general description, such as "a person dressed in the uniform of the town guard" or "a red-haired dwarf wearing a pointed hat." You also communicate a message of up to twenty-five words. The Beast travels for the duration toward the specified location, covering about 25 miles per 24 hours or 50 miles if the Beast can fly.

When the Beast arrives, it delivers your message to the creature that you described, mimicking your communication. If the Beast doesn't reach its destination before the spell ends, the message is lost, and the Beast returns to where you cast the spell.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The spell's duration increases by 48 hours for each spell slot level above 2.

Carrying Message.name: Carrying Message
Carrying Message.description:
The Beast travels for the duration toward the specified location, covering about 25 miles per 24 hours or 50 miles if the Beast can fly.

When the Beast arrives, it delivers your message to the creature that you described, mimicking your communication. If the Beast doesn’t reach its destination before the spell ends, the message is lost, and the Beast returns to where you cast the spell.

Longstrider.name: Longstrider
Longstrider.description:
You touch a creature. The target's Speed increases by 10 feet until the spell ends.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

Longstrider.name: Longstrider
Longstrider.description: The target’s Speed increases by 10 feet until the spell ends.

Moonbeam.name: Moonbeam
Moonbeam.description:
A silvery beam of pale light shines down in a 5-foot-radius, 40-foot-high Cylinder centered on a point within range. Until the spell ends, Dim Light fills the Cylinder, and you can take a Magic action on later turns to move the Cylinder up to 60 feet.

When the Cylinder appears, each creature in it makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 2d10 Radiant damage, and if the creature is shape-shifted (as a result of the Polymorph spell, for example), it reverts to its true form and can't shape-shift until it leaves the Cylinder. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only. A creature also makes this save when the spell's area moves into its space and when it enters the spell's area or ends its turn there. A creature makes this save only once per turn.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot.The damage increases by 1d10 for each spell slot level above 2.

Spider Climb.name: Spider Climb
Spider Climb.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item .mmClaw0000000000]] attacks and uses [[/item .mmBite0000000000]].

Claw.name: Claw
Claw.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC [[lookup @skills.ath.passive]]) from one of two claws.

Grappled.name: Grappled
Grappled.description: If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC [[/check ability=str skill=ath format=long]], see source item for DC) from one of two claws.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=7mBlINHfcabm0DAr]], one creature within [[lookup @range.value activity=7mBlINHfcabm0DAr]] feet that is willing or that has the Grappled, Incapacitated, or Restrained condition.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage. The target's Hit Point maximum decreases by an amount equal to the Necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains Hit Points equal to that amount.

Deathless Agility.name: Deathless Agility
Deathless Agility.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes the &Reference[Dash] or &Reference[Disengage] action.

Vampire Weakness.name: Vampire Weakness
Vampire Weakness.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has these weaknesses:

Forbiddance. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can't enter a residence without an invitation from an occupant.

Running Water. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes 20 Acid damage if it ends its turn in running water.

Stake to the Heart. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] is destroyed if a weapon that deals Piercing damage is driven into the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s heart while the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has the Incapacitated condition.

Sunlight. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes 20 Radiant damage if it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has Disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

Disadv. Attacks & Checks.name: Disadv. Attacks & Checks
Disadv. Attacks & Checks.description: While in sunlight, it has Disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

Amphibious.name: Amphibious
Amphibious.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can breathe air and water.

Legendary Resistance.name: Legendary Resistance
Legendary Resistance.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three [[/item Rend]] attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of [[/item Spellcasting]] to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMelfsAcidA]{Melf's Acid Arrow} (level 3 version).

Acid Breath.name: Acid Breath
Acid Breath.description:
Dexterity Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=qNI6W02jCUQbPpYE]], each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=qNI6W02jCUQbPpYE]] in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=qNI6W02jCUQbPpYE]]-foot-long, [[lookup @target.template.width activity=qNI6W02jCUQbPpYE]]-foot-wide Line.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Success: Half damage.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]], +9 to hit with spell attacks):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDetectMagi]{Detect Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplFear000000]{Fear}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMelfsAcidA]{Melf's Acid Arrow} (level 3 version)

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplSpeakwithD]{Speak with Dead}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplVitriolicS]{Vitriolic Sphere}

Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell's school of magic.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Fear.name: Fear
Fear.description:
Each creature in a 30-foot Cone must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or drop whatever it is holding and have the &Reference[frightened apply=false] condition for the duration.

A Frightened creature takes the &Reference[dash] action and moves away from you by the safest route on each of its turns unless there is nowhere to move. If the creature ends its turn in a space where it doesn't have line of sight to you, the creature makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a successful save, the spell ends on that creature.

Fear.name: Fear
Fear.description: A &Reference[frightened apply=false] creature takes the &Reference[dash] action and moves away from you by the safest route on each of its turns unless there is nowhere to move. If the creature ends its turn in a space where it doesn’t have line of sight to you, the creature makes a [[/save ability=wis]] saving throw. On a successful save, the spell ends on that creature.

Melf's Acid Arrow.name: Melf's Acid Arrow
Melf's Acid Arrow.description:
A shimmering green arrow streaks toward a target within range and bursts in a spray of acid. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 4d4 Acid damage and 2d4 Acid damage at the end of its next turn. On a miss, the arrow splashes the target with acid for half as much of the initial damage only.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage (both initial and later) increases by 1d4 for each spell slot level above 2.

Lingering Acid.name: Lingering Acid
Lingering Acid.description: On a hit, the target takes 4d4 Acid damage and [[/damage 2d4 type=acid]] (plus 1d4 per spell slot level above 2) Acid damage at the end of its next turn.

Speak with Dead.name: Speak with Dead
Speak with Dead.description:
You grant the semblance of life to a corpse of your choice within range, allowing it to answer questions you pose. The corpse must have a mouth, and this spell fails if the deceased creature was Undead when it died. The spell also fails if the corpse was the target of this spell within the past 10 days.

Until the spell ends, you can ask the corpse up to five questions. The corpse knows only what it knew in life, including the languages it knew. Answers are usually brief, cryptic, or repetitive, and the corpse is under no compulsion to offer a truthful answer if you are antagonistic toward it or it recognizes you as an enemy. This spell doesn't return the creature's soul to its body, only its animating spirit. Thus, the corpse can't learn new information, doesn't comprehend anything that has happened since it died, and can't speculate about future events.

Vitriolic Sphere.name: Vitriolic Sphere
Vitriolic Sphere.description:
You point at a location within range, and a glowing, 1-foot-diameter ball of acid streaks there and explodes in a 20-foot-radius Sphere. Each creature in that area makes a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 10d4 Acid damage and another [[/damage 5d4 type=acid]] damage at the end of its next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half the initial damage only.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The initial damage increases by 2d4 for each spell slot level above 4.

Lingering Acid.name: Lingering Acid
Lingering Acid.description: The creature takes [[/damage 5d4 type=acid]] damage at the end of its next turn

Cloud of Insects.name: Cloud of Insects
Cloud of Insects.description:
Dexterity Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=0OkFhjOM80ipoNKy]], one creature the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=0OkFhjOM80ipoNKy]] feet.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has Disadvantage on saving throws to maintain &Reference[Concentration} until the end of its next turn.

Failure or Success: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.

Concentration Disadvantage.name: Concentration Disadvantage
Concentration Disadvantage.description: The target has Disadvantage on saving throws to maintain Concentration until the end of its next turn

Frightful Presence.name: Frightful Presence
Frightful Presence.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplFear000000]{Fear}, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @abilities.cha.dc]]). The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.

Pounce.name: Pounce
Pounce.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves up to half its Speed, and it makes one [[/item Rend]] attack.

Commoner.name: Commoner
Commoner.description:
Gear: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepClub000000]{Club}

Commoner

@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.mmAppendixMonste.JournalEntryPage.M7bvUVFcncRjraJP caption=false cite=false classes="no-embed mm free-rules-embed"]

Training.name: Training
Training.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has proficiency in one skill of the DM's choice and has Advantage whenever it makes an ability check using that skill.

Demonic Restoration.name: Demonic Restoration
Demonic Restoration.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] dies outside the Abyss, its body dissolves into ichor, and it gains a new body instantly, reviving with all its Hit Points somewhere in the Abyss.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item .mmShred000000000]] attacks.

Spores.name: Spores
Spores.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=voqQeTnihpy3BTFf]], each creature in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=voqQeTnihpy3BTFf]]-foot Emanation originating from the [[lookup @name lowercase]].

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition and repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. While Poisoned, the target takes [[/damage average activity=ukZveNVmvvtwbDj0]] at the start of each of its turns. Emptying a flask of Holy Water on the target ends the effect early.

Poisoned.name: Poisoned
Poisoned.description: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition and repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Stunning Screech.name: Stunning Screech
Stunning Screech.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=eoIikvnPayaj02oN]], each creature in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=eoIikvnPayaj02oN]]-foot Emanation originating from the [[lookup @name lowercase]] (demons succeed automatically).

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &Reference[Stunned apply=false] condition until the end of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s next turn.

Stunned.name: Stunned
Stunned.description: The target has the &Reference[Stunned apply=false]] condition until the end of the vrock’s next turn.

Details.name: Details
Details.text:
A Region (Arcane Empires) Adventure for

Level 12 Characters

End an outbreak of deadly plague.

Scenes: @UUID[Scene.dmgDragonsLair00]{Dragon's Lair}, @UUID[Scene.dmgFarmstead0000]{Farmstead}

Situation. Sewer Plague (see @UUID[Compendium.dnd-dungeon-masters-guide.content.JournalEntry.dmgDmsToolbox000.JournalEntryPage.PsUeY10v8e07V3g2#magical-contagions]{chapter 3} of the Dungeon Master’s Guide) has broken out in Soubar, near Baldur’s Gate. Powerful magic is necessary to counteract the magical contagion.

Hook. Soubar’s mayor hires the characters to assist the elf Stormshade (Medium @UUID[Actor.aifDruid00000000]{Druid}), who has devised a cure for the contagion.

Encounters

Characters must resolve these encounters.

Collect Night Holly. To perform the cleansing rites, Stormshade needs the consecrated ashes of a branch of night holly. Night holly grows in a thicket in the Fields of the Dead; it resembles mundane holly, but under bright moonlight, its leaves glitter like stars in the night sky. Eight @UUID[Actor.aifVampireSpawn0]{Vampire Spawn} roam the thicket and prey on the party.

Unfortunately, on the night the characters arrive at the thicket, the moon is obscured by clouds. The @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMoonbeam00]{Moonbeam} and @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplFountofMoo]{Fount of Moonlight} spells can be used to bring moonlight to the overcast thicket. Otherwise, a character can identify night holly by taking a Study action and succeeding on a [[/check nature 15 format=long]].

Burn the Holly in Sacred Fire. Once cut, the night holly must be burned in a sacred brazier at a nearby abandoned temple before dawn. The holly takes 1 hour to burn into white ash, but an @UUID[Actor.aifAdultBlackDra]{Adult Black Dragon} now lairs in the temple. Use the @UUID[Scene.dmgDragonsLair00]{Dragon’s Lair} map from appendix B in the Dungeon Master’s Guide for the temple; the brazier is on level 3.

Foundry Note

The dragon is pre-placed on Level 2 of the Dragon Lair map. It is not hidden.
