Perform the Rites. To complete the cleansing rites, the holly ashes must be sprinkled in a well in Soubar. Use the @UUID[Scene.dmgFarmstead0000]{Farmstead} map from appendix B of the Dungeon Master’s Guide.

As soon as the ashes are dispersed, at least three creatures must recite magical words in Druidic around the well for 1 minute; this requires the creatures to maintain Concentration for the duration. Stormshade and four villagers (@UUID[Actor.aifCommoner00000]{Commoners}) join the characters in reciting the words.

When the ritual begins, six @UUID[Actor.aifVrock00000000]{Vrocks} emerge from the well and begin combat. As long as at least three participants maintain Concentration for the ritual’s full duration, the ritual is a success and the Sewer Plague is stopped.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.book.JournalEntry.aifAtlas00000000.JournalEntryPage.Bhdx3cxCr44tGLIz caption=false]

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.book.JournalEntry.aifAtlas00000000.JournalEntryPage.Xparj0UfJHfRFDTA caption=false]

Dread March of the Bone Titan.name: Dread March of the Bone Titan
Dread March of the Bone Titan.description:
A Deity (Kelemvor) Adventure for

Level 7 Characters

Sabotage a colossal necromantic superweapon.

Situation. A massive, walking necropolis called the Bone Titan has emerged from the Trollmoors. Created by an enterprising Archmage named Kryzzik the Profane, this gargantuan titan of crypt stone, bone, and corpses marches inexorably toward the town of Triboar.

Hook. The Knights of the Eternal Order (see Forgotten Realms: Heroes of Faerûn) call on the party to infiltrate the Bone Titan and destroy whatever controls it while the knights attempt to slow it down. The knights pledge a reward of 25,000 GP for the party’s help.

Wand.name: Wand
Wand.description: An @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagArcaneFocus]{Arcane Focus} is bejeweled or carved to channel arcane magic. A Sorcerer, Warlock, or Wizard can use such an item as a Spellcasting Focus.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes four [[/item .mmArcaneBurst000]] attacks.

Misty Step.name: Misty Step
Misty Step.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMistyStep0]{Misty Step}, requiring no spell components and using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

lSbRnSVRWsTQoh2w.name: Misty Step lSbRnSVRWsTQoh2w
lSbRnSVRWsTQoh2w.description: Briefly surrounded by silvery mist, you teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.

Protective Magic.name: Protective Magic
Protective Magic.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplCounterspe]{Counterspell} or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplShield0000]{Shield} in response to the spell's trigger, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

Counterspell.name: Counterspell
Counterspell.description: You attempt to interrupt a creature in the process of casting a spell. The creature makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the spell dissipates with no effect, and the action, Bonus Action, or Reaction used to cast it is wasted. If that spell was cast with a spell slot, the slot isn't expended.

activation.condition: when you see a creature within range casting a spell with Verbal, Somatic, or Material components

Shield.name: Shield
Shield.description: An imperceptible barrier of magical force protects you. Until the start of your next turn, you have a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and you take no damage from @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMagicMissi]{Magic Missile}.

activation.condition: when you are hit by an attack roll or targeted by the Magic Missile spell

Imperceptible Barrier.name: Imperceptible Barrier
Imperceptible Barrier.description: Until the start of your next turn, you have a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and you take no damage from Magic Missile.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDetectMagi]{Detect Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDetectThou]{Detect Thoughts}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDisguiseSe]{Disguise Self}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplInvisibili]{Invisibility}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplLight00000]{Light}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMageArmor0]{Mage Armor} (included in AC), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMageHand00]{Mage Hand}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplPrestidigi]{Prestidigitation}

2/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplFly0000000]{Fly}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplLightningB]{Lightning Bolt} (level 7 version)

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplConeofCold]{Cone of Cold} (level 9 version), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMindBlank0]{Mind Blank} (cast before combat), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplScrying000]{Scrying}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplTeleport00]{Teleport}

Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell's school of magic.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Detect Thoughts.name: Detect Thoughts
Detect Thoughts.description:
You activate one of the effects below. Until the spell ends, you can activate either effect as a Magic action on your later turns.

Sense Thoughts. You sense the presence of thoughts within 30 feet of yourself that belong to creatures that know languages or are telepathic. You don't read the thoughts, but you know that a thinking creature is present.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Read Thoughts. Target one creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself or one creature within 30 feet of yourself that you detected with the Sense Thoughts option. You learn what is most on the target's mind right now. If the target doesn't know any languages and isn't telepathic, you learn nothing.

As a Magic action on your next turn, you can try to probe deeper into the target's mind. If you probe deeper, the target makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, you discern the target's reasoning, emotions, and something that looms large in its mind (such as a worry, love, or hate). On a successful save, the spell ends. Either way, the target knows that you are probing into its mind, and until you shift your attention away from the target's mind, the target can take an action on its turn to make an [[/check ability=int skill=arc dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC, ending the spell on a success.

Disguise Self.name: Disguise Self
Disguise Self.description:
You make yourself—including your clothing, armor, weapons, and other belongings on your person—look different until the spell ends. You can seem 1 foot shorter or taller and can appear heavier or lighter. You must adopt a form that has the same basic arrangement of limbs as you have. Otherwise, the extent of the illusion is up to you.

The changes wrought by this spell fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, if you use this spell to add a hat to your outfit, objects pass through the hat, and anyone who touches it would feel nothing.

To discern that you are disguised, a creature must take the Study action to inspect your appearance and succeed on an [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC.

Disguised.name: Disguised
Disguised.description: To discern that you are disguised, a creature must take the Study action to inspect your appearance and succeed on an [[/check ability=int skill=inv]] check against your spell save DC.

Invisibility.name: Invisibility
Invisibility.description:
A creature you touch has the &Reference[invisible apply=false] condition until the spell ends. The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 2.

Invisible.name: Invisible
Invisible.description: The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Light.name: Light
Light.description:
You touch one Large or smaller object that isn't being worn or carried by someone else. Until the spell ends, the object sheds Bright Light in a 20-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 20 feet. The light can be colored as you like.

Covering the object with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends if you cast it again.

Mage Armor.name: Mage Armor
Mage Armor.description: You touch a willing creature who isn't wearing armor. Until the spell ends, the target's base AC becomes 13 plus its Dexterity modifier. The spell ends early if the target dons armor.

Mage Armor.name: Mage Armor
Mage Armor.description: The target's base AC becomes 13 + its Dexterity modifier.

Prestidigitation.name: Prestidigitation
Prestidigitation.description:
You create a magical effect within range. Choose the effect from the options below. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time.

Sensory Effect. You create an instantaneous, harmless sensory effect, such as a shower of sparks, a puff of wind, faint musical notes, or an odd odor.

Fire Play. You instantaneously light or snuff out a candle, a torch, or a small campfire.

Clean or Soil. You instantaneously clean or soil an object no larger than 1 cubic foot.

Minor Sensation. You chill, warm, or flavor up to 1 cubic foot of nonliving material for 1 hour.

Magic Mark. You make a color, a small mark, or a symbol appear on an object or a surface for 1 hour.

Minor Creation. You create a nonmagical trinket or an illusory image that can fit in your hand. It lasts until the end of your next turn. A trinket can deal no damage and has no monetary worth.

Fly.name: Fly
Fly.description:
You touch a willing creature. For the duration, the target gains a Fly Speed of 60 feet and can hover. When the spell ends, the target falls if it is still aloft unless it can stop the fall.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 3.

Lightning Bolt.name: Lightning Bolt
Lightning Bolt.description:
A stroke of lightning forming a 100-foot-long, 5-foot-wide Line blasts out from you in a direction you choose. Each creature in the Line makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking 8d6 Lightning damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 3.

materials.value: a bit of fur and a crystal rod

Cone of Cold.name: Cone of Cold
Cone of Cold.description:
You unleash a blast of cold air. Each creature in a 60-foot Cone originating from you makes a Constitution saving throw, taking 8d8 Cold damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature killed by this spell becomes a frozen statue until it thaws.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for each spell slot level above 5.

materials.value: a small crystal or glass cone

Mind Blank.name: Mind Blank
Mind Blank.description: Until the spell ends, one willing creature you touch has Immunity to Psychic damage and the Charmed condition. The target is also unaffected by anything that would sense its emotions or alignment, read its thoughts, or magically detect its location, and no spell—not even @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplWish000000]{Wish}—can gather information about the target, observe it remotely, or control its mind.

Scrying.name: Scrying
Scrying.description:
You can see and hear a creature you choose that is on the same plane of existence as you. The target makes a Wisdom saving throw, which is modified (see the tables below) by how well you know the target and the sort of physical connection you have to it. The target doesn't know what it is making the save against, only that it feels uneasy.

Your Knowledge of the Target Is …Save Modifier
Secondhand (heard of the target)+5
Firsthand (met the target)+0
Extensive (know the target well)−5
You Have the Target's …Save Modifier
Picture or other likeness−2
Garment or other possession−4
Body part, lock of hair, or bit of nail−10

On a successful save, the target isn't affected, and you can't use this spell on it again for 24 hours.

On a failed save, the spell creates an Invisible, intangible sensor within 10 feet of the target. You can see and hear through the sensor as if you were there. The sensor moves with the target, remaining within 10 feet of it for the duration. If something can see the sensor, it appears as a luminous orb about the size of your fist.

Instead of targeting a creature, you can target a location you have seen. When you do so, the sensor appears at that location and doesn't move.

materials.value: a focus worth 1,000+ GP, such as a crystal ball, mirror, or water-filled font

affects.special: creature on same plane of existence or a location you have seen
at target location or within 10 feet of target creature

Teleport.name: Teleport
Teleport.description:
This spell instantly transports you and up to eight willing creatures that you can see within range, or a single object that you can see within range, to a destination you select. If you target an object, it must be Large or smaller, and it can't be held or carried by an unwilling creature.

The destination you choose must be known to you, and it must be on the same plane of existence as you. Your familiarity with the destination determines whether you arrive there successfully. The DM rolls [[/gmr 1d100]] and consults the Teleportation Outcome table and the explanations after it.

@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.tables24.RollTable.phbsplTeleportMi]{Teleportation Outcome}
FamiliarityMishapSimilar AreaOff TargetOn Target
Permanent circle———01–00
Linked object———01–00
Very familiar01–0506–1314–2425–00
Seen casually01–3334–4344–5354–00
Viewed once or described01–4344–5354–7374–00
False destination01–5051–00——

Familiarity. Here are the meanings of the terms in the table's Familiarity column:

  • "Permanent circle" means a permanent teleportation circle whose sigil sequence you know.
  • "Linked object" means you possess an object taken from the desired destination within the last six months, such as a book from a wizard's library.
  • "Very familiar" is a place you have visited often, a place you have carefully studied, or a place you can see when you cast the spell.
  • "Seen casually" is a place you have seen more than once but with which you aren't very familiar.
  • "Viewed once or described" is a place you have seen once, possibly using magic, or a place you know through someone else's description, perhaps from a map.
  • "False destination" is a place that doesn't exist. Perhaps you tried to scry an enemy's sanctum but instead viewed an illusion, or you are attempting to teleport to a location that no longer exists.

Mishap. The spell's unpredictable magic results in a difficult journey. Each teleporting creature (or the target object) takes [[/damage 3d10 type=force]] damage, and the DM rerolls on the table to see where you wind up (multiple mishaps can occur, dealing damage each time).

Similar Area. You and your group (or the target object) appear in a different area that's visually or thematically similar to the target area. You appear in the closest similar place. If you are heading for your home laboratory, for example, you might appear in another person's laboratory in the same city.

Off Target. You and your group (or the target object) appear [[/r 2d12]] miles away from the destination in a random direction. Roll [[/r 1d8]] for the direction: 1, east; 2, southeast; 3, south; 4, southwest; 5, west; 6, northwest; 7, north; or 8, northeast.

On Target. You and your group (or the target object) appear where you intended.

affects.special: you and up to eight creatures or one object

Mage Hand.name: Mage Hand
Mage Hand.description:
A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.

When you cast the spell, you can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial.

As a Magic action on your later turns, you can control the hand thus again. As part of that action, you can move the hand up to 30 feet.

The hand can't attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

Mage Armor.name: Mage Armor
Mage Armor.description: The target's base AC becomes 13 + its Dexterity modifier.

Spider Climb.name: Spider Climb
Spider Climb.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item .mmClaw0000000000]] attacks and uses [[/item .mmBite0000000000]].

Claw.name: Claw
Claw.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC [[lookup @skills.ath.passive]]) from one of two claws.

Grappled.name: Grappled
Grappled.description: If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC [[/check ability=str skill=ath format=long]], see source item for DC) from one of two claws.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=7mBlINHfcabm0DAr]], one creature within [[lookup @range.value activity=7mBlINHfcabm0DAr]] feet that is willing or that has the Grappled, Incapacitated, or Restrained condition.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage. The target's Hit Point maximum decreases by an amount equal to the Necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains Hit Points equal to that amount.

Deathless Agility.name: Deathless Agility
Deathless Agility.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes the &Reference[Dash] or &Reference[Disengage] action.

Vampire Weakness.name: Vampire Weakness
Vampire Weakness.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has these weaknesses:

Forbiddance. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can't enter a residence without an invitation from an occupant.

Running Water. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes 20 Acid damage if it ends its turn in running water.

Stake to the Heart. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] is destroyed if a weapon that deals Piercing damage is driven into the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s heart while the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has the Incapacitated condition.

Sunlight. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes 20 Radiant damage if it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has Disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

Disadv. Attacks & Checks.name: Disadv. Attacks & Checks
Disadv. Attacks & Checks.description: While in sunlight, it has Disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

Aversion to Fire.name: Aversion to Fire
Aversion to Fire.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes Fire damage, it has Disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

Averse.name: Averse
Averse.description: It has Disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

Berserk.name: Berserk
Berserk.description:
Whenever the [[lookup @name lowercase]] starts its turn &Reference[Bloodied], roll [[/r 1d6]]. On a 6, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] goes berserk. On each of its turns while berserk, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] attacks the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] attacks an object. Once the [[lookup @name lowercase]] goes berserk, it remains so until it is destroyed or it is no longer Bloodied.

The [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s creator, if within [[lookup @range.value activity=tnkOsrSwEElO2kZM]] feet of the berserk [[lookup @name lowercase]], can try to calm it by taking an action to make a [[/check ability=cha skill=per dc=@abilities.str.dc]] DC 15 Charisma (Persuasion) check; the golem must be able to hear its creator. If this check succeeds, the golem ceases being berserk until the start of its next turn, at which point it resumes rolling for the Berserk trait again if it is still Bloodied.

Berserk.name: Berserk
Berserk.description: On each of its turns while berserk, the creature attacks the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the creature attacks an object. Once the creature goes berserk, it remains so until it is destroyed or it is no longer &Reference[Bloodied apply=false].

Lightning Absorption.name: Lightning Absorption
Lightning Absorption.description: Whenever the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is subjected to Lightning damage, it regains a number of Hit Points equal to the Lightning damage dealt.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item Slam]] attacks.

Death Knight Aspirant.name: Death Knight Aspirant
Death Knight Aspirant.description:
Death Knight Aspirant

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmAppendixMonste.JournalEntryPage.IC2tkedmjZBt4733 caption=false cite=false classes="no-embed mm"]

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmAppendixMonste.JournalEntryPage.YODr1hp93SXFKzLn caption=false cite=false classes="no-embed mm"]

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Marshal Undead.name: Marshal Undead
Marshal Undead.description: [[lookup @target.affects.special activity=WbzFmVAOPQ7eL6IW]] creatures of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s choice (excluding itself) in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=WbzFmVAOPQ7eL6IW]]-foot Emanation originating from it have Advantage on attack rolls and saving throws. It can’t use this trait if it has the Incapacitated condition.

Adv: Attacks & Saves.name: Adv: Attacks & Saves
Adv: Attacks & Saves.description: The creature has Advantage on attack rolls and saving throws. It can’t use this trait if it has the Incapacitated condition.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three [[/item .mOFhWkASKsQxw6ni]] attacks.

Hellfire Orb.name: Hellfire Orb
Hellfire Orb.description:
Dexterity Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=q3tW0wl3eLe2rDU9]], each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=q3tW0wl3eLe2rDU9]] in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=q3tW0wl3eLe2rDU9]]-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=q3tW0wl3eLe2rDU9]] feet.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Success: Half damage.

Parry.name: Parry
Parry.description: Trigger: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] is [[lookup @activation.condition activity=aLG3BRZL7P6OEjwd]]. Response: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] adds [[lookup @roll.formula activity=aLG3BRZL7P6OEjwd]] to its AC against that attack, possibly causing it to miss.

Use.name: Use
Use.condition: hit by a melee attack roll while holding a weapon

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplPhantomSte]{Phantom Steed}

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDestructiv]{Destructive Wave} (Necrotic), @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDispelMagi]{Dispel Magic}

Phantom Steed.name: Phantom Steed
Phantom Steed.description:
A Large, quasi-real, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.actors.Actor.phbsumPhantomSte]{horselike creature} appears on the ground in an unoccupied space of your choice within range. You decide the creature’s appearance, and it is equipped with a saddle, bit, and bridle. Any of the equipment created by the spell vanishes in a puff of smoke if it is carried more than 10 feet away from the steed.

For the duration, you or a creature you choose can ride the steed. The steed uses the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.actors.Actor.phbmobRidingHors]{Riding Horse} stat block (see appendix B), except it has a Speed of 100 feet and can travel 13 miles in an hour. When the spell ends, the steed gradually fades, giving the rider 1 minute to dismount. The spell ends early if the steed takes any damage.

Destructive Wave.name: Destructive Wave
Destructive Wave.description: Destructive energy ripples outward from you in a 30-foot Emanation. Each creature you choose in the Emanation makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 5d6 Thunder damage and 5d6 Radiant or Necrotic damage (your choice) and has the Prone condition. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage only.

Dispel Magic.name: Dispel Magic
Dispel Magic.description:
Choose one creature, object, or magical effect within range. Any ongoing spell of level 3 or lower on the target ends. For each ongoing spell of level 4 or higher on the target, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability (DC 10 plus that spell’s level). On a successful check, the spell ends.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You automatically end a spell on the target if the spell’s level is equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you use.

Death Cultist.name: Death Cultist
Death Cultist.description:
Gear: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.equipment.Item.phbarmSplintArmo]{Splint Armor}

Cultists

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmAppendixMonste.JournalEntryPage.VICfYukXoYkWJ1yn caption=false cite=false classes="no-embed mm"]

Death Cultist

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmAppendixMonste.JournalEntryPage.n7c1yeBdbTnjOZNX caption=false cite=false classes="no-embed mm"]

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three attacks, using [[/item .mmDreadScythe000]]Dread Scythe or [[/item .mmDeathlyRay0000]] in any combination.

Dread Scythe.name: Dread Scythe
Dread Scythe.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]], and the target can’t regain Hit Points until the end of its next turn.

Healing Restriction.name: Healing Restriction
Healing Restriction.description: The target can’t regain Hit Points until the end of its next turn.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplSpeakwithD]{Speak with Dead}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplThaumaturg]{Thaumaturgy}

Spirit Wail.name: Spirit Wail
Spirit Wail.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=5JzDfoXBTiCay7OP]], each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=5JzDfoXBTiCay7OP]] in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=5JzDfoXBTiCay7OP]]-foot Emanation originating from the [[lookup @name lowercase]].

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the creature has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn.

Success: Half damage only.

Frightened.name: Frightened
Frightened.description: The creature has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn.

Speak with Dead.name: Speak with Dead
Speak with Dead.description:
You grant the semblance of life to a corpse of your choice within range, allowing it to answer questions you pose. The corpse must have a mouth, and this spell fails if the deceased creature was Undead when it died. The spell also fails if the corpse was the target of this spell within the past 10 days.

Until the spell ends, you can ask the corpse up to five questions. The corpse knows only what it knew in life, including the languages it knew. Answers are usually brief, cryptic, or repetitive, and the corpse is under no compulsion to offer a truthful answer if you are antagonistic toward it or it recognizes you as an enemy. This spell doesn’t return the creature’s soul to its body, only its animating spirit. Thus, the corpse can’t learn new information, doesn’t comprehend anything that has happened since it died, and can’t speculate about future events.

Thaumaturgy.name: Thaumaturgy
Thaumaturgy.description:
You manifest a minor wonder within range. You create one of the effects below within range. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time.

Altered Eyes. You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

Booming Voice. Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute. For the duration, you have Advantage on [[/check ability=cha skill=itm]] checks.

Fire Play. You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.

Invisible Hand. You instantaneously cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.

Phantom Sound. You create an instantaneous sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as a rumble of thunder, the cry of a raven, or ominous whispers.

Tremors. You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.

folders.Dread March of the Bone Titan: Dread March of the Bone Titan

Dread March of the Bone Titan.name: Dread March of the Bone Titan

Details.name: Details
Details.text:
A Deity (Kelemvor) Adventure for

Level 7 Characters

Sabotage a colossal necromantic superweapon.

Scene: @UUID[Scene.aifBoneTitan0000]{Bone Titan}

Adventure (Import to Run): @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.adventures.Adventure.M4LA35Xwj9ty8ErO]{Dread March of the Bone Titan}

Situation. A massive, walking necropolis called the Bone Titan has emerged from the Trollmoors. Created by an enterprising @UUID[Actor.aifArchmage00000]{Archmage} named Kryzzik the Profane, this gargantuan titan of crypt stone, bone, and corpses marches inexorably toward the town of Triboar.

Hook. @UUID[Compendium.dnd-heroes-faerun.book.JournalEntry.hofDeitiesOfFaer.JournalEntryPage.xz4iOjZJhiEuRc0B#knights-of-the-eternal-order]{The Knights of the Eternal Order} (see Forgotten Realms: Heroes of Faerûn) call on the party to infiltrate the Bone Titan and destroy whatever controls it while the knights attempt to slow it down. The knights pledge a reward of [[/award 25000GP]] for the party’s help.

Encounters

The adventure consists of these encounters.

March of Desolation. Characters approaching the Bone Titan see ruined villages, dead forests, and cursed land empty of living creatures.

Climb the Colossus. Use the Bone Titan map below for this and subsequent encounters. The party must find a way into the Bone Titan. The interior is warded against teleportation, but entry points at the hips or arms can be reached by flight or by climbing. Eight @UUID[Actor.aifVampireSpawn0]{Vampire Spawn} crawl around the titan’s exterior, defending it from intruders. The necromantic magic of the Bone Titan protects the vampires, preventing them from being affected by sunlight.

Hips. Six @UUID[Actor.aifFleshGolem000]{Flesh Golems} guard @UUID[Actor.aifBarrel0000000]{barrels} of combustible necrotic fuel stored in the hips. Each barrel has AC 15, HP 25, and Vulnerability to Fire damage. Destroying all the barrels halts the Bone Titan after [[/r 1d10]] minutes but doesn’t destroy it.

Torso. Six @UUID[Actor.aifRopeandpullyS]{rope-and-pulley systems} of muscle, tendon, and bone (each AC 11, HP 27) supply power to the titan. Destroying them leaves the titan unable to walk or lift its arms. The torso is defended by three @UUID[Actor.aifDeathKnightAs]{Death Knight Aspirants}.

Arms. The titan’s arms boast cannons firing warheads of necrotic energy. Each cannon is operated by five @UUID[Actor.aifDeathCultist0]{Death Cultists}. Characters who have proficiency in the Arcana or Religion skill can detonate a warhead. Detonating one warhead causes a chain reaction with other warheads, obliterating the arm the warhead is housed in; creatures in the arm when the warhead explodes makes a [[/save 15 dex]] saving throw, taking [[/damage 12d6 fire]] damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Head. Kryzzik steers the Bone Titan from a throne in the head. If the characters stop the titan’s progress, he flees.

Conclusion. Once the Bone Titan’s march is stopped and Kryzzik abandons it, its necromantic aura fades and nature takes over. Within months, the skeletal frame of the titan becomes home to birds and other animals, and locals plunder it for building stone.

Spiritual Weapon.name: Spiritual Weapon
Spiritual Weapon.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplSpiritualW]{Spiritual Weapon} spell, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

z817Et9IPt6qHawH.name: Spiritual Weapon z817Et9IPt6qHawH
z817Et9IPt6qHawH.description:
You create a floating, spectral force that resembles a weapon of your choice and lasts for the duration. The force appears within range in a space of your choice, and you can immediately make one melee spell attack against one creature within 5 feet of the force. On a hit, the target takes Force damage equal to 1d8 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

As a Bonus Action on your later turns, you can move the force up to 20 feet and repeat the attack against a creature within 5 feet of it.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for every slot level above 2.

Light.name: Light
Light.description:
You touch one Large or smaller object that isn't being worn or carried by someone else. Until the spell ends, the object sheds Bright Light in a 20-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 20 feet. The light can be colored as you like.

Covering the object with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends if you cast it again.

Thaumaturgy.name: Thaumaturgy
Thaumaturgy.description:
You manifest a minor wonder within range. You create one of the effects below within range. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time.

Altered Eyes. You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

Booming Voice. Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute. For the duration, you have Advantage on [[/check ability=cha skill=itm]] checks.

Fire Play. You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.

Invisible Hand. You instantaneously cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.

Phantom Sound. You create an instantaneous sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as a rumble of thunder, the cry of a raven, or ominous whispers.

Tremors. You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.

Command.name: Command
Command.description:
You speak a one-word command to a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or follow the command on its next turn. Choose the command from these options:

Approach. The target moves toward you by the shortest and most direct route, ending its turn if it moves within 5 feet of you.

Drop. The target drops whatever it is holding and then ends its turn.

Flee. The target spends its turn moving away from you by the fastest available means.

Grovel. The target has the Prone condition and then ends its turn.

Halt. On its turn, the target doesn't move and takes no action or Bonus Action.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can affect one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

Hold Person.name: Hold Person
Hold Person.description:
Choose a Humanoid that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the &Reference[paralyzed apply=false] condition for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional Humanoid for each spell slot level above 2.

Paralyzed.name: Paralyzed
Paralyzed.description: At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the [[/save ability=wis]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Details.name: Details
Details.text:
A Location (Icewind Dale) Adventure for

Level 3 Characters

Stop a series of cult killings.

Situation. A @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.book.JournalEntry.aifTentownsGazet.JournalEntryPage.GF9kz7TMKfi9HW3S]{cult of Auril} has revived the rite of humanoid sacrifice in Easthaven. Their leader, Nymetra, operates from hiding in @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.book.JournalEntry.aifTentownsGazet.JournalEntryPage.S3dgtf53GPjGCFgA]{Caer-Dineval}.

Hook. Sheriff Markham Southwell (Medium, Lawful Good @UUID[Actor.aifWarriorVetera]{Warrior Veteran}) hires the characters to look into the disappearance of local fisher Bott Witters, husband of elderly innkeeper Vie Witters. Bott was last seen heading up the coast.

Encounters

The adventure consists of these encounters.

Frozen Sacrifice. An hour from town, three @UUID[Actor.aifWolf000000000]{Wolves} scavenge from a fishing boat frozen in thin ice. The boat holds Bott’s corpse, marked with snowflake symbols left behind by cultists of Auril.

Easthaven Killings. The killers are a @UUID[Actor.aifCultistFanati]{Cultist Fanatic} and three @UUID[Actor.aifCultist000000]{Cultists} wearing white masks. Until the characters solve the killings, a body marked with snowflakes is found every [[/r 1d6]] days.

Caer-Dineval. The people of Caer-Dineval worship Auril, and the village is the next settlement up the coast from Bott’s boat. When the party arrives to investigate, three @UUID[Actor.aifImp0000000000]{Imps} break free from the castle to fight the party. Later, Yldreth and Nymetra explain that Auril protects their village from the fiends in the castle. They deny knowledge of the killings.

Cold Court. The cult operates out of an abandoned wooden tower outside Caer-Dineval. Characters might be led to the tower through rumors, tracking cultists in the snow, or divination magic. Each time the characters enter a distinct level of the tower, roll on the following table, ignoring duplicates. As the party explores, they eventually find a ritual table and list of future sacrifices approved by “Ice-Knife Nymetra.” Their own names are listed.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.tables.RollTable.aifEncColdCourtX rollable classes="caption-top" resultLabel="Encounter" caption=false]

Ice-Knife Nymetra. Nymetra (Medium, Neutral Evil @UUID[Actor.aifBerserker0000]{Berserker}) lives in the tower. She summons [[/r 1d6]] @UUID[Actor.aifIceMephit0000]{Ice Mephits} and fights to the death.

Conclusion. If Nymetra is slain, the cult disbands, and Yldreth thanks the party for dismantling this schismatic cult of Auril—then asks for their help against the fiends. Each character’s Renown Score with Easthaven and Caer-Dineval increases by 1.

The Curse on Humble Hill.name: The Curse on Humble Hill
The Curse on Humble Hill.description:
A Deity (Chauntea) Adventure for

Level 1 Characters

Explore an alchemist’s lair.

Situation. The hamlet of Humble Hill is beset by failing crops, sickly livestock, and illness.

Hook. The Church of Chauntea has sent Watchful Sister of the Earth Liana (Medium Priest Acolyte), a human member of the Seeds of Cultivation, to assist. She gathers the party and offers them 100 GP each to help her find the root of the sickness.

Divine Aid.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplBless00000]{Bless}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDispelMagi]{Dispel Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplHealingWor]{Healing Word}, or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplLesserRest]{Lesser Restoration}, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

Bless.name: Bless
Bless.description:
You bless up to three creatures within range. Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target adds 1d4 to the attack roll or save.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

Blessed.name: Blessed
Blessed.description: Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target adds 1d4 to the attack roll or save.

Healing Word.name: Healing Word
Healing Word.description:
A creature of your choice that you can see within range regains Hit Points equal to 2d4 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The healing increases by 2d4 for each spell slot level above 1.

Sanctuary.name: Sanctuary
Sanctuary.description: You ward a creature within range. Until the spell ends, any creature who targets the warded creature with an attack roll or a damaging spell must succeed on a [[/save ability=wis dc=@attributes.spell.dc format=long]] or either choose a new target or lose the attack or spell. This spell doesn't protect the warded creature from areas of effect. The spell ends if the warded creature makes an attack roll, casts a spell, or deals damage.

materials.value: a shard of glass from a mirror

The spell ends if the warded creature makes an attack roll, casts a spell, or deals damage.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]], +5 to hit with spell attacks):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMageHand00]{Mage Hand}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplPrestidigi]{Prestidigitation}

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDisguiseSe]{Disguise Self}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplIceKnife00]{Ice Knife}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMageArmor0]{Mage Armor} (included in AC), @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplThunderwav]{Thunderwave}

Mage Hand.name: Mage Hand
Mage Hand.description:
A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.

When you cast the spell, you can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial.

As a Magic action on your later turns, you can control the hand thus again. As part of that action, you can move the hand up to 30 feet.

The hand can’t attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

Prestidigitation.name: Prestidigitation
Prestidigitation.description:
You create a magical effect within range. Choose the effect from the options below. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time.

Sensory Effect. You create an instantaneous, harmless sensory effect, such as a shower of sparks, a puff of wind, faint musical notes, or an odd odor.

Fire Play. You instantaneously light or snuff out a candle, a torch, or a small campfire.

Clean or Soil. You instantaneously clean or soil an object no larger than 1 cubic foot.

Minor Sensation. You chill, warm, or flavor up to 1 cubic foot of nonliving material for 1 hour.

Magic Mark. You make a color, a small mark, or a symbol appear on an object or a surface for 1 hour.

Minor Creation. You create a nonmagical trinket or an illusory image that can fit in your hand. It lasts until the end of your next turn. A trinket can deal no damage and has no monetary worth.

Disguise Self.name: Disguise Self
Disguise Self.description:
You make yourself—including your clothing, armor, weapons, and other belongings on your person—look different until the spell ends. You can seem 1 foot shorter or taller and can appear heavier or lighter. You must adopt a form that has the same basic arrangement of limbs as you have. Otherwise, the extent of the illusion is up to you.

The changes wrought by this spell fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, if you use this spell to add a hat to your outfit, objects pass through the hat, and anyone who touches it would feel nothing.

To discern that you are disguised, a creature must take the Study action to inspect your appearance and succeed on an [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC.

Disguised.name: Disguised
Disguised.description: To discern that you are disguised, a creature must take the Study action to inspect your appearance and succeed on an [[/check ability=int skill=inv]] check against your spell save DC.

Ice Knife.name: Ice Knife
Ice Knife.description:
You create a shard of ice and fling it at one creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 1d10 Piercing damage. Hit or miss, the shard then explodes. The target and each creature within 5 feet of it must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 2d6 Cold damage.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The Cold damage increases by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 1.

materials.value: a drop of water or a piece of ice

Mage Armor.name: Mage Armor
Mage Armor.description: You touch a willing creature who isn’t wearing armor. Until the spell ends, the target’s base AC becomes 13 plus its Dexterity modifier. The spell ends early if the target dons armor.

Mage Armor.name: Mage Armor
Mage Armor.description: The target's base AC becomes 13 + its Dexterity modifier.

Thunderwave.name: Thunderwave
Thunderwave.description:
You unleash a wave of thunderous energy. Each creature in a 15-foot Cube originating from you makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 2d8 Thunder damage and is pushed 10 feet away from you. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only.

In addition, unsecured objects that are entirely within the Cube are pushed 10 feet away from you, and a thunderous boom is audible within 300 feet.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for each spell slot level above 1.

Mage Armor.name: Mage Armor
Mage Armor.description: The target's base AC becomes 13 + its Dexterity modifier.

Constricting Vine.name: Constricting Vine
Constricting Vine.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC [[lookup @skills.ath.passive]]). Until the grapple ends, the target takes [[/damage average activity=7voODpkc7vuuouqM]] damage at the start of each of its turns, and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can’t make Constricting Vine attacks.

Grappled.name: Grappled
Grappled.description: If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC [[/check skill=ath/acr format=long]], see source item for DC).

Entangling Plants.name: Entangling Plants
Entangling Plants.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplEntangle00] spell, using Constitution as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @abilities.con.dc]]).

Entangle.name: Entangle
Entangle.description:
Grasping plants sprout from the ground in a 20-foot square within range. For the duration, these plants turn the ground in the area into &Reference[difficultterrain]. They disappear when the spell ends.

Each creature (other than you) in the area when you cast the spell must succeed on a Strength saving throw or have the &Reference[restrained apply=false] condition until the spell ends. A Restrained creature can take an action to make a [[/check ability=str skill=ath dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself from the grasping plants and is no longer Restrained by them.

Restrained.name: Restrained
Restrained.description: A Restrained creature can take an action to make a [[/check ability=str skill=ath]] check against your spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself from the grasping plants and is no longer Restrained by them.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item .mmBite0000000000]] attacks.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a creature, it is subjected to the following effect.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=F0T3hYR3EtUEMhvs]].

First Failure: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition. While Poisoned, the target's Hit Point maximum doesn't return to normal when finishing a Long Rest, and it repeats the save every 24 hours that elapse, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Subsequent Failures: The Poisoned target's Hit Point maximum decreases by 5 ([[/r 1d10]]).

Poisoned.name: Poisoned
Poisoned.description:
First CON Save Failure: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition. While Poisoned, the target’s Hit Point maximum doesn’t return to normal when finishing a Long Rest, and it repeats the save every 24 hours that elapse, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Subsequent CON Save Failures: The Poisoned target’s Hit Point maximum decreases by 5 ([[/r 1d10]]).</p>

Details.name: Details
Details.text:
A Deity (Chauntea) Adventure for

Level 1 Characters

Explore an alchemist’s lair.

Scene: @UUID[Scene.aifGauntsLab0000]{Gaunts Lab}

Situation. The hamlet of Humble Hill is beset by failing crops, sickly livestock, and illness.

Hook. The Church of Chauntea has sent Watchful Sister of the Earth Liana (Medium @UUID[Actor.aifPriestAcolyte]{Priest Acolyte}), a human member of the Seeds of Cultivation, to assist. She gathers the party and offers them [[/award each 100GP]] to help her find the root of the sickness.

Adventure (Import to Run): @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.adventures.Adventure.OJuc9WnDJDAETIFr]{The Curse on Humble Hill}

Encounters

The adventure consists of these encounters.

Investigating Humble Hill. The people of Humble Hill are wary of the party. Interacting with locals allows the characters to learn the “curse” coincides with a visit from a traveling halfling alchemist named Algar Gaunt (Small, Neutral Evil @UUID[Actor.aifMageApprentic]{Mage Apprentice}), who sold several farmers a “miraculous growth” fertilizer. The fertilizer has corrupted the water table and poisoned crops.

Finding Gaunt. Sister Liana tends the townsfolk and charges the characters with finding Gaunt. As the characters search the region, roll on the table below, rerolling duplicates. After each encounter, a character can make a [[/skill 15 inv]] check. On a successful check, they find a clue that leads them to Gaunt’s lab, which is accessed by way of a stairway leading down from an apparently abandoned overgrown shed.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.tables.RollTable.aifEncFindingGau rollable classes="caption-top" resultLabel="Encounter" caption=false]

Gaunt’s Lab. Use @UUID[Scene.aifGauntsLab0000]{the map} and features below for Gaunt’s lab:

Ooze Chamber. A @UUID[Actor.aifPsychicGrayOo]{Psychic Gray Ooze} lurks in puddles of dirty water. When characters approach, it initiates combat.

Laboratory. Gaunt’s lab notes and equipment can be used to create an antidote to the fertilizer.

Study. Gaunt studies his field notes here. If discovered, he tries to flee through the trapped hallway and up the ladder in his bedroom, which leads back to the surface.

Trap. Medium or larger creatures stepping on the pressure plate activate ceiling nozzles that spray acid. Creatures in the hall make a [[/save 13 dex]] saving throw, taking [[/damage 2d6 Acid]] damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.book.JournalEntry.aifAtlas00000000.JournalEntryPage.BkzM5bHUIcmoR5Nh caption=false]

Hook. The characters are invited to a decadent party at Eomane House on the wrong night.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]], +5 to hit with spell attacks):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMageHand00]{Mage Hand}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplPrestidigi]{Prestidigitation}

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDisguiseSe]{Disguise Self}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplIceKnife00]{Ice Knife}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMageArmor0]{Mage Armor} (included in AC), @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplThunderwav]{Thunderwave}

Mage Hand.name: Mage Hand
Mage Hand.description:
A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.

When you cast the spell, you can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial.

As a Magic action on your later turns, you can control the hand thus again. As part of that action, you can move the hand up to 30 feet.

The hand can’t attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

Prestidigitation.name: Prestidigitation
Prestidigitation.description:
You create a magical effect within range. Choose the effect from the options below. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time.

Sensory Effect. You create an instantaneous, harmless sensory effect, such as a shower of sparks, a puff of wind, faint musical notes, or an odd odor.

Fire Play. You instantaneously light or snuff out a candle, a torch, or a small campfire.

Clean or Soil. You instantaneously clean or soil an object no larger than 1 cubic foot.

Minor Sensation. You chill, warm, or flavor up to 1 cubic foot of nonliving material for 1 hour.

Magic Mark. You make a color, a small mark, or a symbol appear on an object or a surface for 1 hour.

Minor Creation. You create a nonmagical trinket or an illusory image that can fit in your hand. It lasts until the end of your next turn. A trinket can deal no damage and has no monetary worth.

Disguise Self.name: Disguise Self
Disguise Self.description:
You make yourself—including your clothing, armor, weapons, and other belongings on your person—look different until the spell ends. You can seem 1 foot shorter or taller and can appear heavier or lighter. You must adopt a form that has the same basic arrangement of limbs as you have. Otherwise, the extent of the illusion is up to you.

The changes wrought by this spell fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, if you use this spell to add a hat to your outfit, objects pass through the hat, and anyone who touches it would feel nothing.

To discern that you are disguised, a creature must take the Study action to inspect your appearance and succeed on an [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC.

Disguised.name: Disguised
Disguised.description: To discern that you are disguised, a creature must take the Study action to inspect your appearance and succeed on an [[/check ability=int skill=inv]] check against your spell save DC.

Ice Knife.name: Ice Knife
Ice Knife.description:
You create a shard of ice and fling it at one creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 1d10 Piercing damage. Hit or miss, the shard then explodes. The target and each creature within 5 feet of it must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 2d6 Cold damage.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The Cold damage increases by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 1.

materials.value: a drop of water or a piece of ice

Mage Armor.name: Mage Armor
Mage Armor.description: You touch a willing creature who isn’t wearing armor. Until the spell ends, the target’s base AC becomes 13 plus its Dexterity modifier. The spell ends early if the target dons armor.

Mage Armor.name: Mage Armor
Mage Armor.description: The target's base AC becomes 13 + its Dexterity modifier.

Thunderwave.name: Thunderwave
Thunderwave.description:
You unleash a wave of thunderous energy. Each creature in a 15-foot Cube originating from you makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 2d8 Thunder damage and is pushed 10 feet away from you. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only.

In addition, unsecured objects that are entirely within the Cube are pushed 10 feet away from you, and a thunderous boom is audible within 300 feet.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for each spell slot level above 1.

Mage Armor.name: Mage Armor
Mage Armor.description: The target's base AC becomes 13 + its Dexterity modifier.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Invisibility.name: Invisibility
Invisibility.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplInvisibili]{Invisibility} on itself, requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability.

BGYUyh36nOQKX4Pr.name: Invisibility BGYUyh36nOQKX4Pr
BGYUyh36nOQKX4Pr.description:
A creature you touch has the &Reference[invisible apply=false] condition until the spell ends. The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 2.

Invisible.name: Invisible
Invisible.description: The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Shape-Shift.name: Shape-Shift
Shape-Shift.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] shape-shifts to resemble a rat (Speed 20 ft.), a raven (20 ft., Fly 60 ft.), or a spider (20 ft., Climb 20 ft.), or it returns to its true form. Its game statistics are the same in each form, except for its Speed. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]], +4 to hit with spell attacks):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplLight00000]{Light}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplThaumaturg]{Thaumaturgy}

2/Day: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplCommand000]{Command}

1/Day: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplHoldPerson]{Hold Person}

Spiritual Weapon.name: Spiritual Weapon
Spiritual Weapon.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplSpiritualW]{Spiritual Weapon} spell, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

z817Et9IPt6qHawH.name: Spiritual Weapon z817Et9IPt6qHawH
z817Et9IPt6qHawH.description:
You create a floating, spectral force that resembles a weapon of your choice and lasts for the duration. The force appears within range in a space of your choice, and you can immediately make one melee spell attack against one creature within 5 feet of the force. On a hit, the target takes Force damage equal to 1d8 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

As a Bonus Action on your later turns, you can move the force up to 20 feet and repeat the attack against a creature within 5 feet of it.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for every slot level above 2.

Light.name: Light
Light.description:
You touch one Large or smaller object that isn't being worn or carried by someone else. Until the spell ends, the object sheds Bright Light in a 20-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 20 feet. The light can be colored as you like.

Covering the object with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends if you cast it again.

Thaumaturgy.name: Thaumaturgy
Thaumaturgy.description:
You manifest a minor wonder within range. You create one of the effects below within range. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time.

Altered Eyes. You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

Booming Voice. Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute. For the duration, you have Advantage on [[/check ability=cha skill=itm]] checks.

Fire Play. You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.

Invisible Hand. You instantaneously cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.

Phantom Sound. You create an instantaneous sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as a rumble of thunder, the cry of a raven, or ominous whispers.

Tremors. You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.

Command.name: Command
Command.description:
You speak a one-word command to a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or follow the command on its next turn. Choose the command from these options:

Approach. The target moves toward you by the shortest and most direct route, ending its turn if it moves within 5 feet of you.

Drop. The target drops whatever it is holding and then ends its turn.

Flee. The target spends its turn moving away from you by the fastest available means.

Grovel. The target has the Prone condition and then ends its turn.

Halt. On its turn, the target doesn't move and takes no action or Bonus Action.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can affect one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

Hold Person.name: Hold Person
Hold Person.description:
Choose a Humanoid that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the &Reference[paralyzed apply=false] condition for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional Humanoid for each spell slot level above 2.

Paralyzed.name: Paralyzed
Paralyzed.description: At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the [[/save ability=wis]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Guard.name: Guard
Guard.description:
Gear: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbarmChainShirt]{Chain Shirt}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbarmShield0000]{Shield}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepSpear00000]{Spear}

Guards

Guard

Shield.name: Shield
Shield.description: You gain the Armor Class benefit of a Shield only if you have training with it.

Ethereal Sight.name: Ethereal Sight
Ethereal Sight.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane when it is on the Material Plane.

Incorporeal Movement.name: Incorporeal Movement
Incorporeal Movement.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can move through other creatures and objects as if they were &Reference[Difficult Terrain]. It takes [[/damage 1d10 average type=force]] damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item .yf1Nf7oPWS4arOOL]] attacks.

Etherealness.name: Etherealness
Etherealness.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplEtherealne]{Etherealness} spell, requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] is visible on the Material Plane while on the Border Ethereal and vice versa, but it can't affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.

88qd0Ulz7AMzouDU.name: Etherealness 88qd0Ulz7AMzouDU
88qd0Ulz7AMzouDU.description:
You step into the border regions of the Ethereal Plane, where it overlaps with your current plane. You remain in the Border Ethereal for the duration. During this time, you can move in any direction. If you move up or down, every foot of movement costs an extra foot. You can perceive the plane you left, which looks gray, and you can't see anything there more than 60 feet away.

While on the Ethereal Plane, you can affect and be affected only by creatures, objects, and effects on that plane. Creatures that aren't on the Ethereal Plane can't perceive or interact with you unless a feature gives them the ability to do so.

When the spell ends, you return to the plane you left in the spot that corresponds to your space in the Border Ethereal. If you appear in an occupied space, you are shunted to the nearest unoccupied space and take Force damage equal to twice the number of feet you are moved.

This spell ends instantly if you cast it while you are on the Ethereal Plane or a plane that doesn't border it, such as one of the Outer Planes.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot.You can target up to three willing creatures (including yourself) for each spell slot level above 7. The creatures must be within 10 feet of you when you cast the spell.

Horrific Visage.name: Horrific Visage
Horrific Visage.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=v8KiqUloIE5eocSu]], each creature in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=v8KiqUloIE5eocSu]]-foot Cone that can see the [[lookup @name lowercase]] and isn't an Undead.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition until the start of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s next turn.

Success: The target is immune to this [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s Horrifying Visage for 24 hours.

Frightened.name: Frightened
Frightened.description: The target has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition until the start of the attacking creature's next turn.

Possession.name: Possession
Possession.description:
Charisma Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=7gmNBVjwuYTyANMe]], one [[lookup @target.affects.special activity=7gmNBVjwuYTyANMe]] the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=7gmNBVjwuYTyANMe]] feet.

Failure: The target is possessed by the [[lookup @name lowercase]]; the [[lookup @name lowercase]] disappears, and the target has the &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] condition and loses control of its body. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] now controls the body, but the target retains awareness. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, except ones that specifically target Undead. The [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s game statistics are the same, except it uses the possessed target's Speed, as well as the target's Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution modifiers.

The possession lasts until the body drops to 0 Hit Points or the [[lookup @name lowercase]] leaves as a Bonus Action. When the possession ends, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] appears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the target, and the target is immune to this ghost's Possession for 24 hours.

Success: The target is immune to this [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s Possession for 24 hours.

Incapacitated.name: Incapacitated
Incapacitated.description: The target has the &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] condition and loses control of its body.

Details.name: Details
Details.text:
A Location (Baldur's Gate) Adventure for

Level 4 Characters

Survive a lethal invitation.

Scene: @UUID[Scene.aifEomaneHouse00]{Eomane House}

Adventure (Import to Run): @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.adventures.Adventure.QIsCIw3GL1yOAIAa]{Blood Night}

Situation. The four wicked scions of Eomane House (see “@UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.book.JournalEntry.aifBaldursGateGa.JournalEntryPage.NQ1uNs56RPWjf6kN]{Upper City}”) host a party that’s secretly a murderous competition to honor Bhaal.

Hook. The characters are invited to a decadent party at Eomane House on the wrong night.

Encounters

The adventure consists of these encounters.

Pleasant Welcome. A @UUID[Actor.aifSpy0000000000]{Spy} serving Trentellar Eomane invites characters into the library, serves drinks, and introduces other guests, who tell the characters about the four Eomane siblings.

Murder Contest. Dolandre Eomane’s booming voice echoes through the house, gleefully informing guests the house is now magically sealed and the Eomanes are competing to murder the most guests for their patron, Bhaal. The other guests scatter and try to hide or escape.

Eomanes. The Eomanes roam the house separately. The family members are as follows:

Dolandre Eomane. Dolandre (Medium, Lawful Evil @UUID[Actor.aifPerformer0000]{Performer}) relishes in the violence, with a @UUID[Actor.aifBarbedDevil00]{Barbed Devil} named Mister Pointy Hugs at her side.

Nysene Eomane. Nysene (Medium, Lawful Evil @UUID[Actor.aifNoble00000000]{Noble}) pulls animals from a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.dmgRustBagofTric]{Bag of Tricks} (rust) to torment her quarry.

Russora Eomane. Russora (Small, Neutral Evil @UUID[Actor.aifMageApprentic]{Mage Apprentice}) instructs four @UUID[Actor.aifImp0000000000]{Imp} minions to help her fight.

Trentellar Eomane. Trentellar (Medium, Neutral Evil @UUID[Actor.aifCultistFanati]{Cultist Fanatic}) commands four bloodthirsty @UUID[Actor.aifSpy0000000000]{Spies} who consider him a divine agent of Bhaal.

The House. Doors and windows exiting the house can’t be opened and have Immunity to all damage.

The Survivor. Before the party, the Eomanes ritually murdered their hirelings—whose corpses adorn various rooms—but they missed a human hireling named Bilwen (Medium @UUID[Actor.aifGuard00000000]{Guard}) who is hiding in the barracks. Bilwen shares that the only escape involves climbing down the outside of the house from the rooftop garden.

Ghost in the Garden. The Lawful Neutral @UUID[Actor.aifGhost00000000]{Ghost} of the former owner of the house, Fellumbur Delce, haunts the garden at night. The Eomanes murdered him when they moved in. He can be put to rest by sharing the house’s deed, which he hid in the library before he died. (The Eomanes don’t know about it.) Fellumbur promises the deed to those who kill all four Eomanes. Killing them also unseals the house’s exits.

Conclusion. If the characters defeat the Eomanes, they can keep the manor as their Bastion.

Foundry Note

Location of the NPCs:

  1. Trentellar Eomane is in the Arcane Study on the east side of the house next to the library. The spies are in the library and the main hallway near the front door.

  2. Dolandre Eomane and the devil are in the workshop on the west side of the house.

  3. Nysene Eomane is in a junk room on the second floor nearest the NW stairs.

  4. The guard Bilwen is in the barracks on the SW side of the second floor.

  5. Russora Eomane.and the imps are on the third floor in the junk room on the east side of the house.

  6. The ghost, Fellumbur Delce, is in the third-floor garden but hidden.

Hook. The characters are visiting the temple when screams of panic and fleeing patrons signal a crisis. The high priest of the temple slams the doors to the Forgotten Wing and breathlessly asks the characters to investigate.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting

1/Day: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplTashasHide]{Tasha’s Hideous Laughter} (level 3 version)

Tasha's Hideous Laughter.name: Tasha's Hideous Laughter
Tasha's Hideous Laughter.description:
One creature of your choice that you can see within range makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it has the &Reference[prone apply=false] and &Reference[incapacitated apply=false] conditions for the duration. During that time, it laughs uncontrollably if it’s capable of laughter, and it can’t end the Prone condition on itself.

At the end of each of its turns and each time it takes damage, it makes another [[/save ability=wis dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] saving throw. The target has Advantage on the save if the save is triggered by damage. On a successful save, the spell ends.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level about 1.

Uncontrollable Laughter.name: Uncontrollable Laughter
Uncontrollable Laughter.description:
has the &Reference[prone apply=false] and &Reference[incapacitated apply=false] conditions for the duration. During that time, it laughs uncontrollably if it’s capable of laughter, and it can’t end the Prone condition on itself.

At the end of each of its turns and each time it takes damage, it makes another [[/save ability=wis dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] saving throw. The target has Advantage on the save if the save is triggered by damage. On a successful save, the spell ends.

Minor Illusion.name: Minor Illusion
Minor Illusion.description:
You create a sound or an image of an object within range that lasts for the duration. See the descriptions below for the effects of each. The illusion ends if you cast this spell again.

If a creature takes a Study action to examine the sound or image, the creature can determine that it is an illusion with a successful [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the illusion becomes faint to the creature.

Sound. If you create a sound, its volume can range from a whisper to a scream. It can be your voice, someone else’s voice, a lion’s roar, a beating of drums, or any other sound you choose. The sound continues unabated throughout the duration, or you can make discrete sounds at different times before the spell ends.

Image. If you create an image of an object—such as a chair, muddy footprints, or a small chest—it must be no larger than a 5-foot Cube. The image can’t create sound, light, smell, or any other sensory effect. Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, since things can pass through it.

Prestidigitation.name: Prestidigitation
Prestidigitation.description:
You create a magical effect within range. Choose the effect from the options below. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time.

Sensory Effect. You create an instantaneous, harmless sensory effect, such as a shower of sparks, a puff of wind, faint musical notes, or an odd odor.

Fire Play. You instantaneously light or snuff out a candle, a torch, or a small campfire.

Clean or Soil. You instantaneously clean or soil an object no larger than 1 cubic foot.

Minor Sensation. You chill, warm, or flavor up to 1 cubic foot of nonliving material for 1 hour.

Magic Mark. You make a color, a small mark, or a symbol appear on an object or a surface for 1 hour.

Minor Creation. You create a nonmagical trinket or an illusory image that can fit in your hand. It lasts until the end of your next turn. A trinket can deal no damage and has no monetary worth.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplBless00000]{Bless}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplLesserRest]{Lesser Restoration} (as an action)

Bless.name: Bless
Bless.description:
You bless up to three creatures within range. Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target adds 1d4 to the attack roll or save.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

Blessed.name: Blessed
Blessed.description: Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target adds 1d4 to the attack roll or save.

Lesser Restoration.name: Lesser Restoration
Lesser Restoration.description: You touch a creature and end one condition on it: &Reference[blinded], &Reference[deafened], &Reference[paralyzed], or &Reference[poisoned].

Healing Word.name: Healing Word
Healing Word.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplHealingWor]{Healing Word}, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

myomZEnYjGO4ePQh.name: Healing Word myomZEnYjGO4ePQh
myomZEnYjGO4ePQh.description:
A creature of your choice that you can see within range regains Hit Points equal to 2d4 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The healing increases by 2d4 for each spell slot level above 1.

Shielded Mind.name: Shielded Mind
Shielded Mind.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s thoughts can’t be read by any means, and other creatures can communicate with it telepathically only if it allows them.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]], and the target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the end of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s next turn.

Poisoned.name: Poisoned
Poisoned.description: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the end of the biter's next turn.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage. The target has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC [[lookup @skills.ath.passive]]), and it has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition until the grapple ends.

Grappled and Restrained.name: Grappled and Restrained

Escape Tests (see source item for DC)

[[/check skill=ath ability=str]]
