Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectEvil]{Detect Evil and Good}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectMagi]{Detect Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectThou]{Detect Thoughts}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplShapechang]{Shapechange} (Beast or Humanoid form only, no Temporary Hit Points gained from the spell, and no Concentration or Temporary Hit Points required to maintain the spell)

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplCreateFood]{Create Food and Water}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDream00000]{Dream}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplGreaterRes]{Greater Restoration}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplScrying000]{Scrying}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplSleep00000]{Sleep}

Detect Evil and Good.name: Detect Evil and Good
Detect Evil and Good.description:
For the duration, you sense the location of any Aberration, Celestial, Elemental, Fey, Fiend, or Undead within 30 feet of yourself. You also sense whether the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplHallow0000]{Hallow} spell is active there and, if so, where.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell’s school of magic.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Detect Thoughts.name: Detect Thoughts
Detect Thoughts.description:
You activate one of the effects below. Until the spell ends, you can activate either effect as a Magic action on your later turns.

Sense Thoughts. You sense the presence of thoughts within 30 feet of yourself that belong to creatures that know languages or are telepathic. You don’t read the thoughts, but you know that a thinking creature is present.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Read Thoughts. Target one creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself or one creature within 30 feet of yourself that you detected with the Sense Thoughts option. You learn what is most on the target’s mind right now. If the target doesn’t know any languages and isn’t telepathic, you learn nothing.

As a Magic action on your next turn, you can try to probe deeper into the target’s mind. If you probe deeper, the target makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, you discern the target’s reasoning, emotions, and something that looms large in its mind (such as a worry, love, or hate). On a successful save, the spell ends. Either way, the target knows that you are probing into its mind, and until you shift your attention away from the target’s mind, the target can take an action on its turn to make an [[/check ability=int skill=arc dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC, ending the spell on a success.

Shapechange.name: Shapechange
Shapechange.description:
You shape-shift into another creature for the duration or until you take a Magic action to shape-shift into a different eligible form. The new form must be of a creature that has a Challenge Rating no higher than your level or Challenge Rating. You must have seen the sort of creature before, and it can’t be a Construct or an Undead.

When you shape-shift, you gain a number of Temporary Hit Points equal to the Hit Points of the form. The spell ends early if you have no Temporary Hit Points left.

Your game statistics are replaced by the stat block of the chosen form, but you retain your creature type; alignment; personality; Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores; Hit Points; Hit Point Dice; proficiencies; and ability to communicate. If you have the Spellcasting feature, you retain it too.

Upon shape-shifting, you determine whether your equipment drops to the ground or changes in size and shape to fit the new form while you’re in it.

Create Food and Water.name: Create Food and Water
Create Food and Water.description: You create 45 pounds of food and 30 gallons of fresh water on the ground or in containers within range—both useful in fending off the hazards of malnutrition and dehydration. The food is bland but nourishing and looks like a food of your choice, and the water is clean. The food spoils after 24 hours if uneaten.

Dream.name: Dream
Dream.description:
You target a creature you know on the same plane of existence. You or a willing creature you touch enters a trance state to act as a dream messenger. While in the trance, the messenger is &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] and has a Speed of 0.

If the target is asleep, the messenger appears in the target’s dreams and can converse with the target as long as it remains asleep, through the spell’s duration. The messenger can also shape the dream’s environment, creating landscapes, objects, and other images. The messenger can emerge from the trance at any time, ending the spell. The target recalls the dream perfectly upon waking.

If the target is awake when you cast the spell, the messenger knows it and can either end the trance (and the spell) or wait for the target to sleep, at which point the messenger enters its dreams.

You can make the messenger terrifying to the target. If you do so, the messenger can deliver a message of no more than ten words, and then the target makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target gains no benefit from its rest, and it takes 3d6 Psychic damage when it wakes up.

Trance State.name: Trance State
Trance State.description: While in the trance, the messenger is Incapacitated and has a Speed of 0.

Greater Restoration.name: Greater Restoration
Greater Restoration.description:
You touch a creature and magically remove one of the following effects from it:

  • 1 &Reference[Exhaustion] level
  • The &Reference[Charmed] or &Reference[Petrified] condition
  • A curse, including the target’s Attunement to a cursed magic item
  • Any reduction to one of the target’s ability scores
  • Any reduction to the target’s Hit Point maximum

materials.value: diamond dust worth 100+ GP, which the spell consumes

Scrying.name: Scrying
Scrying.description:
You can see and hear a creature you choose that is on the same plane of existence as you. The target makes a Wisdom saving throw, which is modified (see the tables below) by how well you know the target and the sort of physical connection you have to it. The target doesn’t know what it is making the save against, only that it feels uneasy.

Your Knowledge of the Target Is …Save Modifier
Secondhand (heard of the target)+5
Firsthand (met the target)+0
Extensive (know the target well)−5
You Have the Target’s …Save Modifier
Picture or other likeness−2
Garment or other possession−4
Body part, lock of hair, or bit of nail−10

On a successful save, the target isn’t affected, and you can’t use this spell on it again for 24 hours.

On a failed save, the spell creates an Invisible, intangible sensor within 10 feet of the target. You can see and hear through the sensor as if you were there. The sensor moves with the target, remaining within 10 feet of it for the duration. If something can see the sensor, it appears as a luminous orb about the size of your fist.

Instead of targeting a creature, you can target a location you have seen. When you do so, the sensor appears at that location and doesn’t move.

materials.value: a focus worth 1,000+ GP, such as a crystal ball, mirror, or water-filled font

affects.special: creature on same plane of existence or a location you have seen
at target location or within 10 feet of target creature

Sleep.name: Sleep
Sleep.description:
Each creature of your choice in a 5-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point within range must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the &Reference[incapacitated apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn, at which point it must repeat the save. If the target fails the second save, the target has the &Reference[unconscious] condition for the duration. The spell ends on a target if it takes damage or someone within 5 feet of it takes an action to shake it out of the spell’s effect.

Creatures that don’t sleep, such as elves, or that have Immunity to the Exhaustion condition automatically succeed on saves against this spell.

materials.value: a pinch of sand or rose petals

Sleeping.name: Sleeping
Sleeping.description: The target has the &Reference[incapacitated apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn, at which point it must repeat the save. If the target fails the second save, the target has the &Reference[unconscious] condition for the duration. The spell ends on a target if it takes damage or someone within 5 feet of it takes an action to shake it out of the spell’s effect.

Demonic Restoration.name: Demonic Restoration
Demonic Restoration.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] dies outside the Abyss, its body dissolves into ichor, and it gains a new body instantly, reviving with all its Hit Points somewhere in the Abyss.

Incorporeal Movement.name: Incorporeal Movement
Incorporeal Movement.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can move through other creatures and objects as if they were &Reference[Difficult Terrain]. It takes [[/damage 1d10 average type=force]] damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

Light Sensitivity.name: Light Sensitivity
Light Sensitivity.description: While in Bright Light, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Disadvantage on attack rolls.

Shadow Stealth.name: Shadow Stealth
Shadow Stealth.description: While in Dim Light or Darkness, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes the &Reference[Hide] action.

Details.name: Details
Details.text:
A Location (Calimshan) Adventure for

Level 4 Characters

Pacify a quartet of troublesome deities.

Scene: @UUID[Scene.aifTempleOfAThou]{Temple Of A Thousand}

Adventure (Import to Run): @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.adventures.Adventure.VDr646k4rbN238nk]{Gods Long Forgotten}

Situation. Calimport’s Temple of a Thousand includes the Forgotten Wing, a space devoted to deities who are no longer worshiped. Some of the gods memorialized there don’t want to be forgotten and cause chaos to remind the world they exist.

Hook. The characters are visiting the temple when screams of panic and fleeing patrons signal a crisis. The high priest of the temple slams the doors to the Forgotten Wing and breathlessly asks the characters to investigate.

Encounters

Use the Temple of a Thousand map earlier in this chapter for this adventure. Four wayward deities are causing the disturbance in the Forgotten Wing. Each deity was represented in the temple by a statue; the deities have manifested in these statues, which have transformed into monsters. Most can be talked down through social interaction or tests of skill. The deities are as follows:

Motanwe. Motanwe is a hunting god once revered by an extinct tribe of steppe nomads. He manifests as a Large stone statue of a horned humanoid (use the @UUID[Actor.aifHelmedHorror0]{Helmed Horror} stat block). He is Indifferent to the party but is angrily grieving his long-dead people. He admires warriors and those with hunting skill.

Nimbus. Nimbus is a god of the sun who resents being overshadowed by, or even considered an aspect of, Lathander. Nimbus manifests as a flying orb of light three feet in diameter (Celestial, Chaotic Good @UUID[Actor.aifEmpyreanIota0]{Empyrean Iota}). Nimbus responds to hopeful, optimistic people and being shown it can still be relevant or useful.

Korus. Korus is a deity of music who manifests as a Celestial @UUID[Actor.aifPerformerMaes]{Performer Maestro}. Korus’s music is stately and formal, out of current fashion. Korus loudly insists artistic skill is the only true measure of a person’s value but really just wants to inspire people again.

Sholoban. Sholoban is a deity of knowledge, riddles, and magic. She manifests as a @UUID[Actor.aifCouatl0000000]{Couatl}. Sholoban knows deities fade in time and is resigned to her fate, but she wants to make sure mortal society has learned something from her time as a god. She engages in riddle contests and tests of ancient lore with knowledgeable characters.

The Hukh. The Hukh is a mysterious, hungry deity propitiated only by blood and sacrifice. It manifests as a @UUID[Actor.aifShadowDemon00]{Shadow Demon}. The Hukh lurks in the shadows and avoids the party, fighting if a character approaches. Other deities fear the Hukh and won’t help the characters defeat it, but they’re relieved if the characters destroy it.

Conclusion. If three of the five deities are propitiated or destroyed, the surviving deities return to their enshrined locations in the Forgotten Wing and vanish, leaving only inanimate statues. The high priest thanks the characters with a @UUID[Compendium.dnd-dungeon-masters-guide.equipment.Item.dmgDecanterOfEnd]{Decanter of Endless Water} and [[/award 100GP]] each.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.book.JournalEntry.aifAtlas00000000.JournalEntryPage.nfXSk57nEziyeJxT caption=false]

Shadow of the Watch.name: Shadow of the Watch
Shadow of the Watch.description:
A Deity (Helm) Adventure for

Level 6 Characters

Bring peace to an embattled forest.

Situation. A group of fey and other forest dwellers angry at overhunting and logging in the forest have intercepted a caravan under the protection of Helm’s Everwatch Knights. The caravan was bound for the village of Noanar’s Hold on the north edge of the High Forest, and carries critical winter supplies, but now the forest folk hold it hostage.

Hook. Desperate for a solution, the village’s human mayor Nolan Foxglove (Medium Noble) offers the party 3,000 GP in gemstones to locate the missing caravan and secure its return. Foxglove and others in the village consider the forest folk lawless brigands.

Noble.name: Noble
Noble.description:
Gear: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbarmBreastplat]{Breastplate}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepRapier0000]{Rapier}

Nobles

@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.mmAppendixMonste.JournalEntryPage.TVskfAu471arcBTq caption=false cite=false classes="no-embed mm"]

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMinorIllus]{Minor Illusion}

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplBlindnessD]{Blindness/Deafness}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplFaerieFire]{Faerie Fire}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplGrease0000]{Grease}

Jinx.name: Jinx
Jinx.description:
Trigger: A creature the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see hits it with an attack roll.

Response—Wisdom Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=02KFzL9fElzyHOIT]], the triggering creature.

Failure: The attack misses instead.

Save.name: Save
Save.condition: A creature the goblin can see hits it with an attack roll.

Minor Illusion.name: Minor Illusion
Minor Illusion.description:
You create a sound or an image of an object within range that lasts for the duration. See the descriptions below for the effects of each. The illusion ends if you cast this spell again.

If a creature takes a Study action to examine the sound or image, the creature can determine that it is an illusion with a successful [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the illusion becomes faint to the creature.

Sound. If you create a sound, its volume can range from a whisper to a scream. It can be your voice, someone else’s voice, a lion’s roar, a beating of drums, or any other sound you choose. The sound continues unabated throughout the duration, or you can make discrete sounds at different times before the spell ends.

Image. If you create an image of an object—such as a chair, muddy footprints, or a small chest—it must be no larger than a 5-foot Cube. The image can’t create sound, light, smell, or any other sensory effect. Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, since things can pass through it.

Blindness/Deafness.name: Blindness/Deafness
Blindness/Deafness.description:
One creature that you can see within range must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, or it has the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] or &Reference[Deafened apply=false] condition (your choice) for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 2.

Blindness.name: Blindness
Blindness.description: At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the [[/save ability=con]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Deafness.name: Deafness
Deafness.description: At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the [[/save ability=con]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Faerie Fire.name: Faerie Fire
Faerie Fire.description:
Objects in a 20-foot Cube within range are outlined in blue, green, or violet light (your choice). Each creature in the Cube is also outlined if it fails a Dexterity saving throw. For the duration, objects and affected creatures shed &Reference[dimlight] in a 10-foot radius and can’t benefit from the Invisible condition.

Attack rolls against an affected creature or object have Advantage if the attacker can see it.

Outlined.name: Outlined
Outlined.description:
For the duration, objects and affected creatures shed &Reference[dimlight] in a 10-foot radius and can’t benefit from the Invisible condition.

Attack rolls against an affected creature or object have Advantage if the attacker can see it.

Grease.name: Grease
Grease.description:
Nonflammable grease covers the ground in a 10-foot square centered on a point within range and turns it into &Reference[difficultterrain] for the duration.

When the grease appears, each creature standing in its area must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or have the &Reference[prone] condition. A creature that enters the area or ends its turn there must also succeed on that save or fall Prone.

materials.value: a bit of pork rind or butter

Flame Trident.name: Flame Trident
Flame Trident.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. Hit or Miss: The trident magically returns to the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s hand immediately after a ranged attack.

Inferno Blast.name: Inferno Blast
Inferno Blast.description:
Dexterity Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=ta7GjruJh1oJ4cz3]], each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=ta7GjruJh1oJ4cz3]] in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=ta7GjruJh1oJ4cz3]]-[[lookup @target.template.units activity=ta7GjruJh1oJ4cz3]]-radius [[lookup @target.template.type capitalize activity=ta7GjruJh1oJ4cz3]] centered on a point the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=ta7GjruJh1oJ4cz3]] [[lookup @range.units activity=ta7GjruJh1oJ4cz3]].

Failure: [[/damage average activity=ta7GjruJh1oJ4cz3]] damage, and the target starts burning, taking [[/damage average activity=cuIDOQ2o3dMRhqzd]] damage at the start of each of its turns instead of the normal burning damage. The target gains 1 &Reference[Exhaustion apply=false] level whenever it takes this burning damage.

Success: Half damage only.

Foundry Note

This feature provides an Active Effect that will modify the targeted object. Due to the fact that effect can be applied multiple times, the effect needs to be dragged from this item's Effect tab onto the target item's sheet each time the target gains a level of exhaustion after the initial level is applied.

Exhaustion.name: Exhaustion
Exhaustion.description: The target gains 1 &Reference[Exhaustion apply=false] level whenever it takes this burning damage.

Blazing Movement.name: Blazing Movement
Blazing Movement.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves up to its Speed without provoking &Reference[OpportunityAttacks]. During this movement, fire fills a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=MUbX28KmoDF9sC5b]]-foot Emanation originating from the [[lookup @name lowercase]]. When the Emanation enters a creature’s space, that creature takes [[/damage average]] damage. A creature [[lookup @target.affects.special activity=MUbX28KmoDF9sC5b]].

affects.special: can take this damage only once per turn

Entangling Trail.name: Entangling Trail
Entangling Trail.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves up to its Speed without provoking &Reference[OpportunityAttacks]. Each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=fKlN5QustrK7LaSG]] within [[lookup @target.template.size activity=fKlN5QustrK7LaSG]] feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] as it moves is targeted once by the following effect.

Strength Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=fKlN5QustrK7LaSG]].

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn.

Restrained.name: Restrained
Restrained.description: The target has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn.

Druidcraft.name: Druidcraft
Druidcraft.description:
Whispering to the spirits of nature, you create one of the following effects within range.

Weather Sensor. You create a Tiny, harmless sensory effect that predicts what the weather will be at your location for the next 24 hours. The effect might manifest as a golden orb for clear skies, a cloud for rain, falling snowflakes for snow, and so on. This effect persists for 1 round.

Bloom. You instantly make a flower blossom, a seed pod open, or a leaf bud bloom.

Sensory Effect. You create a harmless sensory effect, such as falling leaves, spectral dancing fairies, a gentle breeze, the sound of an animal, or the faint odor of skunk. The effect must fit in a 5-foot Cube.

Fire Play. You light or snuff out a candle, a torch, or a campfire.

Speak with Animals.name: Speak with Animals
Speak with Animals.description:
For the duration, you can comprehend and verbally communicate with Beasts, and you can use any of the Influence action’s skill options with them.

Most Beasts have little to say about topics that don’t pertain to survival or companionship, but at minimum, a Beast can give you information about nearby locations and monsters, including whatever it has perceived within the past day.

Commoner.description:

Commoner

@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.mmAppendixMonste.JournalEntryPage.M7bvUVFcncRjraJP caption=false cite=false classes="no-embed mm free-rules-embed"]

Training.name: Training
Training.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has proficiency in one skill of the DM's choice and has Advantage whenever it makes an ability check using that skill.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two attacks, using [[/item .hRwqUlEyM9TjOmHy]] or [[/item .mmRadiantFlame00]] in any combination.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability:

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplLight00000]{Light}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplThaumaturg]{Thaumaturgy}

1/Day: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplSpiritGuar]{Spirit Guardians}

Divine Aid.name: Divine Aid
Divine Aid.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplBless00000]{Bless}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDispelMagi]{Dispel Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplHealingWor]{Healing Word}, or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplLesserRest]{Lesser Restoration}, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

Bless.name: Bless
Bless.description:
You bless up to three creatures within range. Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target adds 1d4 to the attack roll or save.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

Blessed.name: Blessed
Blessed.description: Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target adds 1d4 to the attack roll or save.

Dispel Magic.name: Dispel Magic
Dispel Magic.description:
Choose one creature, object, or magical effect within range. Any ongoing spell of level 3 or lower on the target ends. For each ongoing spell of level 4 or higher on the target, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability (DC 10 plus that spell's level). On a successful check, the spell ends.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You automatically end a spell on the target if the spell's level is equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you use.

Healing Word.name: Healing Word
Healing Word.description:
A creature of your choice that you can see within range regains Hit Points equal to 2d4 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The healing increases by 2d4 for each spell slot level above 1.

Lesser Restoration.name: Lesser Restoration
Lesser Restoration.description: You touch a creature and end one condition on it: &Reference[blinded], &Reference[deafened], &Reference[paralyzed], or &Reference[poisoned].

Light.name: Light
Light.description:
You touch one Large or smaller object that isn't being worn or carried by someone else. Until the spell ends, the object sheds Bright Light in a 20-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 20 feet. The light can be colored as you like.

Covering the object with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends if you cast it again.

Thaumaturgy.name: Thaumaturgy
Thaumaturgy.description:
You manifest a minor wonder within range. You create one of the effects below within range. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time.

Altered Eyes. You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

Booming Voice. Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute. For the duration, you have Advantage on [[/check ability=cha skill=itm]] checks.

Fire Play. You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.

Invisible Hand. You instantaneously cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.

Phantom Sound. You create an instantaneous sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as a rumble of thunder, the cry of a raven, or ominous whispers.

Tremors. You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.

Spiritual Weapon.name: Spiritual Weapon
Spiritual Weapon.description:
You create a floating, spectral force that resembles a weapon of your choice and lasts for the duration. The force appears within range in a space of your choice, and you can immediately make one melee spell attack against one creature within 5 feet of the force. On a hit, the target takes Force damage equal to 1d8 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

As a Bonus Action on your later turns, you can move the force up to 20 feet and repeat the attack against a creature within 5 feet of it.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for every slot level above 2.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two attacks, using [[/item .mmVineStaff00000]] or [[/item .mmVerdantWisp000]] in any combination.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDruidcraft]{Druidcraft}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplSpeakwithA]{Speak with Animals}

2/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplEntangle00]{Entangle}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplThunderwav]{Thunderwave}

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplAnimalMess]{Animal Messenger}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplLongstride]{Longstrider}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMoonbeam00]{Moonbeam}

Druidcraft.name: Druidcraft
Druidcraft.description:
Whispering to the spirits of nature, you create one of the following effects within range.

Weather Sensor. You create a Tiny, harmless sensory effect that predicts what the weather will be at your location for the next 24 hours. The effect might manifest as a golden orb for clear skies, a cloud for rain, falling snowflakes for snow, and so on. This effect persists for 1 round.

Bloom. You instantly make a flower blossom, a seed pod open, or a leaf bud bloom.

Sensory Effect. You create a harmless sensory effect, such as falling leaves, spectral dancing fairies, a gentle breeze, the sound of an animal, or the faint odor of skunk. The effect must fit in a 5-foot Cube.

Fire Play. You light or snuff out a candle, a torch, or a campfire.

Speak with Animals.name: Speak with Animals
Speak with Animals.description:
For the duration, you can comprehend and verbally communicate with Beasts, and you can use any of the Influence action's skill options with them.

Most Beasts have little to say about topics that don't pertain to survival or companionship, but at minimum, a Beast can give you information about nearby locations and monsters, including whatever it has perceived within the past day.

Entangle.name: Entangle
Entangle.description:
Grasping plants sprout from the ground in a 20-foot square within range. For the duration, these plants turn the ground in the area into &Reference[difficultterrain]. They disappear when the spell ends.

Each creature (other than you) in the area when you cast the spell must succeed on a Strength saving throw or have the &Reference[restrained apply=false] condition until the spell ends. A Restrained creature can take an action to make a [[/check ability=str skill=ath dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself from the grasping plants and is no longer Restrained by them.

Restrained.name: Restrained
Restrained.description: A Restrained creature can take an action to make a [[/check ability=str skill=ath]] check against your spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself from the grasping plants and is no longer Restrained by them.

Thunderwave.name: Thunderwave
Thunderwave.description:
You unleash a wave of thunderous energy. Each creature in a 15-foot Cube originating from you makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 2d8 Thunder damage and is pushed 10 feet away from you. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only.

In addition, unsecured objects that are entirely within the Cube are pushed 10 feet away from you, and a thunderous boom is audible within 300 feet.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for each spell slot level above 1.

Animal Messenger.name: Animal Messenger
Animal Messenger.description:
A Tiny Beast of your choice that you can see within range must succeed on a Charisma saving throw, or it attempts to deliver a message for you (if the target's Challenge Rating isn't 0, it automatically succeeds). You specify a location you have visited and a recipient who matches a general description, such as "a person dressed in the uniform of the town guard" or "a red-haired dwarf wearing a pointed hat." You also communicate a message of up to twenty-five words. The Beast travels for the duration toward the specified location, covering about 25 miles per 24 hours or 50 miles if the Beast can fly.

When the Beast arrives, it delivers your message to the creature that you described, mimicking your communication. If the Beast doesn't reach its destination before the spell ends, the message is lost, and the Beast returns to where you cast the spell.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The spell's duration increases by 48 hours for each spell slot level above 2.

Carrying Message.name: Carrying Message
Carrying Message.description:
The Beast travels for the duration toward the specified location, covering about 25 miles per 24 hours or 50 miles if the Beast can fly.

When the Beast arrives, it delivers your message to the creature that you described, mimicking your communication. If the Beast doesn’t reach its destination before the spell ends, the message is lost, and the Beast returns to where you cast the spell.

Longstrider.name: Longstrider
Longstrider.description:
You touch a creature. The target's Speed increases by 10 feet until the spell ends.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

Longstrider.name: Longstrider
Longstrider.description: The target’s Speed increases by 10 feet until the spell ends.

Moonbeam.name: Moonbeam
Moonbeam.description:
A silvery beam of pale light shines down in a 5-foot-radius, 40-foot-high Cylinder centered on a point within range. Until the spell ends, Dim Light fills the Cylinder, and you can take a Magic action on later turns to move the Cylinder up to 60 feet.

When the Cylinder appears, each creature in it makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 2d10 Radiant damage, and if the creature is shape-shifted (as a result of the Polymorph spell, for example), it reverts to its true form and can't shape-shift until it leaves the Cylinder. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only. A creature also makes this save when the spell's area moves into its space and when it enters the spell's area or ends its turn there. A creature makes this save only once per turn.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot.The damage increases by 1d10 for each spell slot level above 2.

Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item .mmFaerieDust0000]] attacks.

Faerie Dust.name: Faerie Dust
Faerie Dust.description: Melee or Ranged Attack: [[/attack]], reach [[lookup @item.range.reach]] [[lookup @item.range.units]]. or range [[lookup @item.range.value]] [[lookup @item.range.units]]. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] or &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition ([[lookup @name lowercase]]’s choice) until the start of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s next turn.

Charmed.name: Charmed
Charmed.description: The target has the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] condition (attacking creature's choice) until the start of the attacking creature's next turn.

Poisoned.name: Poisoned
Poisoned.description: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition (attacking creature's choice) until the start of the attacking creature's next turn.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDancingLig]{Dancing Lights}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDruidcraft]{Druidcraft}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplInvisibili]{Invisibility} (self only)

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectThou]{Detect Thoughts}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplFly0000000]{Fly}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMajorImage]{Major Image}

Burst of Wonder.name: Burst of Wonder
Burst of Wonder.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplEntangle00]{Entangle}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplPolymorph0]{Polymorph}, or @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplTashasHide]{Tasha's Hideous Laughter}, requiring no Material components and using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

Polymorph.name: Polymorph
Polymorph.description:
You attempt to transform a creature that you can see within range into a Beast. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or shape-shift into a Beast form for the duration. That form can be any Beast you choose that has a Challenge Rating equal to or less than the target’s (or the target’s level if it doesn’t have a Challenge Rating). The target’s game statistics are replaced by the stat block of the chosen Beast, but the target retains its alignment, personality, creature type, Hit Points, and Hit Point Dice. See appendix B for a sample of Beast stat blocks.

The target gains a number of Temporary Hit Points equal to the Hit Points of the Beast form. The spell ends early on the target if it has no Temporary Hit Points left.

The target is limited in the actions it can perform by the anatomy of its new form, and it can’t speak or cast spells.

The target’s gear melds into the new form. The creature can’t use or otherwise benefit from any of that equipment.

Entangle.name: Entangle
Entangle.description:
Grasping plants sprout from the ground in a 20-foot square within range. For the duration, these plants turn the ground in the area into &Reference[difficultterrain]. They disappear when the spell ends.

Each creature (other than you) in the area when you cast the spell must succeed on a Strength saving throw or have the &Reference[restrained apply=false] condition until the spell ends. A Restrained creature can take an action to make a [[/check ability=str skill=ath dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself from the grasping plants and is no longer Restrained by them.

Restrained.name: Restrained
Restrained.description: A Restrained creature can take an action to make a [[/check ability=str skill=ath]] check against your spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself from the grasping plants and is no longer Restrained by them.

Tasha's Hideous Laughter.name: Tasha's Hideous Laughter
Tasha's Hideous Laughter.description:
One creature of your choice that you can see within range makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it has the &Reference[prone apply=false] and &Reference[incapacitated apply=false] conditions for the duration. During that time, it laughs uncontrollably if it’s capable of laughter, and it can’t end the Prone condition on itself.

At the end of each of its turns and each time it takes damage, it makes another [[/save ability=wis dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] saving throw. The target has Advantage on the save if the save is triggered by damage. On a successful save, the spell ends.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level about 1.

Uncontrollable Laughter.name: Uncontrollable Laughter
Uncontrollable Laughter.description:
has the &Reference[prone apply=false] and &Reference[incapacitated apply=false] conditions for the duration. During that time, it laughs uncontrollably if it’s capable of laughter, and it can’t end the Prone condition on itself.

At the end of each of its turns and each time it takes damage, it makes another [[/save ability=wis dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] saving throw. The target has Advantage on the save if the save is triggered by damage. On a successful save, the spell ends.

Dancing Lights.name: Dancing Lights
Dancing Lights.description:
You create up to four torch-size lights within range, making them appear as torches, lanterns, or glowing orbs that hover for the duration. Alternatively, you combine the four lights into one glowing Medium form that is vaguely humanlike. Whichever form you choose, each light sheds Dim Light in a 10-foot radius.

As a Bonus Action, you can move the lights up to 60 feet to a space within range. A light must be within 20 feet of another light created by this spell, and a light vanishes if it exceeds the spell’s range.

Druidcraft.name: Druidcraft
Druidcraft.description:
Whispering to the spirits of nature, you create one of the following effects within range.

Weather Sensor. You create a Tiny, harmless sensory effect that predicts what the weather will be at your location for the next 24 hours. The effect might manifest as a golden orb for clear skies, a cloud for rain, falling snowflakes for snow, and so on. This effect persists for 1 round.

Bloom. You instantly make a flower blossom, a seed pod open, or a leaf bud bloom.

Sensory Effect. You create a harmless sensory effect, such as falling leaves, spectral dancing fairies, a gentle breeze, the sound of an animal, or the faint odor of skunk. The effect must fit in a 5-foot Cube.

Fire Play. You light or snuff out a candle, a torch, or a campfire.

Invisibility.name: Invisibility
Invisibility.description:
A creature you touch has the &Reference[invisible apply=false] condition until the spell ends. The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 2.

Invisible.name: Invisible
Invisible.description: The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Detect Thoughts.name: Detect Thoughts
Detect Thoughts.description:
You activate one of the effects below. Until the spell ends, you can activate either effect as a Magic action on your later turns.

Sense Thoughts. You sense the presence of thoughts within 30 feet of yourself that belong to creatures that know languages or are telepathic. You don’t read the thoughts, but you know that a thinking creature is present.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Read Thoughts. Target one creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself or one creature within 30 feet of yourself that you detected with the Sense Thoughts option. You learn what is most on the target’s mind right now. If the target doesn’t know any languages and isn’t telepathic, you learn nothing.

As a Magic action on your next turn, you can try to probe deeper into the target’s mind. If you probe deeper, the target makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, you discern the target’s reasoning, emotions, and something that looms large in its mind (such as a worry, love, or hate). On a successful save, the spell ends. Either way, the target knows that you are probing into its mind, and until you shift your attention away from the target’s mind, the target can take an action on its turn to make an [[/check ability=int skill=arc dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC, ending the spell on a success.

Fly.name: Fly
Fly.description:
You touch a willing creature. For the duration, the target gains a Fly Speed of 60 feet and can hover. When the spell ends, the target falls if it is still aloft unless it can stop the fall.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 3.

Major Image.name: Major Image
Major Image.description:
You create the image of an object, a creature, or some other visible phenomenon that is no larger than a 20-foot Cube. The image appears at a spot that you can see within range and lasts for the duration. It seems real, including sounds, smells, and temperature appropriate to the thing depicted, but it can’t deal damage or cause conditions.

If you are within range of the illusion, you can take a Magic action to cause the image to move to any other spot within range. As the image changes location, you can alter its appearance so that its movements appear natural for the image. For example, if you create an image of a creature and move it, you can alter the image so that it appears to be walking. Similarly, you can cause the illusion to make different sounds at different times, even making it carry on a conversation, for example.

Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, for things can pass through it. A creature that takes a Study action to examine the image can determine that it is an illusion with a successful [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the creature can see through the image, and its other sensory qualities become faint to the creature.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The spell lasts until dispelled, without requiring Concentration, if cast with a level 4+ spell slot.

Details.name: Details
Details.text:
A Deity (Helm) Adventure for

Level 6 Characters

Bring peace to an embattled forest.

Scene: @UUID[Scene.aifForestCamp000]{Forest Camp}

Adventure (Import to Run): @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.adventures.Adventure.W8Qf4VI3YkoWH5me]{Shadow of the Watch}

Situation. A group of fey and other forest dwellers angry at overhunting and logging in the forest have intercepted a caravan under the protection of Helm’s Everwatch Knights. The caravan was bound for the village of Noanar’s Hold on the north edge of the High Forest, and carries critical winter supplies, but now the forest folk hold it hostage.

Hook. Desperate for a solution, the village’s human mayor Nolan Foxglove (Medium @UUID[Actor.aifNoble00000000]{Noble}) offers the party [[/award 3000GP]] in gemstones to locate the missing caravan and secure its return. Foxglove and others in the village consider the forest folk lawless brigands.

Encounters

The adventure consists of these encounters.

Scene of the Crime. The caravan ambush site is several miles from town, in the forest. Footprints and drag marks suggest the caravan members were taken prisoner and the supplies nabbed. The party can follow this trail to the forest camp.

Forest Ambush. Fey defenders of the forest wait along the way. The group consists of a @UUID[Actor.aifGoblinHexer00]{Goblin Hexer}, a @UUID[Actor.aifSalamanderInf]{Satyr Revelmaster}, and three @UUID[Actor.aifBugbearStalke]{Bugbear Stalkers}. They fight while shouting insults at the party for abetting the selfish destruction of the forest. When one is killed, the rest retreat to the forest camp.

Marks of Civilization. Characters traveling through the woods note excessive logging, cruel animal traps, and a dearth of local wildlife, suggesting the fey have a point.

Forest Camp. Use the @UUID[Scene.aifForestCamp000]{map} below. The camp’s inhabitants and main features are listed below:

Main Gate. Two @UUID[Actor.aifBugbearStalke]{Bugbear Stalkers} stand watch on each southern tower. They alert the camp to intruders before engaging in combat.

Hostage Tent. Ironhoof, a @UUID[Actor.aifCentaurWarden]{Centaur Warden}, guards two human drovers (@UUID[Actor.aifCommoner00000]{Commoners}) and Pryat Tomes (Medium, Lawful Good @UUID[Actor.aifPriest0000000]{Priest}), a human member of the Everwatch Knights. Pryat hopes to negotiate a truce between Noanar’s Hold and the fey.

Camp Residents. Four @UUID[Actor.aifDruid00000000]{Druids} rest in the sleeping tent. The paddock houses a @UUID[Actor.aifPrimevalOwlbe]{Primeval Owlbear}. A @UUID[Actor.aifPixieWonderbr]{Pixie Wonderbringer} named Spirella Rainbloom leads the group and moves about the camp.

Fists or Friends. The characters might sneak or force their way into the camp, but negotiation is possible. Spirella is initially Hostile but agrees to return the supplies and free the prisoners in exchange for a binding agreement from locals that the forest will not be hunted or logged until the damage already done has healed. This could take many years.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.book.JournalEntry.aifAtlas00000000.JournalEntryPage.RJo19ZGGNruIZI47 caption=false]

Restoring Freedale.name: Restoring Freedale
Restoring Freedale.description:
A Location (Dalelands) Adventure for

Level 5 Characters

Bring peace and prosperity to the newest dale.

Situation. The characters are asked to reinvigorate the faded settlement of Freedale, but they’ll have to defend it from enemies.

Hook. The Dales Council summons the characters and asks them to become the new leaders of the settlement. They can turn the settlement into their Bastion (see Dalelands Bastions).

2/Day: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMagicMissi]{Magic Missile} (level 2 version)

Mage Hand.name: Mage Hand
Mage Hand.description:
A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.

When you cast the spell, you can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial.

As a Magic action on your later turns, you can control the hand thus again. As part of that action, you can move the hand up to 30 feet.

The hand can’t attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

Magic Missile.name: Magic Missile
Magic Missile.description:
You create three glowing darts of magical force. Each dart strikes a creature of your choice that you can see within range. A dart deals 1d4 + 1 Force damage to its target. The darts all strike simultaneously, and you can direct them to hit one creature or several.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The spell creates one more dart for each spell slot level above 1.

[[2 + @item.level]]{Level [[lookup @item.level]] darts}

Fireball.name: Fireball
Fireball.description:
A bright streak flashes from you to a point you choose within range and then blossoms with a low roar into a fiery explosion. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius Sphere centered on that point makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking 8d6 Fire damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Flammable objects in the area that aren’t being worn or carried start burning.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 3.

materials.value: a ball of bat guano and sulfur

Amorphous.name: Amorphous
Amorphous.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without expending extra movement to do so.

Sunlight Weakness.name: Sunlight Weakness
Sunlight Weakness.description: While in sunlight, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Disadvantage on D20 Tests.

Draining Swipe.name: Draining Swipe
Draining Swipe.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]], and the target's Strength score decreases by [[/r 1d4]]. The target dies if this reduces that score to 0. If a Humanoid is slain by this attack, a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.aifShadow0000000]{Shadow} rises from the corpse [[/r 1d4]] hours later.

Foundry Note

This feature also provides an Active Effect (AE) to modify the target's Strength Score. When the target roll's their d4 to determine the loss, you can apply the respective AE to the target's sheet.

attack.chatFlavor: On Hit: Target's STR score decreases

Bound.name: Bound
Bound.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] is magically bound to an amulet. While the [[lookup @name lowercase]] and its amulet are on the same plane of existence, the amulet’s wearer can telepathically call the [[lookup @name lowercase]] to travel to it, and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] knows the distance and direction to the amulet. If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is within 60 feet of the amulet’s wearer, half of any damage the wearer takes (round up) is transferred to the [[lookup @name lowercase]].

Regeneration.name: Regeneration
Regeneration.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] regains [[lookup @healing.formula activity=5cGvjZJIJVicjJ3d]] Hit Points at the start of each of its turns if it has at least 1 Hit Point.

heal.condition: starts its turn with at least 1 Hit Point

Spell Storing.name: Spell Storing
Spell Storing.description: A spellcaster who wears the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s amulet can cause the [[lookup @name lowercase]] to store one spell of level 4 or lower. To do so, the wearer must cast the spell on the [[lookup @name lowercase]] while within 5 feet of it. The spell has no effect but is stored within the [[lookup @name lowercase]]. Any previously stored spell is lost when a new spell is stored. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can cast the spell stored with any parameters set by the original caster, requiring no spell components and using the caster’s spellcasting ability. The stored spell is then lost.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item Fist]] attacks.

Protection.name: Protection
Protection.description:
Trigger: An attack roll hits the wearer of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s amulet while the wearer is within 5 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]].

Response: The wearer gains a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack and possibly causing it to miss, until the start of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s next turn.

utility.condition: An attack roll hits the wearer of the guardian's amulet while the wearer is within 5 feet of the guardian

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplSpeakwithD]{Speak with Dead}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplThaumaturg]{Thaumaturgy}

Speak with Dead.name: Speak with Dead
Speak with Dead.description:
You grant the semblance of life to a corpse of your choice within range, allowing it to answer questions you pose. The corpse must have a mouth, and this spell fails if the deceased creature was Undead when it died. The spell also fails if the corpse was the target of this spell within the past 10 days.

Until the spell ends, you can ask the corpse up to five questions. The corpse knows only what it knew in life, including the languages it knew. Answers are usually brief, cryptic, or repetitive, and the corpse is under no compulsion to offer a truthful answer if you are antagonistic toward it or it recognizes you as an enemy. This spell doesn’t return the creature’s soul to its body, only its animating spirit. Thus, the corpse can’t learn new information, doesn’t comprehend anything that has happened since it died, and can’t speculate about future events.

Thaumaturgy.name: Thaumaturgy
Thaumaturgy.description:
You manifest a minor wonder within range. You create one of the effects below within range. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time.

Altered Eyes. You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

Booming Voice. Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute. For the duration, you have Advantage on [[/check ability=cha skill=itm]] checks.

Fire Play. You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.

Invisible Hand. You instantaneously cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.

Phantom Sound. You create an instantaneous sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as a rumble of thunder, the cry of a raven, or ominous whispers.

Tremors. You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.

Stench.name: Stench
Stench.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=mJbwhj3beOIB3Jgj]], any creature (other than a [[lookup @name lowercase]]) that starts its turn in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=mJbwhj3beOIB3Jgj]]-foot Emanation originating from the [[lookup @name lowercase]].

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the start of its next turn.

Success: The target is immune to the Stench of all [[lookup @name lowercase]] for 1 hour.

Poisoned.name: Poisoned
Poisoned.description: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the start of its next turn.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplSpeakwithD]{Speak with Dead}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplThaumaturg]{Thaumaturgy}

Spirit Wail.name: Spirit Wail
Spirit Wail.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=5JzDfoXBTiCay7OP]], each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=5JzDfoXBTiCay7OP]] in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=5JzDfoXBTiCay7OP]]-foot Emanation originating from the [[lookup @name lowercase]].

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the creature has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn.

Success: Half damage only.

Frightened.name: Frightened
Frightened.description: The creature has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn.

Speak with Dead.name: Speak with Dead
Speak with Dead.description:
You grant the semblance of life to a corpse of your choice within range, allowing it to answer questions you pose. The corpse must have a mouth, and this spell fails if the deceased creature was Undead when it died. The spell also fails if the corpse was the target of this spell within the past 10 days.

Until the spell ends, you can ask the corpse up to five questions. The corpse knows only what it knew in life, including the languages it knew. Answers are usually brief, cryptic, or repetitive, and the corpse is under no compulsion to offer a truthful answer if you are antagonistic toward it or it recognizes you as an enemy. This spell doesn’t return the creature’s soul to its body, only its animating spirit. Thus, the corpse can’t learn new information, doesn’t comprehend anything that has happened since it died, and can’t speculate about future events.

Thaumaturgy.name: Thaumaturgy
Thaumaturgy.description:
You manifest a minor wonder within range. You create one of the effects below within range. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time.

Altered Eyes. You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

Booming Voice. Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute. For the duration, you have Advantage on [[/check ability=cha skill=itm]] checks.

Fire Play. You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.

Invisible Hand. You instantaneously cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.

Phantom Sound. You create an instantaneous sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as a rumble of thunder, the cry of a raven, or ominous whispers.

Tremors. You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.

Infernal Glaive.name: Infernal Glaive
Infernal Glaive.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a creature and doesn't already have an infernal wound, it is subjected to the following effect.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=4qy3fKL086OAE1xR]].

Failure: The target receives an infernal wound. While wounded, the target loses [[/damage average activity=IS4utGV80LpDrjvt]] Hit Points at the start of each of its turns. The wound closes after 1 minute, after a spell restores Hit Points to the target, or after the target or a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to stanch the wound, doing so by succeeding on a [[/check format=long activity=KNWa0TFhANjmQCds]].

It can't use this trait if it has the Incapacitated condition.

Details.name: Details
Details.text:
A Location (Dalelands) Adventure for

Level 5 Characters

Bring peace and prosperity to the newest dale.

Scene: @UUID[Scene.aifFreedale00000]{Freedale}, @UUID[Scene.aifHarrowHouseCo]{Harrow House}, @UUID[Scene.aifWizardsTower0]{Wizards Tower}

Adventure (Import to Run): @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.adventures.Adventure.WUItuI9nDoze09zU]{Restoring Freedale}

Situation. The characters are asked to reinvigorate the faded settlement of Freedale, but they’ll have to defend it from enemies.

Hook. The Dales Council summons the characters and asks them to become the new leaders of the settlement. They can turn the settlement into their Bastion (see “@UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.book.JournalEntry.aifDmsToolbox000.JournalEntryPage.ubBi2EjRvuZjHW2a]{Dalelands Bastions}”).

Encounters

As the characters settle into Freedale, they must build relationships with the locals and clear out old buildings that house mysterious threats. Use the map of Freedale below. The characters can explore these locations in any order, but the Zhentarim Foes encounter concludes the adventure.

Harrow House. Harrow House, an old mansion far outside the village is haunted by Gunter Weiss, a wizard who died and returned as a @UUID[Actor.aifVampireNightb]{Vampire Nightbringer}. Use the @UUID[Scene.aifHarrowHouseCo]{Spooky House} map in the Dungeon Master’s Guide for Harrow House. Gunter’s various Undead minions—[[/r 1d4]] @UUID[Actor.aifFlameskull000]{Flameskulls} and [[/r 2d6]] @UUID[Actor.aifShadow0000000]{Shadows}—patrol the house.

Wizard’s Tower. Freedale was once home to a wizard named Morganth the Mysterious. His tower stands on the east side of the village; use the @UUID[Scene.aifWizardsTower0]{Wizard’s Tower} map in appendix B of the Dungeon Master’s Guide. The tower is trapped with the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-dungeon-masters-guide.content.JournalEntry.dmgDmsToolbox000.JournalEntryPage.RLB1MPQRqYDR0CtI#fire-casting-statue]{fire-casting statue trap} described in chapter 3 of the Dungeon Master’s Guide. Morganth’s @UUID[Actor.aifShieldGuardia]{Shield Guardian} still patrols the tower; the controlling amulet is on Morganth’s corpse in the tower’s dungeon, where a @UUID[Actor.aifGhastGravecal]{Ghast Gravecaller} now hides, along with three @UUID[Actor.aifGhoul00000000]{Ghouls}.

Temple of Lathander. The Cult of the Dragon secretly performs ghoulish rites by night in this abandoned temple. If the four @UUID[Actor.aifCultist000000]{Cultist Acolytes} and their @UUID[Actor.aifDeathCultist0]{Death Cultist} leader can be routed, the characters could reopen the temple and earn the goodwill of Freehold’s citizens.

Zhentarim Foes. As soon as the characters arrive, Zhentarim agents discourage them from staying and threaten violence. Eventually, the Zhents make good on that threat, attacking Freedale when the Bastion is near completion.

Stage this assault in multiple waves, and describe additional hostile forces fighting any Bastion Defenders the party might have. First, the characters must face a @UUID[Actor.aifToughBoss0000]{Tough Boss} who leads a force of two @UUID[Actor.aifTough00000000]{Toughs} and four @UUID[Actor.aifDireWolf00000]{Dire Wolves}. Then, the Zhents send a shock force of four @UUID[Actor.aifBeardedDevil0]{Bearded Devils} against the characters. If the devils are defeated, the Zhentarim leader (@UUID[Actor.aifAssassin00000]{Assassin}) and five @UUID[Actor.aifTough00000000]{Toughs} fight the party.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.book.JournalEntry.aifAtlas00000000.JournalEntryPage.3Qe4mqUcRdTPNtUy caption=false]

Dougan's Hell.name: Dougan's Hell
Dougan's Hell.description:
A Location (Icewind Dale) Adventure for

Level 6 Characters

Confront a murderous clan.

Situation. The community of Dougan’s Hole is home to a cursed, bloodthirsty cult.

Hook. Surgulio Pondt hires the characters to protect a shipment of mead from Bryn Shander to Targos, passing by Dougan’s Hole.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]], +4 to hit with spell attacks):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplLight00000]{Light}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplThaumaturg]{Thaumaturgy}

2/Day: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplCommand000]{Command}

1/Day: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplHoldPerson]{Hold Person}

Spiritual Weapon.name: Spiritual Weapon
Spiritual Weapon.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplSpiritualW]{Spiritual Weapon} spell, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

z817Et9IPt6qHawH.name: Spiritual Weapon z817Et9IPt6qHawH
z817Et9IPt6qHawH.description:
You create a floating, spectral force that resembles a weapon of your choice and lasts for the duration. The force appears within range in a space of your choice, and you can immediately make one melee spell attack against one creature within 5 feet of the force. On a hit, the target takes Force damage equal to 1d8 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

As a Bonus Action on your later turns, you can move the force up to 20 feet and repeat the attack against a creature within 5 feet of it.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for every slot level above 2.

Light.name: Light
Light.description:
You touch one Large or smaller object that isn't being worn or carried by someone else. Until the spell ends, the object sheds Bright Light in a 20-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 20 feet. The light can be colored as you like.

Covering the object with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends if you cast it again.

Thaumaturgy.name: Thaumaturgy
Thaumaturgy.description:
You manifest a minor wonder within range. You create one of the effects below within range. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time.

Altered Eyes. You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

Booming Voice. Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute. For the duration, you have Advantage on [[/check ability=cha skill=itm]] checks.

Fire Play. You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.

Invisible Hand. You instantaneously cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.

Phantom Sound. You create an instantaneous sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as a rumble of thunder, the cry of a raven, or ominous whispers.

Tremors. You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.

Command.name: Command
Command.description:
You speak a one-word command to a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or follow the command on its next turn. Choose the command from these options:

Approach. The target moves toward you by the shortest and most direct route, ending its turn if it moves within 5 feet of you.

Drop. The target drops whatever it is holding and then ends its turn.

Flee. The target spends its turn moving away from you by the fastest available means.

Grovel. The target has the Prone condition and then ends its turn.

Halt. On its turn, the target doesn't move and takes no action or Bonus Action.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can affect one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

Hold Person.name: Hold Person
Hold Person.description:
Choose a Humanoid that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the &Reference[paralyzed apply=false] condition for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional Humanoid for each spell slot level above 2.

Paralyzed.name: Paralyzed
Paralyzed.description: At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the [[/save ability=wis]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Berserker.description:
Gear: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepGreataxe00]{Greataxe}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbarmHideArmor0]{Hide Armor}

Bloodied Frenzy.name: Bloodied Frenzy
Bloodied Frenzy.description: While &Reference[Bloodied], the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on attack rolls and saving throws.

Luring Song.name: Luring Song
Luring Song.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] sings a magical melody, which lasts until the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s Concentration ends on it.

Wisdom Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=dxxqZP7Vo01te3QB]], each [[lookup @target.affects.special activity=dxxqZP7Vo01te3QB]] in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=dxxqZP7Vo01te3QB]]-foot Emanation originating from the [[lookup @name lowercase]] when the song starts.

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] condition until the song ends and repeats the save at the end of each of its turns. While Charmed, the target has the &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] condition and ignores the Luring Song of other harpies.

If the target is more than 5 feet from the [[lookup @name lowercase]], the target moves on its turn toward the [[lookup @name lowercase]] by the most direct route, trying to get within 5 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]. It doesn’t avoid &Reference[OpportunityAttacks]; however, before moving into damaging terrain (such as lava or a pit) and whenever it takes damage from a source other than the [[lookup @name lowercase]], the target repeats the save.

Success: The target is immune to this [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s Luring Song for 24 hours.

Charmed & Incapacitated.name: Charmed & Incapacitated
Charmed & Incapacitated.description:
The target has the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] condition until the song ends and repeats the save at the end of each of its turns.

While Charmed, the target has the &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] condition.

Spider Climb.name: Spider Climb
Spider Climb.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] uses [[/item .mmParalyzingTent]] and makes one [[/item .mmBite0000000000]] attack.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]].

Paralyzing Tentacles.name: Paralyzing Tentacles
Paralyzing Tentacles.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=p157Iqz8s0M0VilW]], one [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=p157Iqz8s0M0VilW]] the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @target.template.size activity=p157Iqz8s0M0VilW]] feet.

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition and repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After [[lookup @duration.value activity=p157Iqz8s0M0VilW]] [[lookup @duration.units activity=p157Iqz8s0M0VilW]], it succeeds automatically. While Poisoned, the target has the &Reference[Paralyzed apply=false] condition.

Poisoned & Paralyzed.name: Poisoned & Paralyzed

While Poisoned, the target has the &Reference[Paralyzed apply=false] condition.

Beast of Malar.name: Beast of Malar
Beast of Malar.description:
Ferocious, Shape-Changing Predator

Malar, god of the bestial hunt, sometimes manifests a spark of primal predation in physical form: the beast of Malar. The beast of Malar can take three types of forms—a land form, a sea form, and a sky form—to pursue prey across land, seas, and skies. In each form, its short fur is glossy black with red fur around its jaws and claws as though stained by the blood it has spilled.

The beast of Malar has a muscular and unnatural appearance no matter its form; whether it resembles a bat, wolverine, or shark, there’s no mistaking the beast of Malar for a mundane animal. The beast shifts easily between its forms to pursue its prey, using whichever shape suits it best to catch and kill its quarry.

Normally only one beast of Malar exists at a time. However, Malar might create multiple beasts to pursue legendary prey or simply display his extraordinary ferocity.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]].

Claws (Land or Sky Form Only).name: Claws (Land or Sky Form Only)
Claws (Land or Sky Form Only).description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is Large or smaller, it has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Recuperative Shape-Shift.name: Recuperative Shape-Shift
Recuperative Shape-Shift.description: The beast shape-shifts into its land form, sea form, or sky form and regains [[lookup @healing.formula activity=PeY4lqnS9EvxnXWk]] Hit Points. Its game statistics are the same in each form, except where noted. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn’t transformed.

Divine Immortality.name: Divine Immortality
Divine Immortality.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] dies, its body dissolves into black goo, and it gains a new body after [[/r 1d10]] days, reviving with all its Hit Points in a place of Malar’s choosing.

Amphibious.name: Amphibious
Amphibious.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can breathe air and water.

Legendary Resistance.name: Legendary Resistance
Legendary Resistance.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Regeneration.name: Regeneration
Regeneration.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] regains [[lookup @healing.formula activity=5cGvjZJIJVicjJ3d]] Hit Points at the start of each of its turns. If the beast takes Radiant damage or damage from a Critical Hit, this trait doesn’t function at the start of the beast’s next turn. The beast dies only if it starts its turn with 0 Hit Points and doesn’t regenerate.

heal.condition: starts its turn with at least 1 Hit Point

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The beast makes three attacks, using [[/item Bite]] or [[/item .twp2874lhP8h3wCu]]{Claws} in any combination.

Details.name: Details
Details.text:
A Location (Icewind Dale) Adventure for

Level 6 Characters

Confront a murderous clan.

Scene: @UUID[Scene.aifDougansWarren]{Dougans Warren}

Situation. The community of Dougan’s Hole is home to a cursed, bloodthirsty cult.

Hook. Surgulio Pondt (see “@UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.book.JournalEntry.aifTentownsGazet.JournalEntryPage.QlAGjLnZcWPpUOB8]{Targos}”) hires the characters to protect a shipment of mead from @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.book.JournalEntry.aifTentownsGazet.JournalEntryPage.p3X5cvOBlHMvlr0y]{Bryn Shander} to @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.book.JournalEntry.aifTentownsGazet.JournalEntryPage.QlAGjLnZcWPpUOB8]{Targos}, passing by Dougan’s Hole.

Encounters

The adventure consists of these encounters.

Cursed Cargo. Two loaded wagons set out from Bryn Shander, driven by a Zhentarim @UUID[Actor.aifTough00000000]{Tough} and a @UUID[Actor.aifSpy0000000000]{Spy} claiming to be laborers. The mead casks have secret compartments loaded with stolen goods.

Trouble on Ten Trail. Lim of Dougan’s Hole (a @UUID[Actor.aifCultistFanati]{Cultist Fanatic}) and five @UUID[Actor.aifBerserker0000]{Berserkers} fight, attempting to drag wagons and victims back to Dougan’s Hole. If the party returns to town, that settlement’s speaker raises an outcry and the characters are sent to investigate Dougan’s Hole.

The Surface. See the description of Dougan’s Hole for details on the settlement. Corpses litter the pike wall, which is a maze of charred cult shrines scavenged by three @UUID[Actor.aifHarpy00000000]{Harpies} and a @UUID[Actor.aifCarrionCrawle]{Carrion Crawler}.

Below Town. Dougan’s Warren can be entered through side passages or from the Bloodchamber at the central stone of Thruun. Each time the characters enter a labeled area on the @UUID[Scene.aifDougansWarren]{Dougan’s Warren} map, roll on the following table, rerolling duplicates. Named individuals on the table are detailed in “Dougan’s Hole.” All inhabitants suffer from @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.book.JournalEntry.aifMagicOfIcewin.JournalEntryPage.aTf0o38mXjaRz4Ii]{Dougan’s Bloodcurse} (described in that section).

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.tables.RollTable.aifEncDougansWar rollable classes="caption-top" resultLabel="Encounter"]{Dougan's Warren}

Thruun. When Elder Dubrace becomes aware of the characters, he directs any surviving combatants against the characters and summons Thruun, a @UUID[Actor.aifBeastofMalar0]{Beast of Malar}. If Dubrace is killed without summoning Thruun, it manifests over his corpse.

Conclusion. If Thruun drops to 0 HP, the Bloodcurse ends. Thruun will return someday. Dougan’s Hole can rejoin Ten-Towns, though this reunion is fraught with suspicion and reproach. Each character’s Renown Score with Targos increases by 1.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.book.JournalEntry.aifAtlas00000000.JournalEntryPage.nQYZ7x9fkIEZldyw caption=false]

Calim Crossing.name: Calim Crossing
Calim Crossing.description:
A Location (Calimshan) Adventure for

Level 3 Characters

Brave the dangers of the Calim Desert.

Situation. Shezar Han, a human merchant (Medium, Neutral Good Commoner), must take his caravan from Memnon to Calimport, a weeklong journey of over 150 miles. But his guards are monsters in disguise intending to lure the caravan to its destruction.

Hook. Shezar hires the characters to escort his caravan to Calimport. He offers each character 100 GP now and another 100 GP when the caravan reaches its destination.
