Training.name: Training
Training.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has proficiency in one skill of the DM's choice and has Advantage whenever it makes an ability check using that skill.

Pack Tactics.name: Pack Tactics
Pack Tactics.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally doesn’t have the Incapacitated condition.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item .mmRend0000000000]]{Rend} or [[/item .mmSlam0000000000]]{Slam} attacks.

Sleep Gaze.name: Sleep Gaze
Sleep Gaze.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=TXstlDE42CZicPAk]], [[lookup @target.affects.labels.statblock activity=TXstlDE42CZicPAk]] the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=TXstlDE42CZicPAk]] feet (Constructs and Undead succeed automatically).

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Unconscious apply=false] condition for [[lookup @labels.duration activity=TXstlDE42CZicPAk]] or until it takes damage or a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to wake it.

Success: The target is immune to this [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s Sleep Gaze for 24 hours.

Unconscious.name: Unconscious
Unconscious.description: The target has the &Reference[Unconscious apply=false] condition for the duration (see source item for the length of the duration) or until it takes damage or a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to wake it.

Shape-Shift.name: Shape-Shift
Shape-Shift.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] shape-shifts into a Medium human or a Medium jackal-humanoid hybrid, or it returns to its true form (that of a Small jackal). Other than its size, its game statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn’t transformed.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item .mmClaw0000000000]] attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of [[/item .mmCorruptingTouc]].

Corrupting Touch.name: Corrupting Touch
Corrupting Touch.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=F4cByCi1IEouN08a]], [[lookup @target.affects.labels.statblock activity=F4cByCi1IEouN08a]] the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=F4cByCi1IEouN08a]] feet.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target is cursed for 1 hour. Until the curse ends, the target has the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] and &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] conditions.

Cursed, Charmed & Poisoned.name: Cursed, Charmed & Poisoned
Cursed, Charmed & Poisoned.description: Until the curse ends, the target has the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] and &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] conditions.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDisguiseSe]{Disguise Self} (can appear as a Large or Medium biped), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMinorIllus]{Minor Illusion}

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplGeas000000]{Geas}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMajorImage]{Major Image}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplScrying000]{Scrying}

Leap.name: Leap
Leap.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] jumps up to [[lookup @range.value activity=C28C43DeD8iFtZMe]] feet by [[lookup @activation.condition activity=C28C43DeD8iFtZMe]].

Disguise Self.name: Disguise Self
Disguise Self.description:
You make yourself—including your clothing, armor, weapons, and other belongings on your person—look different until the spell ends. You can seem 1 foot shorter or taller and can appear heavier or lighter. You must adopt a form that has the same basic arrangement of limbs as you have. Otherwise, the extent of the illusion is up to you.

The changes wrought by this spell fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, if you use this spell to add a hat to your outfit, objects pass through the hat, and anyone who touches it would feel nothing.

To discern that you are disguised, a creature must take the Study action to inspect your appearance and succeed on an [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC.

Disguised.name: Disguised
Disguised.description: To discern that you are disguised, a creature must take the Study action to inspect your appearance and succeed on an [[/check ability=int skill=inv]] check against your spell save DC.

Minor Illusion.name: Minor Illusion
Minor Illusion.description:
You create a sound or an image of an object within range that lasts for the duration. See the descriptions below for the effects of each. The illusion ends if you cast this spell again.

If a creature takes a Study action to examine the sound or image, the creature can determine that it is an illusion with a successful [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the illusion becomes faint to the creature.

Sound. If you create a sound, its volume can range from a whisper to a scream. It can be your voice, someone else's voice, a lion's roar, a beating of drums, or any other sound you choose. The sound continues unabated throughout the duration, or you can make discrete sounds at different times before the spell ends.

Image. If you create an image of an object—such as a chair, muddy footprints, or a small chest—it must be no larger than a 5-foot Cube. The image can't create sound, light, smell, or any other sensory effect. Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, since things can pass through it.

Geas.name: Geas
Geas.description:
You give a verbal command to a creature that you can see within range, ordering it to carry out some service or refrain from an action or a course of activity as you decide. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] condition for the duration. The target automatically succeeds if it can't understand your command.

While Charmed, the creature takes [[/damage 5d10 type=psychic]] damage if it acts in a manner directly counter to your command. It takes this damage no more than once each day.

You can issue any command you choose, short of an activity that would result in certain death. Should you issue a suicidal command, the spell ends.

A @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplRemoveCurs]{Remove Curse}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplGreaterRes]{Greater Restoration}, or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplWish000000]{Wish} spell ends this spell.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. If you use a level 7 or 8 spell slot, the duration is 365 days. If you use a level 9 spell slot, the spell lasts until it is ended by one of the spells mentioned above.

Under Orders.name: Under Orders
Under Orders.description: While &Reference[Charmed apply=false], the creature takes [[/damage 5d10 type=psyhic]] damage if it acts in a manner directly counter to your command. It takes this damage no more than once each day.

Major Image.name: Major Image
Major Image.description:
You create the image of an object, a creature, or some other visible phenomenon that is no larger than a 20-foot Cube. The image appears at a spot that you can see within range and lasts for the duration. It seems real, including sounds, smells, and temperature appropriate to the thing depicted, but it can't deal damage or cause conditions.

If you are within range of the illusion, you can take a Magic action to cause the image to move to any other spot within range. As the image changes location, you can alter its appearance so that its movements appear natural for the image. For example, if you create an image of a creature and move it, you can alter the image so that it appears to be walking. Similarly, you can cause the illusion to make different sounds at different times, even making it carry on a conversation, for example.

Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, for things can pass through it. A creature that takes a Study action to examine the image can determine that it is an illusion with a successful [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the creature can see through the image, and its other sensory qualities become faint to the creature.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The spell lasts until dispelled, without requiring Concentration, if cast with a level 4+ spell slot.

Scrying.name: Scrying
Scrying.description:
You can see and hear a creature you choose that is on the same plane of existence as you. The target makes a Wisdom saving throw, which is modified (see the tables below) by how well you know the target and the sort of physical connection you have to it. The target doesn't know what it is making the save against, only that it feels uneasy.

Your Knowledge of the Target Is …Save Modifier
Secondhand (heard of the target)+5
Firsthand (met the target)+0
Extensive (know the target well)−5
You Have the Target's …Save Modifier
Picture or other likeness−2
Garment or other possession−4
Body part, lock of hair, or bit of nail−10

On a successful save, the target isn't affected, and you can't use this spell on it again for 24 hours.

On a failed save, the spell creates an Invisible, intangible sensor within 10 feet of the target. You can see and hear through the sensor as if you were there. The sensor moves with the target, remaining within 10 feet of it for the duration. If something can see the sensor, it appears as a luminous orb about the size of your fist.

Instead of targeting a creature, you can target a location you have seen. When you do so, the sensor appears at that location and doesn't move.

materials.value: a focus worth 1,000+ GP, such as a crystal ball, mirror, or water-filled font

affects.special: creature on same plane of existence or a location you have seen
at target location or within 10 feet of target creature

Parry.name: Parry
Parry.description: Trigger: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] is [[lookup @activation.condition activity=aLG3BRZL7P6OEjwd]]. Response: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] adds [[lookup @roll.formula activity=aLG3BRZL7P6OEjwd]] to its AC against that attack, possibly causing it to miss.

Use.name: Use
Use.condition: hit by a melee attack roll while holding a weapon

Pack Tactics.name: Pack Tactics
Pack Tactics.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally doesn't have the Incapacitated condition.

Running Leap.name: Running Leap
Running Leap.description: With a 10-foot running start, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can Long Jump up to 25 feet.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item .mmRend0000000000]] attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of [[/item .mmRoar0000000000]].

Roar.name: Roar
Roar.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=Igeu89TALGlNPXDg]], one creature within [[lookup @range.value activity=Igeu89TALGlNPXDg]] feet.

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition until the start of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s next turn.

Frightened.name: Frightened
Frightened.description: The target has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition until the start of the attacking creature’s next turn.

Paralyzed.name: Paralyzed
Paralyzed.description: The target has the &Reference[Paralyzed apply=false] condition, and it repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.

Prone.name: Prone
Prone.description: The target has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Water Bound.name: Water Bound
Water Bound.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] dies if it leaves the water to which it is bound or if that water is destroyed.

Invisible in Water.name: Invisible in Water
Invisible in Water.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has the &Reference[Invisible] condition while fully immersed in water.

Surge.name: Surge
Surge.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC [[lookup @skills.ath.passive]]), and it has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition until the grapple ends.

Grappled & Restrained.name: Grappled & Restrained
Grappled & Restrained.description: If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC [[/check ability=str skill=ath format=long]], see source item for DC), and it has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition until the grapple ends.

Fire Aura.name: Fire Aura
Fire Aura.description: At the end of each of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s turns, each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=15VgJKVXwYBOFSqJ]] of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s choice in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=15VgJKVXwYBOFSqJ]]-foot Emanation originating from the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes [[/damage average]] damage. Creatures and flammable objects in the Emanation start burning.

Fire Form.name: Fire Form
Fire Form.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without expending extra movement to do so, and it can enter a creature's space and stop there. The first time it enters a creature's space on a turn, that creature takes [[/damage average]] damage.

Illumination.name: Illumination
Illumination.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] sheds Bright Light in a 30-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 30 feet.

Water Susceptibility.name: Water Susceptibility
Water Susceptibility.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes 3 (1d6) Cold damage damage for every 5 feet the [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves in water or for every gallon of water splashed on it.

Foundry Note

Scaling is configured to roll the correct number of dice based on the distance traveled through water. 1 is default for 5 feet, 2 is for 10 feet, and so forth.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item .mmBurn0000000000]] attacks.

Burn.name: Burn
Burn.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a creature or a flammable object, it starts &Reference[burning].

Details.name: Details
Details.text:
A Location (Calimshan) Adventure for

Level 3 Characters

Brave the dangers of the Calim Desert.

Scenes: @UUID[Scene.dmgCaravanEncamp]{Caravan Encampment}, @UUID[Scene.dmgWizardsTower0]{Wizard’s Tower}

Adventure (Import to Run): @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.adventures.Adventure.eRgFLdd3IYvUvmm5]{Calim Crossing}

Situation. Shezar Han, a human merchant (Medium, Neutral Good @UUID[Actor.aifCommoner00000]{Commoner}), must take his caravan from Memnon to Calimport, a weeklong journey of over 150 miles. But his guards are monsters in disguise intending to lure the caravan to its destruction.

Hook. Shezar hires the characters to escort his caravan to Calimport. He offers the characters [[/award each 100gp]] now and another [[/award each 100gp]] when the caravan reaches its destination.

Encounters

This adventure takes place over a week as the caravan follows the Trade Way south across the desert. The caravan includes dozens of camels carrying precious goods, but Shezar’s prize possession is a @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.items.Item.aifBrazierofComm]{Brazier of Commanding Fire Elementals,} which he keeps packed away on his camel.

Shezar has hired eight guards aside from the characters; he doesn’t know they’re @UUID[Actor.mmJackalwere0000]{Jackalweres} in humanoid form. Their leader is named Thukir. Thukir and the other jackalweres work for a @UUID[Actor.aifLamia00000000]{Lamia} named Selim who covets Shezar’s magic brazier. Shezar assigns Thukir and the other guards to remain with the caravan every day while the characters scout the path ahead.

Desert Encounters. Each day, as the characters scout, roll on the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.tables.RollTable.aifEncCalimDeser]{Calim Desert Encounters} table. The characters spot any encounters from far off, so they can flee from threats too dangerous for them to handle and redirect the caravan along a safer route.

Jackalwere Treason. The “guards” keep to themselves and avoid interacting with the characters. Thukir does the talking for the group. The jackalweres maintain their deception for as long as possible, but if they sense the party is onto them, they try to ambush the party one night in camp. Use the @UUID[Scene.dmgCaravanEncamp]{Caravan Encampment }map in appendix B of the Dungeon Master’s Guide for this encounter, replacing the wagons with bundles of goods offloaded from the caravan’s camels.

Sandstorm. On the fourth day, a furious Calim sandstorm (see “@UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.book.JournalEntry.aifDesertSurviva.JournalEntryPage.KJvjdQTQMmNOvQLN]{Environmental Effects”} earlier in this chapter) approaches the caravan. The characters can seek shelter for the caravan or, failing that, shelter in place. If the jackalweres haven’t yet been revealed, they try to steal the brazier. Should the jackalweres get the brazier toward Selim’s tower (see below).

Selim Strikes. The @UUID[Actor.aifLamia00000000]{Lamia} Selim lairs in a desert tower near the south end of the Trade Way. On the second-to-last night of the journey, Selim sneaks up to the camp and steals the brazier. If the jackalweres haven’t yet been confronted, they join with Selim to seize the camp. Shezar begs the characters to recover the brazier from the lamia.

Selim’s Tower. Use the @UUID[Scene.dmgWizardsTower0]{Wizard’s Tower} map in the Dungeon Master’s Guide for Selim’s lair. The tower entrance on level 1 is guarded by a @UUID[Actor.aifWarriorVetera]{Warrior Veteran }and their pet @UUID[Actor.mmLion0000000000]{Lion}. Replace the central chamber on level 2 with a pool housing a @UUID[Actor.mmWaterWeird0000]{Water Weird} Selim has imprisoned. Selim is on level 4, along with a @UUID[Actor.aifFireElemental]{Fire Elemental} he’s summoned using the brazier.

Conclusion. When the party brings Shezar safely to Calimport, he pays them the promised reward and gives them the magic brazier, insisting it has brought him nothing but woe and misfortune.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.book.JournalEntry.aifAtlas00000000.JournalEntryPage.aEewjd28aKSjtuBh caption=false]

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.book.JournalEntry.aifAtlas00000000.JournalEntryPage.EoOSGpQIgcWDR9O5 caption=false]

Robber Baron.name: Robber Baron
Robber Baron.description:
A Region (Sword Coast) Adventure for

Level 1 Characters

Rescue a man from desperate bandits.

Situation. Bandits have settled into ruined towers flanking a road within a day’s travel of Baldur’s Gate. Now they stop travelers and demand a toll. They’ve even taken prisoners, demanding ransoms for the prisoners’ release.

Situation. Bandits have settled into ruined towers flanking a road within a day’s travel of Baldur’s Gate. Now they stop travelers and demand a toll. They’ve even taken prisoners, demanding ransoms for the prisoners’ release.

Hook. A middle-aged human trader named Rolf Twyrtho (Medium Commoner) has received a ransom note for his brother Adon, held by the bandits. Rolf offers each character 50GP to bring Adon home and teach the bandits a lesson.

Training.name: Training
Training.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has proficiency in one skill of the DM's choice and has Advantage whenever it makes an ability check using that skill.

Cunning Action.name: Cunning Action
Cunning Action.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes the &Reference[Dash apply=false], the &Reference[Disengage apply=false], or &Reference[Hide apply=false] action.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability:

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplLight00000]{Light}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplThaumaturg]{Thaumaturgy}

Divine Aid.name: Divine Aid
Divine Aid.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplBless00000]{Bless}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDispelMagi]{Dispel Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplHealingWor]{Healing Word}, or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplLesserRest]{Lesser Restoration}, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

Bless.name: Bless
Bless.description:
You bless up to three creatures within range. Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target adds 1d4 to the attack roll or save.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

Blessed.name: Blessed
Blessed.description: Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target adds 1d4 to the attack roll or save.

Healing Word.name: Healing Word
Healing Word.description:
A creature of your choice that you can see within range regains Hit Points equal to 2d4 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The healing increases by 2d4 for each spell slot level above 1.

Sanctuary.name: Sanctuary
Sanctuary.description: You ward a creature within range. Until the spell ends, any creature who targets the warded creature with an attack roll or a damaging spell must succeed on a [[/save ability=wis dc=@attributes.spell.dc format=long]] or either choose a new target or lose the attack or spell. This spell doesn't protect the warded creature from areas of effect. The spell ends if the warded creature makes an attack roll, casts a spell, or deals damage.

materials.value: a shard of glass from a mirror

Warded.name: Warded
Warded.description:
Until the spell ends, any creature who targets the warded creature with an attack roll or a damaging spell must succeed on a [[/save ability=wis format=long]] or either choose a new target or lose the attack or spell.

The spell ends if the warded creature makes an attack roll, casts a spell, or deals damage.

Light.name: Light
Light.description:
You touch one Large or smaller object that isn't being worn or carried by someone else. Until the spell ends, the object sheds Bright Light in a 20-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 20 feet. The light can be colored as you like.

Covering the object with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends if you cast it again.

Thaumaturgy.name: Thaumaturgy
Thaumaturgy.description:
You manifest a minor wonder within range. You create one of the effects below within range. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time.

Altered Eyes. You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

Booming Voice. Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute. For the duration, you have Advantage on [[/check ability=cha skill=itm]] checks.

Fire Play. You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.

Invisible Hand. You instantaneously cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.

Phantom Sound. You create an instantaneous sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as a rumble of thunder, the cry of a raven, or ominous whispers.

Tremors. You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.

Details.name: Details
Details.text:
A Region (Sword Coast) Adventure for

Level 1 Characters

Rescue a man from desperate bandits.

Scene: @UUID[Scene.dmgDungeonHideou]{Dungeon Hideout}

Adventure (Import to Run): @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.adventures.Adventure.eqAlV0pdxZshW0Ss]{Robber Baron}

Situation. Bandits have settled into ruined towers flanking a road within a day’s travel of Baldur’s Gate. Now they stop travelers and demand a toll. They’ve even taken prisoners, demanding ransoms for the prisoners’ release.

Hook. A middle-aged human trader named Rolf Twyrtho (Medium @UUID[Actor.aifCommoner00000]{Commoner}) has received a ransom note for his brother Adon, held by the bandits. Rolf offers each character [[/award 50GP]] to bring Adon home and teach the bandits a lesson.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.book.JournalEntry.aifAtlas00000000.JournalEntryPage.D1UR6xSwVTsxuDRS caption=false]

Encounters

The adventure consists of these encounters. All the bandits are human and Medium size.

Bandit Stronghold. Use the @UUID[Scene.dmgDungeonHideou]{Dungeon Hideout} map—an arch over the roadway once connected these watchtowers. The western stairway on level 1 leads to level 2’s secret exit tunnel and the few rooms directly along it; ignore the rest of level 2. Bandits have lived in this hideout for weeks, and characters traveling the road spot campfire smoke from the west tower. The robbers aren’t bloodthirsty—if they defeat the characters, they’re content to rob them and figure out if anyone is worth ransoming.

Characters who search the area more broadly might discover a hidden entrance to the lair of the robbers. This hole in the hillside, covered with brush, is the secret exit found on level 2 of the map.

Mardon Rueh (Medium @UUID[Actor.aifSpy0000000000]{Spy}) is the bandit leader. He carries keys to the locked areas on level 1. His sister, Wendi Rueh (Medium @UUID[Actor.aifPriestAcolyte]{Priest Acolyte}), tries to prevent anyone from dying, even hostages or the characters. The Ruehs were once aristocrats and were ruined by the Eomanes, a rival family the Ruehs accused of devil worship. Mardon intends to use money gained from banditry to hire mercenaries and take revenge. If given the chance, Mardon tells his story to the party and he might even hire the characters to be his agents. For more on the Eomanes, see the “@UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.book.JournalEntry.aifBaldursGateGa.JournalEntryPage.NQ1uNs56RPWjf6kN#other-sites]{Eomane House}” section and the adventure “@UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.book.JournalEntry.aifBloodNight000]{Blood Night}” in chapter 6.

Fallen Archway. Caldwell (Medium @UUID[Actor.aifTough00000000]{Tough}) and his pet @UUID[Actor.aifMastiff000000]{Mastiff} keep watch on the road. A total of three @UUID[Actor.aifBandit0000000]{Bandits} and one @UUID[Actor.aifScout00000000]{Scout} lurk in the ruined guardhouses to either side, but they’re bored and &Reference[Indifferent], talking to each other and occasionally leaving the building to speak with Caldwell or play with the dog. Caldwell is &Reference[Hostile] and demands a toll of 3 GP from each passerby, but he’s willing to barter. At any impasse in talks, the robbers insist on more money. If the party doesn’t relent, the robbers reluctantly begin combat.

East Tower. Mardon lives in a rough office and bedroom set up in this tower. In the northeastern barrack, three @UUID[Actor.aifBandit0000000]{Bandits} rest. A room in the southeast corner built around the oiled, polished stump of an ancient oak houses Wendi Rueh, Mardon’s sister. She reveres Oghma and has placed a wooden symbol of Oghma atop the stump. Battle sounds bring everyone into the fray. Journals and other documents in these rooms tell the story of the Rueh family and their vendetta with the Eomanes.

West Tower. Three @UUID[Actor.aifBandit0000000]{Bandits} and one @UUID[Actor.aifMastiff000000]{Mastiff} relax around a campfire in this tower, which is in much worse condition than the eastern one. They keep a lax watch on the stairway down, which they’ve covered with wooden boards. The stairway is unstable. Characters who move at no more than half their Speed on a turn use it safely. Otherwise, the stairs crumble and all creatures on the stairs fall 10 feet to level 1, alerting everyone in west level 1 (below).

East Level 1. The eastern section of the hideout houses castoff junk and three locked prison cells with one prisoner, Adon Twyrtho (Medium @UUID[Actor.aifWarriorInfant]{Warrior Infantry}). Adon is eager to escape, but he admits to being treated well while he waited to be ransomed. He points out that the bandits pass through this area when they change shifts.

Central Level 1. To the east of this pillared hall, rubble chokes a stairway. To the west, a similar stair leads to an escape tunnel with a brush-covered entrance on a hillside. A locked southwestern room holds most of the bandits’ loot and supplies, including the following:

  • [[/award 380cp 630sp 120gp 26pp]]
  • Six @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.items.Item.aifTigereyeGem00]{tigereye gems}, worth 10 GP each
  • @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.dmgPotionOfClimb]{Potion of Climbing}
  • @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.items.Item.aifSpellScrollSe]{Spell Scroll of See Invisibility}

West Level 1. One @UUID[Actor.aifTough00000000]{Tough}, one @UUID[Actor.aifScout00000000]{Scout}, one @UUID[Actor.aifMastiff000000]{Mastiff}, and three @UUID[Actor.aifBandit0000000]{Bandits} rest or socialize in the barrack here. These combatants respond quickly to the sounds of fighting or a shouted alarm from the floor above.

Conclusion. If the party agrees to help Mardon and Wendi get justice on the Eomanes and regain their rightful position in Baldur’s Gate, Mardon releases Adon. As long as Adon is freed, Rolf makes good on his promised payment.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.book.JournalEntry.aifAtlas00000000.JournalEntryPage.D1UR6xSwVTsxuDRS caption=false]

Hell Ship.name: Hell Ship
Hell Ship.description:
A Region (Lands of Intrigue) Adventure for

Level 8 Characters

Battle undead pirates on land and sea.

Situation. The ghost ship Bloodrider terrorizes shipping from a hidden port. Its undead crew leaves no survivors, and the surge in piracy is unexplained.

Hook. The human merchant captain Shireen Malahnk (Medium Bandit Captain) wants extra guards for her ship, Wisteria, hauling metal and gems from Athkatla to Baldur’s Gate. She offers 250 GP per person.

Foundry Note

This feature also provides an Active Effect (AE) that will modify this creature's Armor Class when you utilize the reaction. You can enable the AE in the effects tab of the character sheet.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Somatic or Material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMageHand00]{Mage Hand}

2/Day: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMagicMissi]{Magic Missile} (level 2 version)

1/Day: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplFireball00]{Fireball}

Mage Hand.name: Mage Hand
Mage Hand.description:
A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.

When you cast the spell, you can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial.

As a Magic action on your later turns, you can control the hand thus again. As part of that action, you can move the hand up to 30 feet.

The hand can’t attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

Magic Missile.name: Magic Missile
Magic Missile.description:
You create three glowing darts of magical force. Each dart strikes a creature of your choice that you can see within range. A dart deals 1d4 + 1 Force damage to its target. The darts all strike simultaneously, and you can direct them to hit one creature or several.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The spell creates one more dart for each spell slot level above 1.

[[2 + @item.level]]{Level [[lookup @item.level]] darts}

Fireball.name: Fireball
Fireball.description:
A bright streak flashes from you to a point you choose within range and then blossoms with a low roar into a fiery explosion. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius Sphere centered on that point makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking 8d6 Fire damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Flammable objects in the area that aren’t being worn or carried start burning.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 3.

materials.value: a ball of bat guano and sulfur

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two attacks, using [[/item .mmClaw0000000000]] or [[/item .mmFireRay0000000]] in any combination.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

2/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplAlterSelf0]{Alter Self}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplCommand000]{Command} (level 3 version), @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectMagi]{Detect Magic}

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDominatePe]{Dominate Person} (level 8 version), @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplPlaneShift]{Plane Shift} (self only)

Alter Self.name: Alter Self
Alter Self.description:
You alter your physical form. Choose one of the following options. Its effects last for the duration, during which you can take a Magic action to replace the option you chose with a different one.

Aquatic Adaptation. You sprout gills and grow webs between your fingers. You can breathe underwater and gain a Swim Speed equal to your Speed.

Foundry Note

The Active Effect provided by the Aquatic Adaptation activity upgrades the character's Swim Speed to a value of "1" to indicate equivalence to (walk) Speed.

Change Appearance. You alter your appearance. You decide what you look like, including your height, weight, facial features, sound of your voice, hair length, coloration, and other distinguishing characteristics. You can make yourself appear as a member of another species, though none of your statistics change. You can’t appear as a creature of a different size, and your basic shape stays the same; if you’re bipedal, you can’t use this spell to become quadrupedal, for instance. For the duration, you can take a Magic action to change your appearance in this way again.

Natural Weapons. You grow claws (Slashing), fangs (Piercing), horns (Piercing), or hooves (Bludgeoning). When you use your Unarmed Strike to deal damage with that new growth, it deals 1d6 damage of the type in parentheses instead of dealing the normal damage for your Unarmed Strike, and you use your spellcasting ability modifier for the attack and damage rolls rather than using Strength.

Aquatic Adaptation.name: Aquatic Adaptation
Aquatic Adaptation.description: You can breathe underwater and gain a Swim Speed equal to your Speed.

Natural Weapon.name: Natural Weapon
Natural Weapon.description: When you use your Unarmed Strike to deal damage with that new growth, it deals 1d6 damage of the type in parentheses instead of dealing the normal damage for your Unarmed Strike, and you use your spellcasting ability modifier for the attack and damage rolls rather than using Strength.

Command.name: Command
Command.description:
You speak a one-word command to a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or follow the command on its next turn. Choose the command from these options:

Approach. The target moves toward you by the shortest and most direct route, ending its turn if it moves within 5 feet of you.

Drop. The target drops whatever it is holding and then ends its turn.

Flee. The target spends its turn moving away from you by the fastest available means.

Grovel. The target has the Prone condition and then ends its turn.

Halt. On its turn, the target doesn’t move and takes no action or Bonus Action.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can affect one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell’s school of magic.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Dominate Person.name: Dominate Person
Dominate Person.description:
One Humanoid you can see within range must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] condition for the duration. The target has Advantage on the save if you or your allies are fighting it. Whenever the target takes damage, it repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

You have a telepathic link with the Charmed target while the two of you are on the same plane of existence. On your turn, you can use this link to issue commands to the target (no action required), such as “Attack that creature,” “Move over there,” or “Fetch that object.” The target does its best to obey on its turn. If it completes an order and doesn’t receive further direction from you, it acts and moves as it likes, focusing on protecting itself.

You can command the target to take a Reaction but must take your own Reaction to do so.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. Your Concentration can last longer with a spell slot of level 6 (up to 10 minutes), 7 (up to 1 hour), or 8+ (up to 8 hours).

Dominated.name: Dominated
Dominated.description: Whenever the &Reference[charmed apply=false] target takes damage, it repeats the [[/save ability=wis]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Plane Shift.name: Plane Shift
Plane Shift.description:
You and up to eight willing creatures who link hands in a circle are transported to a different plane of existence. You can specify a target destination in general terms, such as the City of Brass on the Elemental Plane of Fire or the palace of Dispater on the second level of the Nine Hells, and you appear in or near that destination, as determined by the DM.

Alternatively, if you know the sigil sequence of a teleportation circle on another plane of existence, this spell can take you to that circle. If the teleportation circle is too small to hold all the creatures you transported, they appear in the closest unoccupied spaces next to the circle.

materials.value: a forked, metal rod worth 250+ GP and attuned to a plane of existence

affects.special: you and up to eight willing creatures

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes one [[/item .mmBeard000000000]] attack and one [[/item .mmInfernalGlaive]] attack.

Beard.name: Beard
Beard.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]], and the target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the start of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s next turn. Until this poison ends, the target can't regain Hit Points.

Poisoned.name: Poisoned
Poisoned.description: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the start of the user's next turn. Until this poison ends, the target can’t regain Hit Points.

Infernal Glaive.name: Infernal Glaive
Infernal Glaive.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a creature and doesn't already have an infernal wound, it is subjected to the following effect.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=4qy3fKL086OAE1xR]].

The wound closes after 1 minute, after a spell restores Hit Points to the target, or after the target or a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to stanch the wound, doing so by succeeding on a [[/check format=long activity=KNWa0TFhANjmQCds]].

If the target is Large or smaller, the devil moves the target up to 30 feet straight toward itself.

Details.name: Details
Details.text:
A Region (Lands of Intrigue) Adventure for

Level 8 Characters

Battle undead pirates on land and sea.

Scene: @UUID[Scene.aifWisteriaCopy0]{Wisteria}

Adventure (Import to Run): @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.adventures.Adventure.gjOnfHW1OqhpIQJw]{Hell Ship}

Situation. The ghost ship Bloodrider terrorizes shipping from a hidden port. Its undead crew leaves no survivors, and the surge in piracy is unexplained.

Hook. The human merchant captain Shireen Malahnk (Medium @UUID[Actor.aifBanditCaptain]{Bandit Captain}) wants extra guards for her ship, Wisteria, hauling metal and gems from Athkatla to Baldur’s Gate. She offers [[/award 250GP]] per person.

Encounters

The adventure consists of these encounters.

Bloodrider. The wind dies and sulfurous fog gathers as the fire-blackened Bloodrider sails in. The ghost ship’s crew boards the becalmed Wisteria. Use the @UUID[Scene.aifWisteriaCopy0]{Ship map} in Dungeon Master’s Guide appendix B. Wisteria’s crew (@UUID[Actor.aifTough00000000]{Toughs}) flees belowdecks or fights against other monsters while two waves of enemies (see below) fight the characters. Humanoids listed below are instead Undead. When destroyed, the creatures turn to brimstone and ash but eventually return (see “Hell’s Cove”).

The pirates board in the following waves:

Wave One. Eight @UUID[Actor.aifPirate0000000]{Pirates} board, led by a @UUID[Actor.aifPirateCaptain]{Pirate Captain} and a @UUID[Actor.aifFlameskull000]{Flameskull}.

Wave Two. As wave one falters, Lieutenant Mazterel (@UUID[Actor.aifCambion000000]{Cambion}), two @UUID[Actor.aifBeardedDevil0]{Bearded Devils}, and two @UUID[Actor.aifPirate0000000]{Pirates} join them. Facing defeat, Mazterel casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplPlaneShift]{Plane Shift} to escape.

Once the battle ends, Bloodrider breaks apart and sinks. The party has time to search the large quarters astern, where tattered logs and charts show Bloodrider’s port, a tiny cove a day’s sail away. If captured, Mazterel can give the same information.

Hell’s Cove. When the characters reach the cove, Bloodrider has returned. All Undead listed in waves one and two are back on the ship. They, and Mazterel if he escaped, ambush the party in the haunted village.

The pirates’ treasure is hidden behind the waterfall and includes [[/award 3500gp]], a set of @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.items.Item.aifAmberDice0000]{amber dice} worth 250 GP, a @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.items.Item.aifShipInABottle]{ship in a bottle} decorated with gold and gemstones worth 750 GP, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.items.Item.aifMarinersArmor]{Mariner’s Armor} (Studded Leather Armor) and a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.dmgFoldingBoat00]{Folding Boat}.

Within the captain’s grotto, the chain-bound, burning heart of Bloodrider’s former captain, Salton Vail, floats in the air. A @UUID[Actor.aifChainDevil000]{Chain Devil} and two @UUID[Actor.aifBarbedDevil00]{Barbed Devils} guard the heart. Bloodrider and its crew rise again 1 day after being destroyed unless the heart is doused in @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagHolyWater00]{Holy Water} and the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplRemoveCurs]{Remove Curse} spell is cast on it. An @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplIdentify00]{Identify} spell cast on the heart reveals this ritual.

Conclusion. With the permanent destruction of the Bloodrider, Shireen sings the group’s praises from Baldur’s Gate to Athkatla. Henceforth, she will provide a ship and crew for any journey the party wants to make.

Echoes of the Shaking Plague.name: Echoes of the Shaking Plague
Echoes of the Shaking Plague.description:
A Region (Heartlands) Adventure for

Level 9 Characters

Work alongside Scardale’s criminal gangs.

Situation. An outbreak of the Shaking Plague is spreading among the docks and slums of Scardale Town. An aspiring drug lord, Dyan Komar, accidentally reawakened the plague while conducting alchemical experiments.

Hook. A local healer, Kestra Alara, pleads with the characters to meet with the town’s three criminal syndicates and enlist their help to locate the source of the plague. She offers 5,000 GP for the party’s assistance.

Stunned.description: The target has the &Reference[Stunned apply=false] condition until the end of the attacking creature's next turn.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
Spellcasting. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplLight00000]{Light}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplThaumaturg]{Thaumaturgy}

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplFlameStrik]{Flame Strike} (level 6 version), @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplGreaterRes]{Greater Restoration}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplRaiseDead0]{Raise Dead}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplZoneofTrut]{Zone of Truth}

Light.name: Light
Light.description:
You touch one Large or smaller object that isn’t being worn or carried by someone else. Until the spell ends, the object sheds Bright Light in a 20-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 20 feet. The light can be colored as you like.

Covering the object with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends if you cast it again.

Thaumaturgy.name: Thaumaturgy
Thaumaturgy.description:
You manifest a minor wonder within range. You create one of the effects below within range. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time.

Altered Eyes. You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

Booming Voice. Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute. For the duration, you have Advantage on [[/check ability=cha skill=itm]] checks.

Fire Play. You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.

Invisible Hand. You instantaneously cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.

Phantom Sound. You create an instantaneous sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as a rumble of thunder, the cry of a raven, or ominous whispers.

Tremors. You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.

Flame Strike.name: Flame Strike
Flame Strike.description:
A vertical column of brilliant fire roars down from above. Each creature in a 10-foot-radius, 40-foot-high Cylinder centered on a point within range makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking 5d6 Fire damage and 5d6 Radiant damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The Fire damage and the Radiant damage increase by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 5.

Greater Restoration.name: Greater Restoration
Greater Restoration.description:
You touch a creature and magically remove one of the following effects from it:

  • 1 &Reference[Exhaustion] level
  • The &Reference[Charmed] or &Reference[Petrified] condition
  • A curse, including the target’s Attunement to a cursed magic item
  • Any reduction to one of the target’s ability scores
  • Any reduction to the target’s Hit Point maximum

materials.value: diamond dust worth 100+ GP, which the spell consumes

Raise Dead.name: Raise Dead
Raise Dead.description:
With a touch, you revive a dead creature if it has been dead no longer than 10 days and it wasn’t Undead when it died.

The creature returns to life with 1 Hit Point. This spell also neutralizes any poisons that affected the creature at the time of death.

This spell closes all mortal wounds, but it doesn’t restore missing body parts. If the creature is lacking body parts or organs integral for its survival—its head, for instance—the spell automatically fails.

Coming back from the dead is an ordeal. The target takes a −4 penalty to D20 Tests. Every time the target finishes a Long Rest, the penalty is reduced by 1 until it becomes 0.

materials.value: a diamond worth 500+ GP, which the spell consumes

Resurrection Sickness (Day 1).name: Resurrection Sickness (Day 1)
Resurrection Sickness (Day 1).description: Coming back from the dead is an ordeal. The target takes a −4 penalty to D20 Tests. Every time the target finishes a Long Rest, the penalty is reduced by 1 until it becomes 0.

Resurrection Sickness (Day 2).name: Resurrection Sickness (Day 2)
Resurrection Sickness (Day 2).description: Coming back from the dead is an ordeal. The target takes a −4 penalty to D20 Tests. Every time the target finishes a Long Rest, the penalty is reduced by 1 until it becomes 0.

Resurrection Sickness (Day 4).name: Resurrection Sickness (Day 4)
Resurrection Sickness (Day 4).description: Coming back from the dead is an ordeal. The target takes a −4 penalty to D20 Tests. Every time the target finishes a Long Rest, the penalty is reduced by 1 until it becomes 0.

Resurrection Sickness (Day 3).name: Resurrection Sickness (Day 3)
Resurrection Sickness (Day 3).description: Coming back from the dead is an ordeal. The target takes a −4 penalty to D20 Tests. Every time the target finishes a Long Rest, the penalty is reduced by 1 until it becomes 0.

Zone of Truth.name: Zone of Truth
Zone of Truth.description:
You create a magical zone that guards against deception in a 15-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point within range. Until the spell ends, a creature that enters the spell’s area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there makes a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, a creature can’t speak a deliberate lie while in the radius. You know whether a creature succeeds or fails on this save.

An affected creature is aware of the spell and can avoid answering questions to which it would normally respond with a lie. Such a creature can be evasive yet must be truthful.

Cannot Lie.name: Cannot Lie
Cannot Lie.description:
On a failed save, a creature can’t speak a deliberate lie while in the radius. You know whether a creature succeeds or fails on this save.

An affected creature is aware of the spell and can avoid answering questions to which it would normally respond with a lie. Such a creature can be evasive yet must be truthful.

Divine Aid.name: Divine Aid
Divine Aid.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplBless00000]{Bless}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDispelMagi]{Dispel Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplHealingWor]{Healing Word}, or @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplLesserRest]{Lesser Restoration}, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

Bless.name: Bless
Bless.description:
You bless up to three creatures within range. Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target adds 1d4 to the attack roll or save.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

Blessed.name: Blessed
Blessed.description: Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target adds 1d4 to the attack roll or save.

Dispel Magic.name: Dispel Magic
Dispel Magic.description:
Choose one creature, object, or magical effect within range. Any ongoing spell of level 3 or lower on the target ends. For each ongoing spell of level 4 or higher on the target, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability (DC 10 plus that spell’s level). On a successful check, the spell ends.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You automatically end a spell on the target if the spell’s level is equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you use.

Healing Word.name: Healing Word
Healing Word.description:
A creature of your choice that you can see within range regains Hit Points equal to 2d4 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The healing increases by 2d4 for each spell slot level above 1.

Lesser Restoration.name: Lesser Restoration
Lesser Restoration.description: You touch a creature and end one condition on it: &Reference[blinded], &Reference[deafened], &Reference[paralyzed], or &Reference[poisoned].

Foundry Note

This feature also provides an Active Effect (AE) that will modify this creature's Armor Class when you utilize the reaction. You can enable the AE in the effects tab of the character sheet.

If the revenant takes Fire or Radiant damage, this trait doesn’t function at the start of its next turn. Its body is destroyed only if it starts its turn with 0 Hit Points and doesn’t regenerate.

Undead Restoration.name: Undead Restoration
Undead Restoration.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] dies, it revives 24 hours later in a different body unless @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDispelEvil]{Dispel Evil and Good} is cast on its corpse. If it revives, it animates a Humanoid corpse elsewhere on the same plane of existence; it now looks different but uses the same stat block and returns with all its Hit Points.

Vengeful Glare.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=r2U9soI3vKTrXhG1]], one [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=r2U9soI3vKTrXhG1]] the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=r2U9soI3vKTrXhG1]] feet.

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition and repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After [[lookup @duration.value activity=r2U9soI3vKTrXhG1]] [[lookup @duration.units activity=r2U9soI3vKTrXhG1]], it succeeds automatically. If the Frightened target is cursed by the [[lookup @name lowercase]] (see [[/item .LuIttybjU4f7tGCs]]), the target also has the &Reference[Paralyzed apply=false] condition for the duration.

Frightened & Paralyzed.description: If the attacking creature curses the Frightened target, the target also has the &Reference[Paralyzed apply=false] condition for the duration. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.

Frightened.name: Frightened
Frightened.description: The target has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition and repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.

Vow of Revenge.name: Vow of Revenge
Vow of Revenge.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] curses one [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=NBJRR41fIGp8FYJh]] it can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=NBJRR41fIGp8FYJh]] feet of itself. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] knows the distance to and direction of the cursed target, even if it is on a different plane of existence. The curse ends on the target if the [[lookup @name lowercase]] uses this Bonus Action on a different creature.

Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two Rotting Slam attacks.

Spore Bomb.name: Spore Bomb
Spore Bomb.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=cmFbJQhqZiLBF9Ij]], each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=cmFbJQhqZiLBF9Ij]] in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=cmFbJQhqZiLBF9Ij]]-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=cmFbJQhqZiLBF9Ij]] feet].

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the start of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s next turn. While Poisoned, the target can’t regain Hit Points.

Success: Half damage only.

Poisoned.name: Poisoned
Poisoned.description: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the start of the violet fungus necrohulk next turn. While Poisoned, the target can’t regain Hit Points.

Absorb Body.name: Absorb Body
Absorb Body.description:
Strength Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=YqWqaRXxaKFCH6P8]], one [[lookup @target.affects.special activity=YqWqaRXxaKFCH6P8]] [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=YqWqaRXxaKFCH6P8]] the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within 5 feet.

Failure: The target is pulled into the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s space and becomes grafted to its body. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can have only one target grafted at a time.

While grafted, the target has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition and Disadvantage on Constitution saving throws. When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves, the grafted target moves with it. If [[lookup @activation.condition activity=KXQbdk3TH6uZex2L]], its body is destroyed, and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] regains [[lookup @healing.formula activity=KXQbdk3TH6uZex2L]] Hit Points.

The grafted target or a creature within 5 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can take an action to make a [[/check ability=str skill=ath dc=@abilities.str.dc format=long]]. On a successful check, the target is no longer grafted and moves to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]].

Grafted: Con Saves and Restrained.name: Grafted: Con Saves and Restrained
Grafted: Con Saves and Restrained.description:
While grafted, the target has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition and Disadvantage on Constitution saving throws.

The grafted target or a creature within 5 feet of the grafter can take an action to make a [[/check ability=str skill=ath format=long]] (see source item for DC). On a successful check, the target is no longer grafted and moves to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the grafter.

Details.name: Details
Details.text:
A Region (Heartlands) Adventure for

Level 9 Characters

Work alongside Scardale’s criminal gangs.

Scene: @UUID[Scene.aifWarehouse0000]{Warehouse}

Adventure (Import to Run): @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.adventures.Adventure.jP4Je75505qEz7qv]{Echoes of the Shaking Plague}

Situation. An outbreak of the Shaking Plague is spreading among the docks and slums of Scardale Town. An aspiring drug lord, Dyan Komar, accidentally reawakened the plague while conducting alchemical experiments.

Hook. A local healer, Kestra Alara, pleads with the characters to meet with the town’s three criminal syndicates and enlist their help to locate the source of the plague. She offers [[/award 5000gp]] for the party’s assistance.

Encounters

The adventure consists of these encounters.

Meeting of the Minds. Kestra has arranged a meeting with syndicate leaders at dusk at a tavern called The Rotting Gull.

Boss Sneed (Medium, Neutral Evil @UUID[Actor.aifBanditCrimeLo]{Bandit Crime Lord}) is the human leader of the Shaker Gang. He’s looking for an anniversary gift for his wife, an @UUID[Actor.aifArchpriest000]{Archpriest} of Tymora. If the characters can provide a suitable gift, he will help them.

Finchley (Small, Chaotic Evil @UUID[Actor.aifToughBoss0000]{Tough Boss}) is the halfling leader of the Dancers. He respects fighting ability and challenges one of the characters to non-deadly single combat. If the character wins and doesn’t kill Finchley, Finchley and his gang will help them.

Walenna Eventide (Medium, Chaotic Neutral @UUID[Actor.aifPirateCaptain]{Pirate Captain}) is the wood elf leader of the Stallions. The Sea Stallion is in need of repairs. If the characters promise to make it seaworthy again, she will help them. Repairing the ship requires 5,000 GP. Alternatively, characters can do the work in 100 days, divided by the number of characters working on the repairs.

See @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.book.JournalEntry.aifDalelandsGaze.JournalEntryPage.yuxHgo0GOPjQsg0O]{Scardale Town} in chapter 2 for more information on these individuals and their followers.

Finding the Source. The source of the plague is a filthy warehouse in the harbor district. It takes [[/r 3d4]] days of searching to find the warehouse. Reduce this by [[/r 1d4]] for every gang the party recruits; if they recruit all three gangs, they find the warehouse before sunrise. Your players might come up with novel strategies to quickly find the source of the plague.

The Warehouse. Use the map below for the warehouse, which contains Dyan’s alchemy lab. Characters searching the lab are exposed to the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.items.Item.aifShakingPlague]{Shaking Plague} (see @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.book.JournalEntry.aifDalelandsGaze.JournalEntryPage.uDg31v9jS2ij43MN#shaking-plague]{chapter 2}). Four @UUID[Actor.aifRevenant00000]{Revenants}, victims of Dyan’s alchemical testing, wander the warehouse and fight intruders. Within each of the southern labs lurks a @UUID[Actor.aifVioletFungusN]{Violet Fungus Necrohulk}. When either of the necrohulks is disturbed, it begins combat, waking the other, which bursts from the room it’s in.

Conclusion. Burning the warehouse to the ground eliminates the source of the plague, and the town slowly recovers. Each gang leader recruited by the party gives the characters an Uncommon magic item as thanks for saving the town.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.book.JournalEntry.aifAtlas00000000.JournalEntryPage.4KrDiuKnfWtDzDnM caption=false]

Heart of Fire.name: Heart of Fire
Heart of Fire.description:
A Deity (Torm) Adventure for

Level 13 Characters

Recover a sword from a dragon’s lair.

Situation. Chalsembyr’s Heart, a sentient Holy Avenger Greatsword sacred to Torm, has been located in the hoard of Khrangyrdis, an Adult Red Dragon and worshiper of Tiamat. Khran, as the dragon is often called, lairs near Ormpur. Complicating matters, Khran wears an Amulet of Proof against Detection and Location. Her lair is protected by a Forbiddance spell that damages Celestials.

Hook. Zimrir Chay (Medium Archpriest), a human devoted to Torm, asks the characters to acquire the sword from Khran. While the party could negotiate, he prefers that the dragon be destroyed, freeing the region from her sway. If the characters agree to slay the creature, Zimrir provides each character with a Potion of Healing (supreme) and a Potion of Fire Resistance.

Legendary Resistance.name: Legendary Resistance
Legendary Resistance.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three [[/item Rend]] attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of [[/item Spellcasting]] to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplScorchingR]{Scorching Ray}.

Fire Breath.name: Fire Breath
Fire Breath.description:
Dexterity Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=bDqgmtLG3zcVuqdi]], each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=bDqgmtLG3zcVuqdi]] in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=bDqgmtLG3zcVuqdi]]-foot Cone.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Success: Half damage.

Commanding Presence.name: Commanding Presence
Commanding Presence.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] uses [[/item Spellcasting]] to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplCommand000]{Command} (level 2 version). The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.

Command.name: Command
Command.description:
You speak a one-word command to a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or follow the command on its next turn. Choose the command from these options:

Approach. The target moves toward you by the shortest and most direct route, ending its turn if it moves within 5 feet of you.

Drop. The target drops whatever it is holding and then ends its turn.

Flee. The target spends its turn moving away from you by the fastest available means.

Grovel. The target has the Prone condition and then ends its turn.

Halt. On its turn, the target doesn't move and takes no action or Bonus Action.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can affect one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]], +12 to hit with spell attacks):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplCommand000]{Command} (level 2 version), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDetectMagi]{Detect Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplScorchingR]{Scorching Ray}

1/Day: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplFireball00]{Fireball}

Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell's school of magic.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Scorching Ray.name: Scorching Ray
Scorching Ray.description:
You hurl three fiery rays. You can hurl them at one target within range or at several. Make a ranged spell attack for each ray. On a hit, the target takes 2d6 Fire damage.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You create one additional ray for each spell slot level above 2.

[[@item.level + 1]]{Total Rays}

Fireball.name: Fireball
Fireball.description:
A bright streak flashes from you to a point you choose within range and then blossoms with a low roar into a fiery explosion. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius Sphere centered on that point makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking 8d6 Fire damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried start burning.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 3.

materials.value: a ball of bat guano and sulfur

Fiery Rays.name: Fiery Rays
Fiery Rays.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] uses [[/item Spellcasting]] to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplScorchingR]{Scorching Ray}. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.

Pounce.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves up to half its Speed, and it makes one [[/item Rend]] attack.

Stunned.description: The target has the &Reference[Stunned apply=false] condition until the end of the attacking creature's next turn.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
Spellcasting. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplLight00000]{Light}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplThaumaturg]{Thaumaturgy}

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplFlameStrik]{Flame Strike} (level 6 version), @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplGreaterRes]{Greater Restoration}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplRaiseDead0]{Raise Dead}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplZoneofTrut]{Zone of Truth}

Light.name: Light
Light.description:
You touch one Large or smaller object that isn’t being worn or carried by someone else. Until the spell ends, the object sheds Bright Light in a 20-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 20 feet. The light can be colored as you like.

Covering the object with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends if you cast it again.

Thaumaturgy.name: Thaumaturgy
Thaumaturgy.description:
You manifest a minor wonder within range. You create one of the effects below within range. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time.

Altered Eyes. You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

Booming Voice. Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute. For the duration, you have Advantage on [[/check ability=cha skill=itm]] checks.

Fire Play. You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.

Invisible Hand. You instantaneously cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.

Phantom Sound. You create an instantaneous sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as a rumble of thunder, the cry of a raven, or ominous whispers.

Tremors. You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.

Flame Strike.name: Flame Strike
Flame Strike.description:
A vertical column of brilliant fire roars down from above. Each creature in a 10-foot-radius, 40-foot-high Cylinder centered on a point within range makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking 5d6 Fire damage and 5d6 Radiant damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The Fire damage and the Radiant damage increase by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 5.

Greater Restoration.name: Greater Restoration
Greater Restoration.description:
You touch a creature and magically remove one of the following effects from it:

  • 1 &Reference[Exhaustion] level
  • The &Reference[Charmed] or &Reference[Petrified] condition
  • A curse, including the target’s Attunement to a cursed magic item
  • Any reduction to one of the target’s ability scores
  • Any reduction to the target’s Hit Point maximum

materials.value: diamond dust worth 100+ GP, which the spell consumes

Raise Dead.name: Raise Dead
Raise Dead.description:
With a touch, you revive a dead creature if it has been dead no longer than 10 days and it wasn’t Undead when it died.

The creature returns to life with 1 Hit Point. This spell also neutralizes any poisons that affected the creature at the time of death.

This spell closes all mortal wounds, but it doesn’t restore missing body parts. If the creature is lacking body parts or organs integral for its survival—its head, for instance—the spell automatically fails.

Coming back from the dead is an ordeal. The target takes a −4 penalty to D20 Tests. Every time the target finishes a Long Rest, the penalty is reduced by 1 until it becomes 0.

materials.value: a diamond worth 500+ GP, which the spell consumes

Resurrection Sickness (Day 1).name: Resurrection Sickness (Day 1)
Resurrection Sickness (Day 1).description: Coming back from the dead is an ordeal. The target takes a −4 penalty to D20 Tests. Every time the target finishes a Long Rest, the penalty is reduced by 1 until it becomes 0.

Resurrection Sickness (Day 2).name: Resurrection Sickness (Day 2)
Resurrection Sickness (Day 2).description: Coming back from the dead is an ordeal. The target takes a −4 penalty to D20 Tests. Every time the target finishes a Long Rest, the penalty is reduced by 1 until it becomes 0.

Resurrection Sickness (Day 4).name: Resurrection Sickness (Day 4)
Resurrection Sickness (Day 4).description: Coming back from the dead is an ordeal. The target takes a −4 penalty to D20 Tests. Every time the target finishes a Long Rest, the penalty is reduced by 1 until it becomes 0.

Resurrection Sickness (Day 3).name: Resurrection Sickness (Day 3)
Resurrection Sickness (Day 3).description: Coming back from the dead is an ordeal. The target takes a −4 penalty to D20 Tests. Every time the target finishes a Long Rest, the penalty is reduced by 1 until it becomes 0.

Zone of Truth.name: Zone of Truth
Zone of Truth.description:
You create a magical zone that guards against deception in a 15-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point within range. Until the spell ends, a creature that enters the spell’s area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there makes a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, a creature can’t speak a deliberate lie while in the radius. You know whether a creature succeeds or fails on this save.

An affected creature is aware of the spell and can avoid answering questions to which it would normally respond with a lie. Such a creature can be evasive yet must be truthful.

Cannot Lie.name: Cannot Lie
Cannot Lie.description:
On a failed save, a creature can’t speak a deliberate lie while in the radius. You know whether a creature succeeds or fails on this save.

An affected creature is aware of the spell and can avoid answering questions to which it would normally respond with a lie. Such a creature can be evasive yet must be truthful.

Divine Aid.name: Divine Aid
Divine Aid.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplBless00000]{Bless}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDispelMagi]{Dispel Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplHealingWor]{Healing Word}, or @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplLesserRest]{Lesser Restoration}, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

Bless.name: Bless
Bless.description:
You bless up to three creatures within range. Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target adds 1d4 to the attack roll or save.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

Blessed.name: Blessed
Blessed.description: Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target adds 1d4 to the attack roll or save.

Dispel Magic.name: Dispel Magic
Dispel Magic.description:
Choose one creature, object, or magical effect within range. Any ongoing spell of level 3 or lower on the target ends. For each ongoing spell of level 4 or higher on the target, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability (DC 10 plus that spell’s level). On a successful check, the spell ends.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You automatically end a spell on the target if the spell’s level is equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you use.

Healing Word.name: Healing Word
Healing Word.description:
A creature of your choice that you can see within range regains Hit Points equal to 2d4 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The healing increases by 2d4 for each spell slot level above 1.

Lesser Restoration.name: Lesser Restoration
Lesser Restoration.description: You touch a creature and end one condition on it: &Reference[blinded], &Reference[deafened], &Reference[paralyzed], or &Reference[poisoned].
