Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMageArmor0]{Mage Armor} (included in AC), @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplThaumaturg]{Thaumaturgy}

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplJallarzisS]{Jallarzi’s Storm of Radiance} (level 7 version), @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMassSugges]{Mass Suggestion}

Mage Armor.name: Mage Armor
Mage Armor.description: You touch a willing creature who isn’t wearing armor. Until the spell ends, the target’s base AC becomes 13 plus its Dexterity modifier. The spell ends early if the target dons armor.

Mage Armor.name: Mage Armor
Mage Armor.description: The target's base AC becomes 13 + its Dexterity modifier.

Thaumaturgy.name: Thaumaturgy
Thaumaturgy.description:
You manifest a minor wonder within range. You create one of the effects below within range. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time.

Altered Eyes. You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

Booming Voice. Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute. For the duration, you have Advantage on [[/check ability=cha skill=itm]] checks.

Fire Play. You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.

Invisible Hand. You instantaneously cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.

Phantom Sound. You create an instantaneous sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as a rumble of thunder, the cry of a raven, or ominous whispers.

Tremors. You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.

Jallarzi's Storm of Radiance.name: Jallarzi's Storm of Radiance
Jallarzi's Storm of Radiance.description:
You unleash a storm of flashing light and raging thunder in a 10-foot-radius, 40-foot-high Cylinder centered on a point you can see within range. While in this area, creatures have the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] and &Reference[Deafened apply=false] conditions, and they can’t cast spells with a Verbal component.

When the storm appears, each creature in it makes a Constitution saving throw, taking 2d10 Radiant damage and 2d10 Thunder damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature also makes this save when it enters the spell’s area for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there. A creature makes this save only once per turn.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The Radiant and Thunder damage increase by 1d10 for each spell slot level above 5.

Senses Overwhelmed.name: Senses Overwhelmed
Senses Overwhelmed.description: While in this area, creatures have the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] and &Reference[Deafened apply=false] conditions, and they can’t cast spells with a Verbal component.

Mass Suggestion.name: Mass Suggestion
Mass Suggestion.description:
You suggest a course of activity—described in no more than 25 words—to twelve or fewer creatures you can see within range that can hear and understand you. The suggestion must sound achievable and not involve anything that would obviously deal damage to any of the targets or their allies. For example, you could say, “Walk to the village down that road, and help the villagers there harvest crops until sunset.” Or you could say, “Now is not the time for violence. Drop your weapons, and dance! Stop in an hour.”

Each target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] condition for the duration or until you or your allies deal damage to the target. Each Charmed target pursues the suggestion to the best of its ability. The suggested activity can continue for the entire duration, but if the suggested activity can be completed in a shorter time, the spell ends for a target upon completing it.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The duration is longer with a spell slot of level 7 (10 days), 8 (30 days), or 9 (366 days).

Charmed.name: Charmed
Charmed.description: The target has the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] condition for the duration or until you or your allies deal damage to the target. Each Charmed target pursues the suggestion to the best of its ability.

Mage Armor.name: Mage Armor
Mage Armor.description: The target's base AC becomes 13 + its Dexterity modifier.

Fire Form.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without expending extra movement to do so, and it can enter a creature's space and stop there. The first time it enters a creature's space on a turn, that creature takes [[/damage average]] damage.

Foundry Note

Scaling is configured to roll the correct number of dice based on the distance traveled through water. 1 is default for 5 feet, 2 is for 10 feet, and so forth.

The target gains 1 &Reference[Exhaustion apply=false] level whenever it takes this burning damage.

Success: Half damage only.

Foundry Note

This feature provides an Active Effect that will modify the targeted object. Due to the fact that effect can be applied multiple times, the effect needs to be dragged from this item's Effect tab onto the target item's sheet each time the target gains a level of exhaustion after the initial level is applied.

When the Emanation enters a creature’s space, that creature takes [[/damage average]] damage. A creature [[lookup @target.affects.special activity=MUbX28KmoDF9sC5b]].

Foundry Note

This feature provides an Active Effect to manage Damage Resistances in the character sheet's Effects tab. The resistances outlined will need to be manually enabled/disabled.

Details.name: Details
Details.text:
A Deity (Torm) Adventure for

Level 13 Characters

Recover a sword from a dragon’s lair.

Scene: @UUID[Scene.aifHeartOfFireDr]{Heart of Fire}

Adventure (Import to Run): @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.adventures.Adventure.m8JoQnWaVSfRyEMx]{Heart of Fire}

Situation. @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.items.Item.aifHolyAvenger00]{Chalsembyr’s Heart}, a sentient @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.dmgHolyAvenger00]{Holy Avenger} Greatsword sacred to Torm, has been located in the hoard of Khrangyrdis, an @UUID[Actor.aifAdultRedDrago]{Adult Red Dragon} and worshiper of Tiamat. Khran, as the dragon is often called, lairs near Ormpur. Complicating matters, Khran wears an @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.dmgAmuletOfProof]{Amulet of Proof against Detection and Location}. Her lair is protected by a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplForbiddanc]{Forbiddance} spell that damages Celestials.

Hook. Zimrir Chay (Medium @UUID[Actor.aifArchpriest000]{Archpriest}), a human devoted to Torm, asks the characters to acquire the sword from Khran. While the party could negotiate, he prefers that the dragon be destroyed, freeing the region from her sway. If the characters agree to slay the creature, Zimrir provides each character with a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.dmgSupremePotion]{Potion of Healing} (supreme) and a @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.items.Item.aifPotionOfResis]{Potion of Fire Resistance}.

Encounters

The adventure consists of these encounters.

Saffron Slayers. The people of Ormpur know the location of Khran’s lair, east across the Shaar in the Dun Hills. But the dragon has countless well-paid eyes and ears in the city, so the party’s fame and purpose quickly spread. Elite forces of a gang in Khran’s employ—a @UUID[Actor.aifBanditCrimeLo]{Bandit Crime Lord}, a @UUID[Actor.aifSpyMaster0000]{Spy Master}, and two @UUID[Actor.aifAssassin00000]{Assassins}—ambush the characters and urge them to leave Ormpur for good.

Burning Shaar. More of Khran’s allies hear of the party and their quest, pursuing them into the Shaar and then the Dun Hills as the characters approach the lair. The elf Naedrin (Medium @UUID[Actor.aifCultistHierop]{Cultist Hierophant}) flies in on the back of Aphusso, a @UUID[Actor.aifYoungRedDrago]{Young Red Dragon}. Naedrin talks first, using his magic to turn would-be dragonslayers from their path. Failing that, Naedrin calls forth two @UUID[Actor.aifFireElemental]{Fire Elementals} and initiates combat. If the battle takes place in the Shaar, an @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.actors.Actor.dmgInferno000000]{inferno} (see @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.content.JournalEntry.dmgDmsToolbox000.JournalEntryPage.lVkdQivhFHqVmxg7#inferno]{chapter 3} of the Dungeon Master’s Guide) results.

Ash Lands. Khran greets the party from a hilltop the party must pass. If battle ensues, she leaves as soon as she can, with a parting invitation to join her later for a fine meal.

Khrangyrdis’s Lair. Use the @UUID[Scene.aifHeartOfFireDr]{Dragon Lair} map in appendix B of the Dungeon Master’s Guide. This structure is an old temple to Tiamat, destroyed during the Spellplague. Khran prefers level 3, but she doesn’t want her servants slain and fights intruders when she becomes aware of them. Khran’s lair is further detailed below:

Level 1. Bizarre yet elegant formations of sharp, melted stone make up the scorched ruins that top Khran’s hill. An unscathed shrine to Tiamat remains in the northeastern corner, outside two stone doors, each with a @UUID[Actor.aifSalamander000]{Salamander} guard. These guards allow visitors to enter the site. Beyond the doors, a @UUID[Actor.aifSalamanderInf]{Salamander Inferno Master} tends an ancient pool of molten stone for Khran’s enjoyment. Once the party is inside, the master and guards ambush them.

Level 2. Walls and pillars carved with images extolling the glory of the Dragon Queen make up this firelit level. Four red @UUID[Actor.aifHalfdragon000]{Half-Dragons} live and work here, guided by a @UUID[Actor.aifFiendCultist0]{Fiend Cultist}. These loyal minions fight intruders.

Level 3. Khran dwells and stores her hoard, including @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.items.Item.aifHolyAvenger00]{Chalsembyr’s Heart}, here.

Conclusion. Tormtars celebrate characters who return Chalsembyr’s Heart to the House of the Hand. Priests offer the sword to a character who serves Torm and is willing to search for the lost realm of Chalsembyr, which Torm ruled as a mortal.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.book.JournalEntry.aifArtHandouts00.JournalEntryPage.AnOSlwqGPrUk91RD caption=false]

Clockwork Memories.name: Clockwork Memories
Clockwork Memories.description:
A Location (Baldur's Gate) Adventure for

Level 7 Characters

Protect an inventor from the Guild.

Situation. A Gondian inventor named Flurn Eightspoke has unlocked a way to preserve a person’s memories in a clockwork brain. He doesn’t realize his test subject was a Guild informant, and now the Guild wants both Flurn and his mechanical creation destroyed.

Hook. A smith offers the characters a discount in exchange for checking on his former boss, the inventor Flurn Eightspoke, at his Heapside workshop. The smith has heard rumors that Flurn ran afoul of the Guild but can’t imagine what the good-natured inventor could have done to deserve this attention. Alternatively, mechanically oriented characters hear that Flurn has completed a great invention and stop by to check it out.

Divine Aid.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplBless00000]{Bless}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDispelMagi]{Dispel Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplHealingWor]{Healing Word}, or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplLesserRest]{Lesser Restoration}, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

Bless.name: Bless
Bless.description:
You bless up to three creatures within range. Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target adds 1d4 to the attack roll or save.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

Blessed.name: Blessed
Blessed.description: Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target adds 1d4 to the attack roll or save.

Dispel Magic.name: Dispel Magic
Dispel Magic.description:
Choose one creature, object, or magical effect within range. Any ongoing spell of level 3 or lower on the target ends. For each ongoing spell of level 4 or higher on the target, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability (DC 10 plus that spell's level). On a successful check, the spell ends.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You automatically end a spell on the target if the spell's level is equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you use.

Healing Word.name: Healing Word
Healing Word.description:
A creature of your choice that you can see within range regains Hit Points equal to 2d4 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The healing increases by 2d4 for each spell slot level above 1.

Lesser Restoration.name: Lesser Restoration
Lesser Restoration.description: You touch a creature and end one condition on it: &Reference[blinded], &Reference[deafened], &Reference[paralyzed], or &Reference[poisoned].

Light.name: Light
Light.description:
You touch one Large or smaller object that isn't being worn or carried by someone else. Until the spell ends, the object sheds Bright Light in a 20-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 20 feet. The light can be colored as you like.

Covering the object with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends if you cast it again.

Thaumaturgy.name: Thaumaturgy
Thaumaturgy.description:
You manifest a minor wonder within range. You create one of the effects below within range. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time.

Altered Eyes. You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

Booming Voice. Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute. For the duration, you have Advantage on [[/check ability=cha skill=itm]] checks.

Fire Play. You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.

Invisible Hand. You instantaneously cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.

Phantom Sound. You create an instantaneous sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as a rumble of thunder, the cry of a raven, or ominous whispers.

Tremors. You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.

Spiritual Weapon.name: Spiritual Weapon
Spiritual Weapon.description:
You create a floating, spectral force that resembles a weapon of your choice and lasts for the duration. The force appears within range in a space of your choice, and you can immediately make one melee spell attack against one creature within 5 feet of the force. On a hit, the target takes Force damage equal to 1d8 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

As a Bonus Action on your later turns, you can move the force up to 20 feet and repeat the attack against a creature within 5 feet of it.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for every slot level above 2.

Training.name: Training
Training.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has proficiency in one skill of the DM's choice and has Advantage whenever it makes an ability check using that skill.

Nimblewright Guard.name: Nimblewright Guard
Nimblewright Guard.description:
Cunningly Crafted Clockwork Sentinels

Nimblewrights are fabricated from durable wood and animated by magic and clockwork gears. Some nimblewrights bear metal plates to protect their cogs and springs, while others have their workings exposed. No mere automatons, nimblewrights can form rudimentary plans and adapt their routines to account for dangers.

Nimblewrights are surprisingly dexterous for creations made of animated wood and metal. A nimblewright walks with a flowing grace and fights with whirling pirouettes.

Nimblewrights can serve as interesting background flavor in Calimshan or other areas where they are common. Roll or choose a result from the Nimblewright Tasks table as inspiration for what a nimblewright guard or nimblewright hulk might be doing in a busy public place.

@embed[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.tables.RollTable.aifNimblewrightT rollable resultLabel="The Nimblewright Is …"]

Nimblewright Guard

Watchful sentries that patrol important sites, nimblewright guards serve as loyal soldiers or work as vigilant bodyguards.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The nimblewright makes three attacks, using [[/item Scimitar]] or [[/item Clockwork Crossbow]] in any combination.

Evasion.name: Evasion
Evasion.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the save and only half damage if it fails. It can’t use this trait if it has the Incapacitated condition.

Parry.name: Parry
Parry.description:
Trigger: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] is [[lookup @activation.condition activity=aLG3BRZL7P6OEjwd]].

Response: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] adds [[lookup @roll.formula activity=aLG3BRZL7P6OEjwd]] to its AC against that attack, possibly causing it to miss.

Use.name: Use
Use.condition: hit by a melee attack roll while holding a weapon

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item Slam]] attacks.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]].

Aversion to Fire.name: Aversion to Fire
Aversion to Fire.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes Fire damage, it has Disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

Averse.name: Averse
Averse.description: It has Disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

Berserk.name: Berserk
Berserk.description:
Whenever the [[lookup @name lowercase]] starts its turn &Reference[Bloodied], roll [[/r 1d6]]. On a 6, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] goes berserk. On each of its turns while berserk, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] attacks the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] attacks an object. Once the [[lookup @name lowercase]] goes berserk, it remains so until it is destroyed or it is no longer Bloodied.

The [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s creator, if within [[lookup @range.value activity=tnkOsrSwEElO2kZM]] feet of the berserk [[lookup @name lowercase]], can try to calm it by taking an action to make a [[/check ability=cha skill=per dc=@abilities.str.dc]] DC 15 Charisma (Persuasion) check; the golem must be able to hear its creator. If this check succeeds, the golem ceases being berserk until the start of its next turn, at which point it resumes rolling for the Berserk trait again if it is still Bloodied.

Berserk.name: Berserk
Berserk.description: On each of its turns while berserk, the creature attacks the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the creature attacks an object. Once the creature goes berserk, it remains so until it is destroyed or it is no longer &Reference[Bloodied apply=false].

Lightning Absorption.name: Lightning Absorption
Lightning Absorption.description: Whenever the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is subjected to Lightning damage, it regains a number of Hit Points equal to the Lightning damage dealt.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item Slam]] attacks.

Wand.name: Wand
Wand.description: An @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.equipment.Item.phbagArcaneFocus]{Arcane Focus} is bejeweled or carved to channel arcane magic. A Sorcerer, Warlock, or Wizard can use such an item as a Spellcasting Focus.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three [[/item .l4INK64V3wIju2AS]] attacks.

Blinding Flash.name: Blinding Flash
Blinding Flash.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=Onad9uNiCzAMfuwf]], each creature in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=Onad9uNiCzAMfuwf]]-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=Onad9uNiCzAMfuwf]] feet.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] condition until the start of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s next turn.

Success: Half damage only.

Blinded.name: Blinded
Blinded.description: the target has the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] condition until the start of the user’s next turn.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDisguiseSe]{Disguise Self}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMageHand00]{Mage Hand}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMinorIllus]{Minor Illusion}

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplHoldPerson]{Hold Person} (level 4 version), @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMageArmor0]{Mage Armor} (included in AC), @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMajorImage]{Major Image}

Disguise Self.name: Disguise Self
Disguise Self.description:
You make yourself—including your clothing, armor, weapons, and other belongings on your person—look different until the spell ends. You can seem 1 foot shorter or taller and can appear heavier or lighter. You must adopt a form that has the same basic arrangement of limbs as you have. Otherwise, the extent of the illusion is up to you.

The changes wrought by this spell fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, if you use this spell to add a hat to your outfit, objects pass through the hat, and anyone who touches it would feel nothing.

To discern that you are disguised, a creature must take the Study action to inspect your appearance and succeed on an [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC.

Disguised.name: Disguised
Disguised.description: To discern that you are disguised, a creature must take the Study action to inspect your appearance and succeed on an [[/check ability=int skill=inv]] check against your spell save DC.

Mage Hand.name: Mage Hand
Mage Hand.description:
A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.

When you cast the spell, you can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial.

As a Magic action on your later turns, you can control the hand thus again. As part of that action, you can move the hand up to 30 feet.

The hand can’t attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

Minor Illusion.name: Minor Illusion
Minor Illusion.description:
You create a sound or an image of an object within range that lasts for the duration. See the descriptions below for the effects of each. The illusion ends if you cast this spell again.

If a creature takes a Study action to examine the sound or image, the creature can determine that it is an illusion with a successful [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the illusion becomes faint to the creature.

Sound. If you create a sound, its volume can range from a whisper to a scream. It can be your voice, someone else’s voice, a lion’s roar, a beating of drums, or any other sound you choose. The sound continues unabated throughout the duration, or you can make discrete sounds at different times before the spell ends.

Image. If you create an image of an object—such as a chair, muddy footprints, or a small chest—it must be no larger than a 5-foot Cube. The image can’t create sound, light, smell, or any other sensory effect. Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, since things can pass through it.

Hold Person.name: Hold Person
Hold Person.description:
Choose a Humanoid that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the &Reference[paralyzed apply=false] condition for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional Humanoid for each spell slot level above 2.

Paralyzed.name: Paralyzed
Paralyzed.description: At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the [[/save ability=wis]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Mage Armor.name: Mage Armor
Mage Armor.description: You touch a willing creature who isn’t wearing armor. Until the spell ends, the target’s base AC becomes 13 plus its Dexterity modifier. The spell ends early if the target dons armor.

Mage Armor.name: Mage Armor
Mage Armor.description: The target's base AC becomes 13 + its Dexterity modifier.

Major Image.name: Major Image
Major Image.description:
You create the image of an object, a creature, or some other visible phenomenon that is no larger than a 20-foot Cube. The image appears at a spot that you can see within range and lasts for the duration. It seems real, including sounds, smells, and temperature appropriate to the thing depicted, but it can’t deal damage or cause conditions.

If you are within range of the illusion, you can take a Magic action to cause the image to move to any other spot within range. As the image changes location, you can alter its appearance so that its movements appear natural for the image. For example, if you create an image of a creature and move it, you can alter the image so that it appears to be walking. Similarly, you can cause the illusion to make different sounds at different times, even making it carry on a conversation, for example.

Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, for things can pass through it. A creature that takes a Study action to examine the image can determine that it is an illusion with a successful [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the creature can see through the image, and its other sensory qualities become faint to the creature.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The spell lasts until dispelled, without requiring Concentration, if cast with a level 4+ spell slot.

Cunning Action.name: Cunning Action
Cunning Action.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes the &Reference[Dash apply=false], the &Reference[Disengage apply=false], or &Reference[Hide apply=false] action.

Shortsword.name: Shortsword
Shortsword.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]], and the target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the start of the assassin's next turn.

Poisoned.name: Poisoned
Poisoned.description: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the start of the assassin’s next turn.

Evasion.name: Evasion
Evasion.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the save and only half damage if it fails. It can't use this trait if it has the Incapacitated condition.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three attacks, using [[/item .jLa5l9pntsTVrMKH]] or [[/item .dL4668G7zXeC5zyY]] in any combination.

Cunning Action.name: Cunning Action
Cunning Action.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes the &Reference[Dash apply=false], the &Reference[Disengage apply=false], or &Reference[Hide apply=false] action.

Details.name: Details
Details.text:
A Location (Baldur's Gate) Adventure for

Level 7 Characters

Protect an inventor from the Guild.

Scene: @UUID[Scene.aifClockworkMemo]{Roadside Inn}

Adventure (Import to Run): @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.adventures.Adventure.nhztXMmry4TBJgMN]{Clockwork Memories}

Situation. A Gondian inventor named Flurn Eightspoke has unlocked a way to preserve a person’s memories in a clockwork brain. He doesn’t realize his test subject was a Guild informant, and now the Guild wants both Flurn and his mechanical creation destroyed.

Hook. A smith offers the characters a discount in exchange for checking on his former boss, the inventor Flurn Eightspoke, at his Heapside workshop. The smith has heard rumors that Flurn ran afoul of the Guild but can’t imagine what the good-natured inventor could have done to deserve this attention. Alternatively, mechanically oriented characters hear that Flurn has completed a great invention and stop by to check it out.

Encounters

The adventure consists of these encounters.

Eightspoke Workshop. Use the @UUID[Scene.aifClockworkMemo]{Roadside Inn} map in appendix C of the Dungeon Master’s Guide. Use the ground floor only; the upper floor is a rooftop patio and a single room where Flurn sleeps. The workshop is a cluttered, noisy place that smells of cut wood and wet metal. Apart from Flurn Eightspoke (Small, Lawful Neutral @UUID[Actor.aifPriest0000000]{Priest}), eight @UUID[Actor.aifCommoner00000]{Commoners} work as apprentices throughout the workshop.

Clockwork Guards. Six @UUID[Actor.aifNimblewrightG]{Nimblewright Soldiers} (see chapter 9) patrol the workshop grounds, including its roof, in pairs. They ignore the characters as they patrol.

Meeting Flurn. Flurn meets the characters. He has a perpetually puzzled look on his face but a friendly demeanor. Flurn gives the characters a quick tour, concluding with his planning room. He is oblivious to Guild agents who have recently been casing his workshop, and he knows of no trouble.

Storage Barn. The covered barn to the west looks like a stable but it holds supplies: iron ingots in one stall, lumber in another, screws and bolts in another, and so on. A suit of @UUID[Actor.aifAnimatedArmor]{Animated Armor} keeps inventory on a slate board bolted to its chest.

Assembly Room. The workshop’s goods are assembled on the three tables in this room. At least some of Flurn’s apprentices are here around the clock. A mechanical fox named Flywheel (use the @UUID[Actor.aifWeasel0000000]{Weasel} stat block, except it’s a Construct rather than a Beast) prowls this room, demanding frequent head pats.

Forge. The room south of the assembly room is a hot, crowded forge. Molds for several sizes of clockwork gears are stacked haphazardly. A small office connected to the forge holds plans for metal pieces, out of the way of errant embers.

Planning Room. The large room to the east has several drafting tables. The walls and tables bear hundreds of half-finished schematics that demonstrate Flurn’s genius. The planning room holds two items of interest: a brain in a jar that Flurn is using as a model (it belonged to an accountant who knew the secret identity of Heapside’s shadowy kingpin), and a mechanical person with its clockwork brain exposed (use the @UUID[Actor.aifFleshGolem000]{Flesh Golem} stat block). The brass and iron brain is a whirring marvel. Flurn has the mechanical person sit up and asks it to solve a few complex equations on a notepad, but before the demonstration gets too far, the Guild makes its move.

The Guild Strikes. The Guild attack comes in two phases: first, a @UUID[Actor.aifBanditDeceive]{Bandit Deceiver} and two @UUID[Actor.aifSpy0000000000]{Spies} come to the workshop’s west entrance to loudly complain of shoddy work. The apprentices try to mollify them, but when Flurn approaches, the Guild agents try to kill him and any characters accompanying him. Meanwhile, an @UUID[Actor.aifAssassin00000]{Assassin} sneaks over the roof to locate and destroy both the physical brain and the mechanical person. The assassin is disguised as an innocent apprentice. The ruse lets him slip past the workshop’s nimblewright guards. The assassin fights if confronted or if given the opportunity to complete the mission.

The Guards Activate. Once any attempt is made on Flurn’s life, his nimblewrights become Hostile to everyone who doesn’t work at the workshop. Their programming compels them to hunt intruders, which includes the characters. You can use the nimblewrights in pairs or even as a big group to challenge the characters—or to help them if the characters struggle against the Guild intruders.

Valuable Memories. If the characters save Flurn and his mechanical person, the mechanical creation takes the notepad and writes, “They came for me because I know Gregor Undarin, flower merchant, is secretly Guild kingpin of Heapside.” The mechanical person might also share details of Gregor’s shady accounts or the location of Gregor’s hidden vaults of ill-gotten treasure, leading to future adventures. Either way, this knowledge earns the characters the Guild’s enmity for as long as Gregor is in power.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.book.JournalEntry.aifAtlas00000000.JournalEntryPage.YsJCgr3GXtV3IU2X caption=false]

Dragon Orb.name: Dragon Orb
Dragon Orb.description:
A Faction (Cult of the Dragon) Adventure for

Level 9 Characters

Retrieve an Artifact for the Cult of the Dragon.

Situation. A Cult of the Dragon cell believes the Orb of Damara (see chapter 8) lies in the trove of Cylrotanth, an Adult Copper Dragon who dwells in the southern Serpent Hills.

Hook. Human Dragonfang Dain Romelin (Medium, Chaotic Evil Cultist Fanatic) hires the characters to retrieve the orb from Cylrotanth’s lair and bring it to him in Soubar, northwest of Triel along the Trade Way near Boareskyr Bridge. Dain claims he has heard the dragon is huge and has reddish scales; he doesn’t admit Cylrotanth is a copper dragon. He offers the party 2,000 GP to complete this mission on the cult’s behalf, and he pays half up front.

Legendary Resistance.name: Legendary Resistance
Legendary Resistance.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three [[/item Rend]] attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of (A) [[/item Slowing Breath]] or (B) [[/item Spellcasting]] to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMindSpike0]{Mind Spike} (level 4 version).

Acid Breath.name: Acid Breath
Acid Breath.description:
Dexterity Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=qNI6W02jCUQbPpYE]], each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=qNI6W02jCUQbPpYE]] in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=qNI6W02jCUQbPpYE]]-foot-long, [[lookup @target.template.width activity=qNI6W02jCUQbPpYE]]-foot-wide Line.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Success: [[lookup @damage.onSave capitalize activity=qNI6W02jCUQbPpYE]] damage.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDetectMagi]{Detect Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMindSpike0]{Mind Spike} (level 4 version), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMinorIllus]{Minor Illusion}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplShapechang]{Shapechange} (Beast or Humanoid form only, no Temporary Hit Points gained from the spell, and no Concentration or Temporary Hit Points required to maintain the spell)

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplGreaterRes]{Greater Restoration}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMajorImage]{Major Image}

Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell's school of magic.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Mind Spike.name: Mind Spike
Mind Spike.description:
You drive a spike of psionic energy into the mind of one creature you can see within range. The target makes a Wisdom saving throw, taking 3d8 Psychic damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. On a failed save, you also always know the target's location until the spell ends, but only while the two of you are on the same plane of existence. While you have this knowledge, the target can't become hidden from you, and if it has the &Reference[invisible apply=false] condition, it gains no benefit from that condition against you.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for each spell slot level above 2.

Spiked.name: Spiked
Spiked.description: You always know the target’s location until the spell ends, but only while the two of you are on the same plane of existence. While you have this knowledge, the target can’t become hidden from you, and if it has the &Reference[invisible apply=false] condition, it gains no benefit from that condition against you.

Minor Illusion.name: Minor Illusion
Minor Illusion.description:
You create a sound or an image of an object within range that lasts for the duration. See the descriptions below for the effects of each. The illusion ends if you cast this spell again.

If a creature takes a Study action to examine the sound or image, the creature can determine that it is an illusion with a successful [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the illusion becomes faint to the creature.

Sound. If you create a sound, its volume can range from a whisper to a scream. It can be your voice, someone else's voice, a lion's roar, a beating of drums, or any other sound you choose. The sound continues unabated throughout the duration, or you can make discrete sounds at different times before the spell ends.

Image. If you create an image of an object—such as a chair, muddy footprints, or a small chest—it must be no larger than a 5-foot Cube. The image can't create sound, light, smell, or any other sensory effect. Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, since things can pass through it.

Shapechange.name: Shapechange
Shapechange.description:
You shape-shift into another creature for the duration or until you take a Magic action to shape-shift into a different eligible form. The new form must be of a creature that has a Challenge Rating no higher than your level or Challenge Rating. You must have seen the sort of creature before, and it can't be a Construct or an Undead.

When you shape-shift, you gain a number of Temporary Hit Points equal to the Hit Points of the form. The spell ends early if you have no Temporary Hit Points left.

Your game statistics are replaced by the stat block of the chosen form, but you retain your creature type; alignment; personality; Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores; Hit Points; Hit Point Dice; proficiencies; and ability to communicate. If you have the Spellcasting feature, you retain it too.

Upon shape-shifting, you determine whether your equipment drops to the ground or changes in size and shape to fit the new form while you're in it.

Greater Restoration.name: Greater Restoration
Greater Restoration.description:
You touch a creature and magically remove one of the following effects from it:

  • 1 &Reference[Exhaustion] level
  • The &Reference[Charmed] or &Reference[Petrified] condition
  • A curse, including the target's Attunement to a cursed magic item
  • Any reduction to one of the target's ability scores
  • Any reduction to the target's Hit Point maximum

materials.value: diamond dust worth 100+ GP, which the spell consumes

Major Image.name: Major Image
Major Image.description:
You create the image of an object, a creature, or some other visible phenomenon that is no larger than a 20-foot Cube. The image appears at a spot that you can see within range and lasts for the duration. It seems real, including sounds, smells, and temperature appropriate to the thing depicted, but it can't deal damage or cause conditions.

If you are within range of the illusion, you can take a Magic action to cause the image to move to any other spot within range. As the image changes location, you can alter its appearance so that its movements appear natural for the image. For example, if you create an image of a creature and move it, you can alter the image so that it appears to be walking. Similarly, you can cause the illusion to make different sounds at different times, even making it carry on a conversation, for example.

Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, for things can pass through it. A creature that takes a Study action to examine the image can determine that it is an illusion with a successful [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the creature can see through the image, and its other sensory qualities become faint to the creature.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The spell lasts until dispelled, without requiring Concentration, if cast with a level 4+ spell slot.

Giggling Magic.name: Giggling Magic
Giggling Magic.description:
Charisma Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=Ttrajc4RC5Ut7pkj]], [[lookup @target.affects.labels.statblock activity=Ttrajc4RC5Ut7pkj]] the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=Ttrajc4RC5Ut7pkj]] feet.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage. Until the end of its next turn, the target rolls [[/r 1d6]] whenever it makes an ability check or attack roll and subtracts the number rolled from the D20 Test.

Failure or Success: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.

Giggling.name: Giggling
Giggling.description: Until the end of its next turn, the target rolls [[/r 1d6]] whenever it makes an ability check or attack and subtracts the number rolled from the D20 Test.

Mind Jolt.name: Mind Jolt
Mind Jolt.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] uses Spellcasting to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMindSpike0]{Mind Spike} (level 4 version). The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.

Pounce.name: Pounce
Pounce.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves up to half its Speed, and it makes one [[/item Rend]] attack.

Slowing Breath.name: Slowing Breath
Slowing Breath.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=teMMQNDDIE9XkPN3]], each creature in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=teMMQNDDIE9XkPN3]]-foot Cone.

Failure: The target can't take Reactions; its Speed is halved; and it can take either an action or a Bonus Action on its turn, not both. This effect lasts until the end of its next turn.

1/2 Speed | Action Restrictions.name: 1/2 Speed | Action Restrictions
1/2 Speed | Action Restrictions.description: The target can’t take Reactions; its Speed is halved; and it can take either an action or a Bonus Action on its turn, not both. This effect lasts until the end of its next turn.

Cultist Fanatic.name: Cultist Fanatic
Cultist Fanatic.description:
Gear: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagHolySymbolV]{Holy Symbol (Varies)}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbarmLeatherArm]{Leather Armor}

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]], +4 to hit with spell attacks):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplLight00000]{Light}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplThaumaturg]{Thaumaturgy}

2/Day: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplCommand000]{Command}

1/Day: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplHoldPerson]{Hold Person}

Spiritual Weapon.name: Spiritual Weapon
Spiritual Weapon.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplSpiritualW]{Spiritual Weapon} spell, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

z817Et9IPt6qHawH.name: Spiritual Weapon z817Et9IPt6qHawH
z817Et9IPt6qHawH.description:
You create a floating, spectral force that resembles a weapon of your choice and lasts for the duration. The force appears within range in a space of your choice, and you can immediately make one melee spell attack against one creature within 5 feet of the force. On a hit, the target takes Force damage equal to 1d8 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

As a Bonus Action on your later turns, you can move the force up to 20 feet and repeat the attack against a creature within 5 feet of it.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for every slot level above 2.

Light.name: Light
Light.description:
You touch one Large or smaller object that isn't being worn or carried by someone else. Until the spell ends, the object sheds Bright Light in a 20-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 20 feet. The light can be colored as you like.

Covering the object with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends if you cast it again.

Thaumaturgy.name: Thaumaturgy
Thaumaturgy.description:
You manifest a minor wonder within range. You create one of the effects below within range. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time.

Altered Eyes. You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

Booming Voice. Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute. For the duration, you have Advantage on [[/check ability=cha skill=itm]] checks.

Fire Play. You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.

Invisible Hand. You instantaneously cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.

Phantom Sound. You create an instantaneous sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as a rumble of thunder, the cry of a raven, or ominous whispers.

Tremors. You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.

Command.name: Command
Command.description:
You speak a one-word command to a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or follow the command on its next turn. Choose the command from these options:

Approach. The target moves toward you by the shortest and most direct route, ending its turn if it moves within 5 feet of you.

Drop. The target drops whatever it is holding and then ends its turn.

Flee. The target spends its turn moving away from you by the fastest available means.

Grovel. The target has the Prone condition and then ends its turn.

Halt. On its turn, the target doesn't move and takes no action or Bonus Action.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can affect one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

Hold Person.name: Hold Person
Hold Person.description:
Choose a Humanoid that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the &Reference[paralyzed apply=false] condition for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional Humanoid for each spell slot level above 2.

Paralyzed.name: Paralyzed
Paralyzed.description: At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the [[/save ability=wis]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Loathsome Limbs.name: Loathsome Limbs
Loathsome Limbs.description:
If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] ends any turn Bloodied and took 15+ Slashing damage during that turn, one of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]l's limbs is severed, falls into the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s space, and becomes a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmTrollLimb00000]{Troll Limb}. The limb acts immediately after the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s turn. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has 1 &Reference[Exhaustion apply=false] level for each missing limb, and it grows replacement limbs the next time it regains Hit Points.

Foundry Note

This feature provides an Active Effect condition in the character sheet's Effects tab to enable each level of Exhaustion. Since the condition can be applied multiple times, the GM must manually manage the level of Exhaustion. There is an active effect available for each level of exhaustion.

Exhaustion 1.name: Exhaustion 1
Exhaustion 1.description: The creature has 1 &Reference[Exhaustion apply=false] level for each missing limb.

Spellcasting (Yuan-ti Form Only).description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplAnimalFrie]{Animal Friendship} (snakes only)

Shape-Shift.name: Shape-Shift
Shape-Shift.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] shape-shifts into a Large snake or returns to its true form. The [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s game statistics are the same in each form, except where noted. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn’t transformed.

Animal Friendship.name: Animal Friendship
Animal Friendship.description:
Target a Beast that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the &Reference[charmed apply=false] condition for the duration. If you or one of your allies deals damage to the target, the spells ends.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional Beast for each spell slot level above 1.

Charmed.name: Charmed
Charmed.description: The target has the &Reference[charmed apply=false] condition for the duration. If you or one of your allies deals damage to the target, the spells ends.

Suggestion.name: Suggestion
Suggestion.description:
You suggest a course of activity—described in no more than 25 words—to one creature you can see within range that can hear and understand you. The suggestion must sound achievable and not involve anything that would obviously deal damage to the target or its allies. For example, you could say, “Fetch the key to the cult’s treasure vault, and give the key to me.” Or you could say, “Stop fighting, leave this library peacefully, and don’t return.”

The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the Charmed condition for the duration or until you or your allies deal damage to the target. The Charmed target pursues the suggestion to the best of its ability. The suggested activity can continue for the entire duration, but if the suggested activity can be completed in a shorter time, the spell ends for the target upon completing it.

Pursuing Suggestion.name: Pursuing Suggestion
Pursuing Suggestion.description: The Charmed target pursues the suggestion to the best of its ability. The suggested activity can continue for the entire duration, but if the suggested activity can be completed in a shorter time, the spell ends for the target upon completing it.

Portent.name: Portent
Portent.description: Trigger: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] [[lookup @target.affects.special activity=4pPRsHy9QaQvVgqt]] it can see makes a D20 Test. Response: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] rolls [[/r 1d20]] and chooses whether to use that roll in place of the d20 rolled for the D20 Test.

Arcane Eye.name: Arcane Eye
Arcane Eye.description:
You create an Invisible, invulnerable eye within range that hovers for the duration. You mentally receive visual information from the eye, which can see in every direction. It also has Darkvision with a range of 30 feet.

As a Bonus Action, you can move the eye up to 30 feet in any direction. A solid barrier blocks the eye’s movement, but the eye can pass through an opening as small as 1 inch in diameter.

Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell’s school of magic.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Locate Object.name: Locate Object
Locate Object.description:
Describe or name an object that is familiar to you. You sense the direction to the object’s location if that object is within 1,000 feet of you. If the object is in motion, you know the direction of its movement.

The spell can locate a specific object known to you if you have seen it up close—within 30 feet—at least once. Alternatively, the spell can locate the nearest object of a particular kind, such as a certain kind of apparel, jewelry, furniture, tool, or weapon.

This spell can’t locate an object if any thickness of lead blocks a direct path between you and the object.

Legend Lore.name: Legend Lore
Legend Lore.description:
Name or describe a famous person, place, or object. The spell brings to your mind a brief summary of the significant lore about that famous thing, as described by the DM.

The lore might consist of important details, amusing revelations, or even secret lore that has never been widely known. The more information you already know about the thing, the more precise and detailed the information you receive is. That information is accurate but might be couched in figurative language or poetry, as determined by the DM.

If the famous thing you chose isn’t actually famous, you hear sad musical notes played on a trombone, and the spell fails.

materials.value: incense worth 250+ GP, which the spell consumes, and four ivory strips worth 50+ GP each

Details.name: Details
Details.text:
A Faction (Cult of the Dragon) Adventure for

Level 9 Characters

Retrieve an Artifact for the Cult of the Dragon.

Scene: @UUID[Scene.aifCylrotanthsLa]{Cylrotanths Lair}

Adventure (Import to Run): @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.adventures.Adventure.oFbJ7xk06Xkm7sME]{Dragon Orb}

Situation. A Cult of the Dragon cell believes the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.items.Item.aifOrbOfDamara00]{Orb of Damara} (see @UUID[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.book.JournalEntry.aifMagicItems000.JournalEntryPage.OrbofDamarazSdTO]{chapter 8}) lies in the trove of Cylrotanth, an @UUID[Actor.aifAdultCopperDr]{Adult Copper Dragon} who dwells in the southern Serpent Hills.

Hook. Human Dragonfang Dain Romelin (Medium, Chaotic Evil @UUID[Actor.aifCultistFanati]{Cultist Fanatic}) hires the characters to retrieve the orb from Cylrotanth’s lair and bring it to him in Soubar, northwest of Triel along the Trade Way near Boareskyr Bridge. Dain claims he has heard the dragon is huge and has reddish scales; he doesn’t admit Cylrotanth is a copper dragon. He offers the party [[/award 2000gp]] to complete this mission on the cult’s behalf, and he pays half up front.

Encounters

The adventure consists of these encounters.

Travel to the Lair. Cylrotanth’s lair lies 135 miles north of Soubar. Each day, use the appropriate encounter below:

Day 1. Wrathful riders (five @UUID[Actor.aifFlamingSkelet]{Flaming Skeletons} riding @UUID[Actor.aifNightmare0000]{Nightmares}) burst from the Fields of the Dead to reenact a fateful charge, targeting the characters.

Day 2. Three @UUID[Actor.aifTroll00000000]{Trolls} try to make a meal of the party.

Day 3. Two @UUID[Actor.aifYoungGreenDra]{Young Green Dragons} stalk the party through the Forest of Wyrms.

Day 4. A @UUID[Actor.aifGrickAncient0]{Grick Ancient} ambushes the characters, and six @UUID[Actor.aifGrick00000000]{Gricks} drop from trees to join in.

Day 5. Near Thlohtzin, a @UUID[Actor.aifYuantiAbomina]{Yuan-ti Abomination} and four @UUID[Actor.aifYuantiMalison]{Yuan-ti Malisons (Type 1)} try to take the party prisoner.

Day 6. Cylrotanth’s friends—Kergan, a @UUID[Actor.aifCyclopsOracle]{Cyclops Oracle}, and Serteus, a @UUID[Actor.mmCyclopsSentry0]{Cyclops Sentry}—confront the characters with foreknowledge of their intent. They are Indifferent but defend themselves if the characters fight them.

Cylrotanth’s Lair. Cylrotanth welcomes the group to his lair and asks if they’ve met his cyclops friends (see above). He becomes Hostile if he learns the group harmed the giants, but he doesn’t fight. He’s willing to trade for his orb, which is a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.dmgCrystalBall00]{Crystal Ball} worth 40,000 GP.

Cult Ambush. Assuming a fight with the dragon has weakened the group, Dain betrays the party in an attempt to take the orb for himself. He’s accompanied by four @UUID[Actor.aifToughBoss0000]{Tough Bosses}, and they ambush the characters outside Cylrotanth’s lair. If the characters befriended the dragon, Cylrotanth helps subdue these attackers.

Conclusion. If parting on good terms, Cylrotanth considers the characters new friends. He rewards them for defeating Dain, giving them the Crystal Ball. If they traded him for it, he returns whatever they traded to him. If the party turns the orb over to the Cult of the Dragon, each character’s Renown Score with the Cult of the Dragon increases by 1.

Tears Fall.name: Tears Fall
Tears Fall.description:
A Deity (Selûne) Adventure for

Level 5 Characters

Chase falling stars for Selûne.

Situation. Stars fall from the sky east of Waterdeep. Clergy in Waterdeep’s House of the Moon divine these meteors are rare fragments from the Tears of Selûne.

Hook. Ervina Tunnall (Medium Priest), a human priest from the House of the Moon, calls on the adventurers to recover the fallen Tears. She offers 500 GP for each Tear and gives the group a map of the Forlorn Hills, where the Tears fell.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two attacks, using [[/item .hRwqUlEyM9TjOmHy]] or [[/item .mmRadiantFlame00]] in any combination.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability:

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplLight00000]{Light}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplThaumaturg]{Thaumaturgy}

1/Day: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplSpiritGuar]{Spirit Guardians}

Divine Aid.name: Divine Aid
Divine Aid.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplBless00000]{Bless}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDispelMagi]{Dispel Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplHealingWor]{Healing Word}, or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplLesserRest]{Lesser Restoration}, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

Bless.name: Bless
Bless.description:
You bless up to three creatures within range. Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target adds 1d4 to the attack roll or save.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

Blessed.name: Blessed
Blessed.description: Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target adds 1d4 to the attack roll or save.

Dispel Magic.name: Dispel Magic
Dispel Magic.description:
Choose one creature, object, or magical effect within range. Any ongoing spell of level 3 or lower on the target ends. For each ongoing spell of level 4 or higher on the target, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability (DC 10 plus that spell's level). On a successful check, the spell ends.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You automatically end a spell on the target if the spell's level is equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you use.

Healing Word.name: Healing Word
Healing Word.description:
A creature of your choice that you can see within range regains Hit Points equal to 2d4 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The healing increases by 2d4 for each spell slot level above 1.

Lesser Restoration.name: Lesser Restoration
Lesser Restoration.description: You touch a creature and end one condition on it: &Reference[blinded], &Reference[deafened], &Reference[paralyzed], or &Reference[poisoned].

Light.name: Light
Light.description:
You touch one Large or smaller object that isn't being worn or carried by someone else. Until the spell ends, the object sheds Bright Light in a 20-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 20 feet. The light can be colored as you like.

Covering the object with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends if you cast it again.

Thaumaturgy.name: Thaumaturgy
Thaumaturgy.description:
You manifest a minor wonder within range. You create one of the effects below within range. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time.

Altered Eyes. You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

Booming Voice. Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute. For the duration, you have Advantage on [[/check ability=cha skill=itm]] checks.

Fire Play. You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.

Invisible Hand. You instantaneously cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.

Phantom Sound. You create an instantaneous sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as a rumble of thunder, the cry of a raven, or ominous whispers.

Tremors. You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.

Spiritual Weapon.name: Spiritual Weapon
Spiritual Weapon.description:
You create a floating, spectral force that resembles a weapon of your choice and lasts for the duration. The force appears within range in a space of your choice, and you can immediately make one melee spell attack against one creature within 5 feet of the force. On a hit, the target takes Force damage equal to 1d8 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

As a Bonus Action on your later turns, you can move the force up to 20 feet and repeat the attack against a creature within 5 feet of it.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for every slot level above 2.

Pack Tactics.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally doesn't have the Incapacitated condition.

Component Pouch.name: Component Pouch
Component Pouch.description: A Component Pouch is watertight and filled with compartments that hold all the free Material components of your spells.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]], +5 to hit with spell attacks):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMageHand00]{Mage Hand}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplPrestidigi]{Prestidigitation}

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDisguiseSe]{Disguise Self}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplIceKnife00]{Ice Knife}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMageArmor0]{Mage Armor} (included in AC), @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplThunderwav]{Thunderwave}

Mage Hand.name: Mage Hand
Mage Hand.description:
A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.

When you cast the spell, you can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial.

As a Magic action on your later turns, you can control the hand thus again. As part of that action, you can move the hand up to 30 feet.

The hand can’t attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

Prestidigitation.name: Prestidigitation
Prestidigitation.description:
You create a magical effect within range. Choose the effect from the options below. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time.

Sensory Effect. You create an instantaneous, harmless sensory effect, such as a shower of sparks, a puff of wind, faint musical notes, or an odd odor.

Fire Play. You instantaneously light or snuff out a candle, a torch, or a small campfire.

Clean or Soil. You instantaneously clean or soil an object no larger than 1 cubic foot.

Minor Sensation. You chill, warm, or flavor up to 1 cubic foot of nonliving material for 1 hour.

Magic Mark. You make a color, a small mark, or a symbol appear on an object or a surface for 1 hour.

Minor Creation. You create a nonmagical trinket or an illusory image that can fit in your hand. It lasts until the end of your next turn. A trinket can deal no damage and has no monetary worth.

Disguise Self.name: Disguise Self
Disguise Self.description:
You make yourself—including your clothing, armor, weapons, and other belongings on your person—look different until the spell ends. You can seem 1 foot shorter or taller and can appear heavier or lighter. You must adopt a form that has the same basic arrangement of limbs as you have. Otherwise, the extent of the illusion is up to you.

The changes wrought by this spell fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, if you use this spell to add a hat to your outfit, objects pass through the hat, and anyone who touches it would feel nothing.

To discern that you are disguised, a creature must take the Study action to inspect your appearance and succeed on an [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC.

Disguised.name: Disguised
Disguised.description: To discern that you are disguised, a creature must take the Study action to inspect your appearance and succeed on an [[/check ability=int skill=inv]] check against your spell save DC.

Ice Knife.name: Ice Knife
Ice Knife.description:
You create a shard of ice and fling it at one creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 1d10 Piercing damage. Hit or miss, the shard then explodes. The target and each creature within 5 feet of it must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 2d6 Cold damage.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The Cold damage increases by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 1.

materials.value: a drop of water or a piece of ice

Mage Armor.name: Mage Armor
Mage Armor.description: You touch a willing creature who isn’t wearing armor. Until the spell ends, the target’s base AC becomes 13 plus its Dexterity modifier. The spell ends early if the target dons armor.

Mage Armor.name: Mage Armor
Mage Armor.description: The target's base AC becomes 13 + its Dexterity modifier.

Thunderwave.name: Thunderwave
Thunderwave.description:
You unleash a wave of thunderous energy. Each creature in a 15-foot Cube originating from you makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 2d8 Thunder damage and is pushed 10 feet away from you. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only.

In addition, unsecured objects that are entirely within the Cube are pushed 10 feet away from you, and a thunderous boom is audible within 300 feet.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for each spell slot level above 1.

Mage Armor.name: Mage Armor
Mage Armor.description: The target's base AC becomes 13 + its Dexterity modifier.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three [[/item .mmRend0000000000]] attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of [[/item .mmSlowingBreath0]].

Acid Breath.name: Acid Breath
Acid Breath.description:
Dexterity Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=qNI6W02jCUQbPpYE]], each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=qNI6W02jCUQbPpYE]] in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=qNI6W02jCUQbPpYE]]-foot-long, [[lookup @target.template.width activity=qNI6W02jCUQbPpYE]]-foot-wide Line.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Success: [[lookup @damage.onSave capitalize activity=qNI6W02jCUQbPpYE]] damage.

Slowing Breath.name: Slowing Breath
Slowing Breath.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=teMMQNDDIE9XkPN3]], each creature in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=teMMQNDDIE9XkPN3]]-foot Cone.

Failure: The target can't take Reactions; its Speed is halved; and it can take either an action or a Bonus Action on its turn, not both. This effect lasts until the end of its next turn.

1/2 Speed | Action Restrictions.name: 1/2 Speed | Action Restrictions
1/2 Speed | Action Restrictions.description: The target can’t take Reactions; its Speed is halved; and it can take either an action or a Bonus Action on its turn, not both. This effect lasts until the end of its next turn.

Flyby.name: Flyby
Flyby.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] doesn't provoke an &Reference[OpportunityAttacks]{Opportunity Attack} when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability:

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDetectEvil]{Detect Evil and Good}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDetectMagi]{Detect Magic}

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplClairvoyan]{Clairvoyance}

Detect Evil and Good.name: Detect Evil and Good
Detect Evil and Good.description:
For the duration, you sense the location of any Aberration, Celestial, Elemental, Fey, Fiend, or Undead within 30 feet of yourself. You also sense whether the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplHallow0000]{Hallow} spell is active there and, if so, where.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell's school of magic.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Clairvoyance.name: Clairvoyance
Clairvoyance.description:
You create an Invisible sensor within range in a location familiar to you (a place you have visited or seen before) or in an obvious location that is unfamiliar to you (such as behind a door, around a corner, or in a grove of trees). The intangible, invulnerable sensor remains in place for the duration.

When you cast the spell, choose seeing or hearing. You can use the chosen sense through the sensor as if you were in its space. As a Bonus Action, you can switch between seeing and hearing.

A creature that sees the sensor (such as a creature benefiting from See Invisibility or &Reference[truesight]) sees a luminous orb about the size of your fist.

materials.value: a focus worth 100+ GP, either a jeweled horn for hearing or a glass eye for seeing

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two attacks, using [[/item .mmTreeClub000000]] or [[/item .mmTrashLob000000]] in any combination.

Tree Club.name: Tree Club
Tree Club.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Prone.name: Prone
Prone.description: If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Trash Lob.name: Trash Lob
Trash Lob.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]], and the target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn.

Poisoned.name: Poisoned
Poisoned.description: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn.

The force appears within range in a space of your choice, and you can immediately make one melee spell attack against one creature within 5 feet of the force. On a hit, the target takes Force damage equal to 1d8 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

Light.name: Light

Covering the object with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends if you cast it again.

Thaumaturgy.name: Thaumaturgy
Thaumaturgy.description:
You manifest a minor wonder within range. You create one of the effects below within range. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time.

Altered Eyes. You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

Booming Voice. Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute. For the duration, you have Advantage on [[/check ability=cha skill=itm]] checks.

Fire Play. You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.

Invisible Hand. You instantaneously cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.

Phantom Sound. You create an instantaneous sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as a rumble of thunder, the cry of a raven, or ominous whispers.

Tremors. You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.

Command.name: Command
Command.description:
You speak a one-word command to a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or follow the command on its next turn. Choose the command from these options:

Approach. The target moves toward you by the shortest and most direct route, ending its turn if it moves within 5 feet of you.

Drop. The target drops whatever it is holding and then ends its turn.

Flee. The target spends its turn moving away from you by the fastest available means.

Grovel. The target has the Prone condition and then ends its turn.

Halt. On its turn, the target doesn't move and takes no action or Bonus Action.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can affect one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

Hold Person.name: Hold Person
Hold Person.description:
Choose a Humanoid that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the &Reference[paralyzed apply=false] condition for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional Humanoid for each spell slot level above 2.

Paralyzed.name: Paralyzed
Paralyzed.description: At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the [[/save ability=wis]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Shield.name: Shield
Shield.description: You gain the Armor Class benefit of a Shield only if you have training with it.

Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three [[/item .vTZW4dSRGXTDWvRd]] attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of [[/item .mmShieldBash0000]].

Shield Bash.name: Shield Bash
Shield Bash.description:
Strength Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=eIErvLccVVCXiCSl]], one [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=eIErvLccVVCXiCSl]] within [[lookup @range.value activity=eIErvLccVVCXiCSl]] [[lookup @range.units activity=eIErvLccVVCXiCSl]]. that the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Prone.name: Prone
Prone.description: If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Parry.name: Parry
Parry.description: Trigger: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] is [[lookup @activation.condition activity=aLG3BRZL7P6OEjwd]]. Response: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] adds [[lookup @roll.formula activity=aLG3BRZL7P6OEjwd]] to its AC against that attack, possibly causing it to miss.

Use.name: Use
Use.condition: hit by a melee attack roll while holding a weapon

Warrior Veteran.name: Warrior Veteran

Parry.name: Parry
Parry.description: Trigger: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] is [[lookup @activation.condition activity=aLG3BRZL7P6OEjwd]]. Response: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] adds [[lookup @roll.formula activity=aLG3BRZL7P6OEjwd]] to its AC against that attack, possibly causing it to miss.

Use.name: Use
Use.condition: hit by a melee attack roll while holding a weapon

Incorporeal Movement.name: Incorporeal Movement
Incorporeal Movement.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can move through other creatures and objects as if they were &Reference[Difficult Terrain]. It takes [[/damage 1d10 average type=force]] damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

Sunlight Sensitivity.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
Sunlight Sensitivity.description: While in sunlight, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

Life Drain.name: Life Drain
Life Drain.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a creature, its Hit Point maximum decreases by an amount equal to the damage taken.

Create Specter.name: Create Specter
Create Specter.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] targets a Humanoid corpse within [[lookup @range.value activity=ypIQdXr13u7LATUP]] feet of itself that has been dead for no longer than 1 minute. The target's spirit rises as a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.aifSpecter000000]{Specter} in the space of its corpse or in the nearest unoccupied space. The specter is under the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s control. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can have no more than seven specters under its control at a time.

Incorporeal Movement.name: Incorporeal Movement

Life Drain.name: Life Drain
